loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, is 47 years old and married woman, lives in remote village of Prey Veng Province. Sok and her husband help each other in farming activities in order to put the family in better living conditions. She has been engaged in this field for 15 years with the average income is USD 5 per day. 

At the moment, Sok would like to order a set of solar home system to install at her home. This will allow her family members to gain access to clean energy, helping them with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. Due to the shortage of funds, Sok has requested a loan from Kiva to buy a set of solar home system. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. Sok awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home system

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 16 años y 2 hijas de 5 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de cd´s, mp3 y mp4.
El es buen padre, independiente y muy trabajador. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ceja’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. 
Agustin es de piel morena, cabello corto y baja estatura. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a l mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de cds, dvds; el viaja a la frontera con Perú a comprar su mercadería por mayor para comercializarlo en su puesto de venta, “inicié mi negocio con ayuda de un familiar, hace 8 años que trabajo independientemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de  mercadería por mayor. Su sueño es ser un proveedor mayorista, el desea comprar cd’s y dvd’s por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que trabaja independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Agustin solicita un préstamo para comprar cd’s y dvd’s por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustin is a 37 year old man, married with two boys ages 12 and 16 and two girls ages 5 and 7. His business is the sale of cd's, mp3 and mp4.

He is a good father, independent and hard working. He runs his business in the 'Ceja' zone, characterized by the informal commerce in all areas.

Agustin is dark skinned, has short hair and low height. He shares his live with his wife, who is in the same business, and with his children who study at school. They live in their own home, made of brick, that has all of the basic services.

His business is the sale of cds, dvds; he travels to the frontier with Peru to purchase his merchandise at wholesale prices in order to sell it at his point of sale. "I started my business with the help of a family member, I have been working independently for 8 years..." he comments. His business' advantage is that he can count on daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of wholesale merchandise.

His dream is to be a wholesale provider, and so for now he wants to purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 8 years that he has worked independently. These are the reasons that Agustin is requesting a loan to purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale in order to stock his business.

loans.use: purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale in order to stock his business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
To make a living, Eulalia engage herself in selling vegetables and bananas. According to her, her profit from the business serves to provide their family basic necessities. Eulalia has been seven years in running the business. Her wish is having good health, in order to have an energy in running the business while she can. 

Eulalia wanted to borrow a loan of P20,000 to buy bananas and vegetables to sell. She hopes to keep her business gainfully and further grow the business to raise her income.

loans.use: to buy banana and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe  owns and operate her rice farm for almost ten years.  She help her husband in providing the needs of her family.  She's working on it just to earn more profit. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays. She was able to sustain the business and she were able to pay her previous loan. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm and in order to provide and produce a good quality of rice in the market.

Ma. Fe's  plan for the future is to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family and for the educational plan of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her ricefield

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter resides with his family in the town of Jimnenez. He owns and operates a taxi business, which provides transportation services to their local community members. He has been working for two years and earns 10,000 PHP per month. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan used for his motorcycle. He is now taking a new loan to buy new tires and brake pads for his motorcycle for safe travel with his customers. 

Peter's plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and brake pads for his motorcycle

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 36 and lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells it in her locality. She has been doing this for many years, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to upcoming Eid festival, the demand for clothing will increase as well. 

This is the reason Nasreen showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming cloths for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell from her home.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida has been involving in business activities since 2014, when she started with her own working capital of $ 500.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is 46, but she is not too dependent on her husband. 

She has a kiosk in front of her house and she taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including aqua, slippers, biscuits, cooking oils, detergents, sardines,sugar, coffee, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. She said, she will improve her management with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: To buy aqua, slippers, biscuits, cooking oils, detergents, sardines,sugar, coffee, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, 51, is a windowed woman living in Kampong Cham province and have no children. She does rice as her main source of income for 30 years and she works for others for a fee to supplement her family’s income. She can save her daily income from her rice farm about 7USD per day. Her rice was destroyed by insects and this is her main challenge in earning income for supporting her family that she faces recently.

She leads a group of three to get a new loan with VisionFund and this is her fifth micro loan. She fully repaid her past loans completely and her family’s living has improved than before through those loans. Srey will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and spend on plowing fee to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes that her rice farm grows well than last year, so she can earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield so she can earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a small house without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. 

Hong requested a loan, which she will use to build a latrine. The latrine will help improve the health of her family. With support from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sengkea

texts.en:
Sengkea and wife (both in the picture standing in front of their house) work as farmers living with 3 children. Sengkea is a hard working farmer. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming. In addition to farming he runs a small feeding farm at his house and also performs traditional music during festivals or weddings to earn extra income for family. He puts all his effort into making his family's living conditions better.

However, his current power prevents him from achieving his goal. It is costly and time consuming. Sengkea has to go charge a battery every 2 or 3 days. When he found out about what solar energy could do for him, he decided to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for a good quality solar home system. He believes this solar home system can reduce his burden and help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Boeng Veng Village, Kraing Leav Commune,Rolea Pe E

loans.name: Taytacha Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jacinta ella es soltera y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos,  ella por medio de estos pequeños negocios  saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. 

El socio que estan pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the community bank TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI. This bank is located in the Anta district in the Cusco region.

Jacinta belongs to this group, she is single, 47 years old and has two children. Jacinta has a business raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. Through this small business, Jacinta is able to support herself and her family.

Jacinta is seeking a loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. The other group members have a variety of small businesses including raising animals and cattle, a corner store, and a farm. The photo of the group member in the bottom left was added on as he couldn't attend the meeting when the photo was taken because of work.

Jacinta wishes to thank those that have helped make her dreams come true and is committed to meeting her set repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is thankful that she previously accessed a loan which has helped sustain her direct selling of personal products and thus sent her children to school and meet the family's daily living expenses. 

Now that it is school time in the Philippines, there are more orders of her personal products, in this regard she needs funds in the amount of PHP 15000 to pay for products such as footwear, underwear, body powder, soap, cosmetics, and towels. She trusts that you will consider her request. It means a lot to her as her income helps fund her children's education.

Ma. Victoria dreams to put up a catering business and build an apartment to rent out for additional income to save and prepare for her children's College Education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products to sell.

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en: Nern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita lives in Atsabe, is married and she has 2 children. She is applying for a loan of $1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop in the center of the market, so many people come to buy there. Merita has been involved in business activities since 2012, when she started with her own working capital of $400.00.

She is earning a good income from her business so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more items in her kiosk including candle, biscuits, cooking oils, hand body, eggs, aqua, coffee, sardines, milks, sugar, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy candles, biscuits, cooking oils, hand body, eggs, aqua, coffee, sardines, milks, sugar, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 34, and lives with her son and husband in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a contractor for manufacturing, assembling hardware, supplying goods etc. Recently, he signed a contract for manufacturing light poles. He needs to purchase all spare parts for assembling light poles. He has spent his capital on his last contract and has not received payment yet.

Yasmeen has requested a Kiva loan so he can easily fulfill his duties and can generate income to provide for his whole family.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's contract to manufacture light poles.

loans.name: Yern's Group

texts.en: Yern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yern works as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Mrs. Lua is a hardworking woman, 63 years old. She is married and has three children.

She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family members and also for environmental protection.

Her family’s income is mainly from raising animals, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth lives with his wife and 2 children in Prey Sampao village. As a village chief, he needs to work on a lot of paperwork. Besides paperwork , Soth does farming with his wife to support family expenses. Currently, he has less burden because his 2 children have jobs to support family's financial situation.

Soth wants to have a reliable energy source to run his farm smoothly. However, his house is in remote area. He has to go charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. As a result, he is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a high quality home solar energy. He believes his family condition will be better and safer. He also can do his paperwork at night without disturbing anyone.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Sampao Village, Pro Snoeb Commune,Rolea Pe Ea

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny is 53 years old. She is a married mother with four children, who resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Vanny can make some income from making clay piggy banks and other souvenirs to sell for more than ten year, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. Her husband is 61 years old a rice farmer and making clay piggy banks as well. Two of her children work as factory workers. Together, they can make approximately USD 20 per day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy farmland to cultivate rice. With this loan, she will be able to help her have enough money to buy farmland to cultivate rice. In the future, she wants to buy more farmland and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 26-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Waleed is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Waleed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Waleed will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Waleed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Business Administration

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Mekar Asih group repaid their loan on time. The repayment not attended by all member, but represented by the boards. 2 members decide to resign because they must move to other places and follow their husband. Because their new place is far away from other members, they can’t join the group again. They will try to establish a new group in their new place. They said thank you to Lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support.

This period Ni Ketut had sold out all her pigs and earns a satisfactory profit. To support the needs of her family, she’s raising pigs at home. Her husband works as a farmer. She joined this group from the beginning when this group was established. She used her portion of loan to purchase superior piglets and feed for her 2 sows that she already owns. She hopes the sows will give birth soon and give her healthy piglets and she can sell them after 2 months. The group expects for a Vet that can visit them regularly.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador thanks KIVA and CCT for their tireless financial and moral support on his livelihood. The loans which he has received in the past certainly helped for a productive harvest of pineapples on his farm thus provide income to feed his children and send them to school. 

To sustain and grow his harvest, he is again seeking assistance in the amount of Php 15000 to pay for more farm seedlings, fertilizer and labor. Although his farm suffered when hit by typhoons, he still maintains his faith that  after the storm, the sun rises again and gives new life and renewed hope for better days. He hopes for a positive response. His farm means a lot to him as this his only means of livelihood.

Dominador aims to acquire a nearby property to expand his farm. He perseveres to see his children finish their studies to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and farm fertilizer to improve his pineapple farm

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
This group composed of three women was created during the first loan cycle of ID-Ghana, Teshie branch and it brings together members who all come from the same group and are united by good social and professional relations. They are into the sale of second hand clothing, local food joint grocery and medicine.

Patience, the featured borrower, is a married woman aged 39 and the mother of two children, all girls and are going to school. She works at selling second hand clothing, local food like fufu (pounded cooked cassava and plantain) and soup, banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) and stew, rice and stew to sell to her customers.

With her new loan portion of GHS 3,700 she is going to buy corn and cassava dough,rice and vegetable to prepare delicious local delicacies and sell to her customers. She has a good deal of experience since she has been in this business for a long time. The profit from her activity will allow her to cover the food and healthcare needs of her children and add to her savings account with ID-Ghana. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva and ninth with ID-Ghana

loans.use: to buy corn and cassava dough,rice and vegetable to prepare delicious local delicacies and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Charolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Charolyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetable to sell to her stall.

Charolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetable to sell to her stall

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana has build her home a few years ago, with her own working capital, and until now her house has been completed, and now she has plan to paint back and to buy goods in the house. but her money is not enough to buy the materials. So now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy paint, brush rollers, sofas, chairs, tables, cabinets, and other things. She is very hopeful with this money she could completed her materials for her house. And she is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her.

loans.use: to buy paint, brush rollers, sofas, chairs, tables, cabinets, and other things.

loans.name: Sophanith's Group

texts.en: Sophanith’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophanith makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is a retired person and she is a divorced woman she lives alone and she needs a loan to fix the walls of her house Natividad hopes you can help her she has some savings but that is not enough to complete the works by herself She hopes you can help her

loans.use: to fix the walls of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mazin

texts.en:
Mazin is a 22-years-old single young man from Gaza city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.
\Mazin is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.
Mazin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mazin will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Mazin appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Business Administration

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
The Dewi Fortuna group receives their loan. 1 member has left because she has been able to manage the business well and continue with her own money. Other members still need a new loan for their business, because their had a strong will to become a successful farmers and breeders. The loan will use to improve their business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and farming tools.

Jero Pudak, will use the loan to buy 3 superior piglets and farming tools. She has a plan to maintain the pigs for fattening and keep them in her garden. Her husband helps her business by finding traditional feed such as banana leaves everyday from his garden. With both of her businesses, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen.
One member is not on the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets and farming tools.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 26 years old, married with 3 school age kids. She runs and operates a bakery with her husband as the master baker. She's been doing well with her business that existed for 2 years. For that period, she had expanded her business and had increased its production. She employs her neighbors that delivers her breads to neighboring towns and municipalities. In need of additional working capital that she asks a loan from the cooperative to the amount of PHP 49,900.00. The said amount will be used to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, butter, cooking oil, leavening and others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, butter, cooking oil, leavening and others

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Age 32 and a resident of Kampong Cham province, Sros is married and blessed with five children. Nowadays, she needs to support four children and two of whom are still in school. She can earn an income to support her family’s living via vegetable selling and working as a labor worker to harvest for others to get more income. Her selling business did not grow well because of having fewer customers. She has been involved with her businesses for 14 years and she can save from her income about 9USD per day. 

For Sros, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan as well. Her family condition is getting better than before through her previous loan. Now, she leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more kinds of vegetables to attract more customers. She hopes that her business grows well with good income in order to upgrade her living standard and able to buy school materials for her children.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables to attract more customers, so that she can be able to increase her income to support her children's studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Wendy Maria

texts.en:
Wendy is a 35 year old single mother, she is an entrepeneur in the area of textiles. She has a small enterprise that make clothes, especially personalized t-shirts, at her place she has got four sewing machines and iron for serigraphy. With Kiva's and Kubo's help she has been able to develop her business, her last loan alowed her to hire an extra employer.
Her biggest accomplishments are raising her daughter and being an employment source for one person for more than a year so is her growing business.
Wendy's business have been growing more than she could imagine. She realised that she needs to make an extra investment in order to meet the client demands, so she is willing to buy yarn fabric.

She took a loan with Kiva and Kubo and she felt pretty comfortable with it, so now she is asking for a new one to keep her enterprise growing she is asking for 21,050 MXN, she is certain that this loan is all she needs to address her short term goals.

loans.use: to invest on rough materials for her t-shirt business.

loans.name: Ean's Group

texts.en:
Ean is a woman living in Kampong Cham province. The rice cropping and cassava growing are the main businesses of her to earn an income.  She is 33-year-old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young to attend school. The main challenge that she faces in this year, her rice and cassava crops were destroyed by insects. She can earn income from her both farms about 9 USD per day which she has been involved in for 15 years. 

In a group of five, she is the group leader and this is her first time with VisionFund. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her farmland in order to get good yield. She hopes that her rice and cassava farm can produce her more yields, so she can get more income to upgrade her living condition and support on her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland in order to increase her crop yield as well as her income to support on her children’s education cost.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 44 years old, she is married and she is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes and she also selling in the market. Delfina has been involving in business activities since 2012, when she started with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy it, it is cheap and unique. If compare to new clothes. So she is still happy to do her business. 

She will use this loan to buy more clothes such as trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirt, long-sleeved shirt, undershirt, turtleneck shirt and other clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirt, long-sleeved shirt, undershirt, turtleneck shirt and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a Mexican farmer who lives from raising and selling hogs. She also owns sheep and cultivates corn on a plot of land close to her house. She decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to take advantage of her animals' manure and transform it into biogas and biofertilizer. She looks forward to displacing the costly and unsustainable LP gas and chemical fertilizer she used to buy, while improving the yield of her field in a natural way and saving money. With her savings, she plans to purchase additional sheep to increase her sheep her to 100 animals. This will allow her to diversify her sources of income, while operating her farm in a cost-effective and sustainable manner
This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: El Diamante De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the El Diamante De Urubamba communal bank. The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

Silvia, age 43, is married and has four children. She works in her business of selling vegetables. She also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She has a stand at the market where she sells the vegetables. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has been in this business for seven years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the vegetables.

She is requesting the loan to buy onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The members who photos are attached to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting. They requested permission to do so because of work.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of selling animals, selling clothes, a grocery store business, and selling food.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means. She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, shoe polish, glue, plates and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, glue, shoe polish and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She also does dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, glue, shoe polish and other items

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Cisencio is grateful that he has on numerous times been granted and have fully paid his loans on time. It definitely helped fund maintenance of his jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service thus continuous income to meet his family's needs.

Once again he is in need of funds in the amount of 30000 PHP to pay for the annual registration, car accessories,fuel and maintenance f his jeepney public service and his van for employees and school service. A proper and regular maintenance of his vehicles is necessary to ensure an efficient and safe trips. He is thanking God for your faithful support on his livelihood.

Crisencio's simple dream is to maintain his business and send his three children to College.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the accessories and maintenance of his jeepney and van for transport service.

loans.name: Manvela

texts.en:
Manvela is 27 years old and lives with her brother in Tsalenjikha district. Manvela is unemployed at the moment and the family lives in poverty. 

Manvela decided to open a food market and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase food products and will open a small food market near her house. She will run her newly opened market and will generate income. Manvela is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has built her house a few years ago, and her house has been completed. And she has plan to repair her house like plaster, paint back and other, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for his house to be repaired. So she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete the materials.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more material such as sand, cement, hand brush, brush roller and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan she can be repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, hand brush, brush roller and other materials to use.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 43 year-old married father of two children who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher and his wife is housewife.  It can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of $ 1500 will allow him to help his daughter graduate from university. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies. 

In the future, Alberto hopes that his children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition, textbooks and university supplies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, because she has plans to renovate her house. Since it's her first home, it is built with woven fiber and now she wants to make better walls. Since she doesn't have enough money to buy the materials to build her house, Francisca will use the loan to buy more materials such as stone, sand, wood, cement, iron, nails, bricks, etc. She is very happy with the loan offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin because she can build her house.

loans.use: To buy to buy stone, sand, wood, cement, iron, nails, bricks and other materials to build her house.

loans.name: Saram

texts.en: A widowed mother of two children, Saram is 58 years old living in Kandal province. To make income for her family, she does rice farming and spend her rest time to works for others for a fee. She has been involved in her business for 36 years and she can save from her daily income about 5USD each day. Her rice was destroyed by insects, so it causes her to earn a very low income. This is the first time for Saram with VisionFund. She will spend her portion of loan to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time. She wishes that she can save time to go to work regularly and properly.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work regularly and properly.

loans.name: Chea Group

texts.en:
Chea is a 61-year-old married rice farmer with six children, and he resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Three of his children are rice farmers and factory workers and other three children attend school. Chea is pictured 1st from the right and cultivated rice since 1974. His wife is a 57-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can earn approximately 9.5 USD per day.

Chea, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members, and he will use his portion to buy fertilizer for farming. With this loan, he will be able to help him to increase his family income. In the future, Chea wants to buy more cows and piglets to fatten to earn additional income and support his children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco ILLARY III,la socia sigue dedicándose a  su negocio de compra y venta de carteras, pantalones, blusas y chompas, entre otros para todos sus clientes que le soliciten, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar carteras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ysabel belongs to the "Illary III" communal bank.  She is continuing with her business buying and selling purses, pants, blouses, sweaters, and other items to the customers who demand these goods.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who provides for her family with this business.

Ysabel is requesting a loan to buy purses and other items.  She is grateful for the loan being provided, and promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy purses and other items to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia sigue vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar menestras, aceite, golosinas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the "Illary III" communal bank.  She is continuing with her grocery store business.  She continues to sell consumer staples such as rice, sugar, and other items to the customers who request them.  She wants to continue to work in this way so that she can support her family.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy dried beans, cooking oil, snacks, and other items.  She is grateful to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy dried beans, cooking oil, snacks, and other items

loans.name: Mirian Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Mirian Matilde, la socia continua  dedicándose a   su negocio de venta de velas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,  la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de velas de colores entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Mirian Matilde. She continues with her business of selling candles. She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

She is a responsible person. She has been in her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy colored candles, among others.

loans.use: to buy colored candles, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, and cell phone recharge cards to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 40 years old, a widow and has one child to provide for She's living with her child and in order to support their daily needs she engaged in a piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them in the market.

She aims to have greater income for the preparation of the educational needs of her child. She need a financial assistance from GDMPC, Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy more piglets to raise, so that she can be able to supply plenty of pigs and produce good quality of meat to supply the needs of her customers

Chona's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Sokny is a local resident living in Battambang province and a mother of a young kid. To support her living condition, she works making snacks. Moreover, she also works as a laborer to prepare houses to get more income. She has been involved in her jobs for ages and she can save from her income about 5 USD per day. Sometimes, she did not get any work to do, so she did not get any income for her family.

This is fourth cycle for Sokny with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans completely. Her family’s living is better than before and she can get a decent income from both works. In a group of three members, she is the group leader and she will use her loan portion to purchase color paint to paint on the wall for supporting her works. She hopes that she can get more income from her works to improve on her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more color paint to paint on the walls for her work in construction

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a happy woman, whose happiness has been triggered by the sucess of her business. Her previous loan of ugx5,000,000 was funded by Kiva funders. Her sales increased and so were his profits. Lillian appreciates the services that the Kiva lenders have accorded her.
She will use this loan to buy stock of pampers,toiletries and other items to meet the demand of her customers and also increase her sales.
She appreciates the work done by the Kiva lenders and is committed to pay well in order to maintain the good relationship with them.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her retail business.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en: Sreypao works as a farmer living with 5 children in Thmey Village. Sreypao does farming and sells grocery in her house. Three of Sreypao's children have started working as factory worker to earn fix income for family. Working hard over 20 years for family, she wants to have a comfortable life. Sreypao has difficulty in using battery for home energy. She needs to recharge battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, she decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home energy. She believes solar home energy can enhance her living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Thmey Village, Kraing Leav Commune, Rolea Pe Ear D

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is the age of 26, her husband is jobless nowadays and it is very difficult for her to manage her household expenses at zero earnings. She wants to provide a source of income to her husband. There are many people driving rickshaws in the society; she considers it an easy way to adopt this occupation for her husband. This is the reason she wants to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's occupation.

Sumera requested a loan for her husband so he can buy an auto rickshaw and can generate reasonable income for his family. She is very happy and relaxed after receiving this loan and thanks to Kiva, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to enable her husband in purchasing auto rickshaw so he can be self employed.

loans.name: Seeman

texts.en:
Seeman is 49 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works hard to generate income for the family. He owns a recycled material shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and papers. He purchases scrap goods from the common people and sells to the recycling factories. Due to household expenses, he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods and, therefore, does not have scrap to sell for generating an income.

Seeman requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband, which he will use to buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and earn some savings to meet unexpected needs.

loans.use: to purchase scrap goods for her husband's recycled material shop.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 22-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His Mother is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Anwar is a student in the university where he studies Physical Education. He Anwar to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Anwar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Anwar will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Anwar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Physical Education

loans.name: Ayoub

texts.en:
Ayoub is a 22-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His Father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Ayoub is a student in the university where he studies Islamic Studies. He Ayoub to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Ayoub took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Ayoub will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Ayoub appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university education in Islamic Studies

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III.
 La socia Julia  Beatriz continúa dedicándose al negocio de turismo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua operando diferentes tipos de rutas como camino inca entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos y entradas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Illary III communal bank. Julia Beatriz continues devoting herself to the tourism business. She is a responsible and hard-working person.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

The member continues operating different types of routes like the Inca trail, among others. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy tickets and passes.

loans.use: to buy tickets and passes.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus fund their daily sustenance. She thanks everyone for supporting her livelihood.

Once again she trusts that she can avail of a 50000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past two years which sustained her family's basic needs. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting her receivables, she maintains her pleasant disposition and believes that things will get better. 

Perina's precious dream is for her store to continue to grow to enable her to send her children to College. Education is her hope for her children to achieve a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yolie

texts.en: Yolie is 34 years old, married and had three children. Her husband is a high school teacher.  In order to gain income and supplement her spouse salary, she opened-up a variety store selling grocery items and other household goods. She wanted to offer more merchandise to earn more income in return. She is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy canned goods, softdrinks and school supplies to sell.  Yolie hopes to improve her sales and profits and help attain business expansion and achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, softdrinks and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, she is married and she is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 1.500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling clothes. Maria has been involving in business activities since 2007, when she started with her own working capital of $500.00. She is earning a good income from selling her business because she is selling in center of the market, so many people like to buy from her. So she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as trousers, shorts, shirts women, men shirts, long sleeve shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, shirts women, men shirts, long sleeve shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Guiomar

texts.en:
Guiomar has built her house a few years ago, and now her house needs to be completed. But the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed with the materials required. 

So she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. And she is taking this loan because she wants to buy the material such as cement, sand, ceramic, cement tiles, ropes, and other materials. She is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her,  because with this loan she can be repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, ceramic, cement tiles, ropes, and other materials.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including slippers, detergents, milks, sardines, soaps, hand body, hair oils, candies, noodles,aqua, cooking oils, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $ 500.00. 

She wants to open a big store in the future. She is selling in center of the market, so she is taking this loan because she wants to add more items according to what people like.

loans.use: to buy slippers, detergents, milks, sardines, soaps, hand body, hair oils, candies, noodles,aqua, cooking oils, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sokha is 37 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. She has been involved in her rice farming for 19 years and this is her main business that she can get income to support her living condition. Moreover, she works for others for a fee as additional income source. Her rice did not produce her good yield and it is her main challenge. She can save her income about 10 USD per day.

For Sokha, this is her seventh cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans. Her previous loans helped to expand on her rice farm. Now, she leads a group of three members to seek for new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to produce higher yield than before. She hopes that she can earn more income from her farming to upgrade her family’s living and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce higher yield so that she can earn more income to upgrade her family’s living and support her children’s education.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phanit's Group

texts.en: Phanit’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phanit makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Inés pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia continua  dedicándose a la venta de comida, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona  responsable ,a la vez  la socia sigue elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the communal bank ILLARY III. She continues working in food sales. She is grateful for the loan she received and promises to make her payments.

This member has been in this business for awhile, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to it each day. She is a responsible person.

She makes different types of meals for the clients she serves, and would like to be able to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy oil and rice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy oil and rice, among other things.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia Emiliana pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, la socia SIGUE dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma  que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO communal bank. She continues to make a living selling stable goods.

She is a responsible and hardworking person. She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her business each day.

She continues selling rice, sugar and other good for her clients. In this way, she is creating a better life for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy sugar and milk, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia owns a stall in their local public market that primarily sells dried fish. She has great number of local costumers because of her competitive price and good salesmanship. Inorder to continuously respond to the increasing demands of her products, she loan from Paglaum MPC to buy additional stocks of dried fish. She believes having enough inventory of goods will keep her costumers patronizing her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Mrs. Tu is 51 years old,  lives in her own house with her husband. She has had a business of selling meat patties for 15 years. She has a good customer base, so she sells her food at a good price. With her earnings she covers some of her living costs. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy more meat, oil, spices, among other ingredients. This way she will be able to continue with her work to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more meat, oil, spices, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Vannay

texts.en:
Vannay works as a technician of a company living in Choung Preal Village. After becoming independent, Vannay earns money to support elder parents. He wants his parents to live in comfortable condition. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery, his parents have to stay in pitch black condition until morning.

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband owns a wigs shop in the main market. His practice is to buy wigs from a wholesaler and sell it to the customers from his shop. He has lot of customers who like to buy wigs from him. Sometimes he purchases wigs from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his wigs to their friends and relative which becomes good advertising.

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more wigs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. She hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter.
She dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more wigs for her husband's wigs selling shop.

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong, a woman living in Battambang province, is 41 years old and a mother of one kid. Nowadays, she sells all kind of vegetables and works as a labor to earn income for her family’s living for 5 years. She can earn income about 6 USD per day from her business. The customers that bought her vegetables is less than before, this is her main challenge in her business. \

For Sokong, this is her ninth micro loan with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loans. With the previous loans, her selling business has improved than before and she can get a decent income to support her living condition to get better. She leads a group of three members to seeking a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader of group, she will spend her loan portion to buy more vegetables to expand her selling to earn more income for her family. She hopes that her family’s business larger than before and earns her good income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to support her vegetables selling to get more income for her family condition.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a single mother on her late 20s, she has a young kid who entirely relays on her. She earn a living by working for a small enterprise, she also makes an extra income by selling shoes and cosmetics by catalog.

Her biggest accomplishment is raising and providing for her kid on her own. She dreams that one day she will be able to buy a house.
Today she is looking to maximize her profit on the selling business by taking advantage from the season. She wants to be able to meet with her client's demand, as she sells the shoes and cosmetics between her family, coworkers and friends. She thinks that the upcoming season is a great time to sell her products, so she is willing to create a small stock, in order to achieve this goal,

Yolanda is looking for a 26,250.00 MXN loan, and with this she will buy enough cosmetics and shoes to cover all the seasonal demands.

loans.use: to stock her shoe mechandise for the upcoming season

loans.name: Monikanika

texts.en:
Monikanika is 20 years old and a single accountant who resides in the Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She has been working as an employee since 2014, earning around $5.5 per day.

Monikanika is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Accounting at the university in the city. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the third year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree.

After graduation, Monikanika wants to have a better job with a decent salary, therefore she will be able to have enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees in Accountancy for the third year.

loans.name: Sroy's Group

texts.en:
Sroy is a widow mother with four children, 34 years old living in Kampong Cham province. She does rice to earn income to support on her family’s living. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to get additional income. She has been involved in her farming for 16 years. Because of drought, her rice did not grow well and this is her main challenge. 
This is second micro loan for Sroy with VisionFund and she wisely paid back her past loan. Her family’s living has improved gradually through the past loan. As the group leader of this new loan, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to input on her rice farm in order to increase the crop yield. She hopes that she can get more income from her farming and able to buy a decent motorbike to go to work and also support on her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to input on her rice farm in order to increase the crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Channel Group

texts.en:
PILI is in her early 40s and is married with four children in school. She has been raising and selling chicken for three years now. She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be PILI's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding the chicken shed.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group Channel which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild his war-damaged old house.

loans.name: Skender

texts.en:
Skender is returning and loyal customer, who has had two previous loans used for his wood cutting business. His first loan allowed him to purchase new tools for his tractor to transport wood from the forest to his home and the second loan allowed him to purchase a piece of land on the mountain to cut wood. He has been satisfied with the loan process and his results each time, and has been able to continue to provide for his family thanks to the lenders.

For the third time, Skender is requesting a loan to for his wood cutting business. He would like to purchase a truck to deliver the wood to his customers. Skender is very grateful to the lenders for their continued support to help him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to deliver the wood to his customers

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 49-year-old, married woman living with her husband and three kids in Chouf, Lebanon. She is an ambitious woman and does the best she can to support her family financially, which is why she owns a shop in which she sells cleaning products for home usage. She is married to a retired military officer, who is now working as a taxi driver to earn some income. Her eldest son is an employee and also helps his parents with house expenses. Wafaa is asking for a 1,029,765 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy new products and satisfy the need of her clients and the increasing demand of new customers. In fact, she has a very good reputation in the area and is known for being hardworking and dedicated to her shop.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for her shop

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with her family. She is the mother of seven children; one of them goes to school. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading within his hometown. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells bull calves to the butchers and keeps heifer for producing milk in future. He has to feed the calves till one or two years until grown up and healthy, which is very lengthy and expensive procedure.
Few days ago, his one healthy cow has died due to disease; he has been increasing the cattle through breeding from that cow but now his breeding procedure and milk production has been affected badly.

He wants to buy a cow to keep constant the breeding procedure and milk production but he already invested his all savings into his current cattle farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a cow to continue his business. She is agreed with ours repayment schedule and signed happily all the necessary documents, including client waiver.
Therefore Parveen has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy a healthy cow with the contribution of savings.
The fatal diseases are the major challenge for him. With the profit amount her husband will buy fodder for cattle and cure against diseases. She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a healthy cow for her husband's breeding and milk production business.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is a 54 year old women from the little Georgian village Flavismani. With her husband and her three children they grow fruits and vegetables on her own land. 

They want to use the money from the loan for protecting their land by building up a fence. To increase their output of fruits and vegetables she also spends some money for new bee hives.

loans.use: Luiza wants to buy bee hives and build a fence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to give his family better life condition by having light in their house after the sunset.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is 42-year-old man from Jabalia City, married and father to three sons and a one little daughter.
Saleem was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest conflict on Gaza his house was destroyed completely, then he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Saleem took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Saleem to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.
Saleem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his war-damaged old house.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa, who is in her late 30's, is widowed with two children, who are still in school. She has been running a beauty salon and tailoring business for seven years now.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Arafa’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her salon products and to start the tailoring business. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, making some modification on her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements and to buy nice materials to make good suits and dresses. She dreams of being an international designer. Arafa will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan term.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements and to buy nice materials to make good suits and dresses.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is 26-year-old woman from Dier Al-Balah City and mother to three sons.
Sawsan was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza her house was destroyed completely. Then she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.
Recently Sawsan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Sawsan to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.
Sawsan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her war-damaged old house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia continua con su negocio de bar y picantería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  arroz, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the communal bank Illary III. She continues to run her bar and picantería (a type of restaurant serving traditional foods). She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful for her loan and promises to make all of her payments. She has been running her business for a long time, and it brings her great personal satisfaction because it allows her to support her family.

Yolanda is requesting this loan to buy rice and beans, among other things.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans, among other things.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en: Morena has been running a general store. For many years, she had sustained the business, and with her generated income, she successfully was able to pay her previous loan used for the business. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en: Dilma is 43 years old; she's married and has three children to provide. Dilma started to engaged in selling dried fish ten years ago. She want to increase her inventory stock of her dried fish due to her customers demand. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell it in the market.  This will allow her to keep her business open in order to continue serving more variety of dried fish to satisfy her customers' tastes and needs. This loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Dilma. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fried fish to sell

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be successful. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes,onions other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans qui habite à Baguida. Ayant huit enfants à charge, Ayawa est une marchande du riz non prépéré et du sucre en détail. Ayawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des bols de riz et du sucre, Ayawa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a married, 45-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. Ayawa has eight children that she cares for.

She sells uncooked rice and sugar in retail sales. Ayawa purchases supplies four times a month at the market and resells them from her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Ayawa needs this loan in order to cover the cost of ordering her supply of bowls of rice and sugar.

She intends to make a good profit in order to help meet her family's needs and better cover her children's school fees for the upcoming start of the school year.

loans.use: to buy 20 bowls of rice and 22 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 49 years old and has six children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, such as turbines and radiators. He has been operating this business for many years and up until recently his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected.

Parveen's son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or to buy cutting tools. She requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her son will use to buy the lathe machine's spare parts and cutting tools to work with the lathe machine. Parveen hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a lathe machine's spare parts and cutting tools for her son's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Vath's Group

texts.en:
Vath is 63 years old and married. She has seven children, three of whom are dependent on her. She lives in Prey Veng province where she makes a living through growing dry- and rainy-season rice. She has been involved in her farming business for more than forty years. She earns around USD13 per day and can save about USD7 per day after deducting daily expenses. The main obstacle to her farming business is the limited rainfall which causes her crop to produce lower outputs. 
Vath forms a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund, which will be her second time. Past loan was used wisely and it had good impact to her family’s living. In fact, the family living condition has been improving and she can provide sufficient healthy food to her family members. Vath, the group leader, will use her loan to buy rice seeds and rent walking tractor to prepare the farmland. She hopes that her crop can return her high yields so that she can upgrade the standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and rent walking tractor to prepare the farmland.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Kutesa Group

texts.en:
Kutesa group is in its third loan cycle of the Women's Committee programme, which is where all the women work to be successful. They are taking part in the scheme to eliminate poverty, where the members are improving their quality of life to get above the poverty line.

One of the members of this group is Saidat, who sells local foods that she makes herself. The food she makes is very good and this is why she is doing so well and has a lot of customers. She says that with her humble source of income she has the means to be able to give her family a dignified life.
