She is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients to be able to continue selling her food, such as: vegetables, meat, rice, corn flour chicken and other goods. Through this she will be able to keep delighting her customers with the delicacies that she makes.
She and the group members appreciate the services of the kiva lenders.

loans.use: to boost her food sales.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father for four kids; two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Mahmoud's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 40-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father for three kids; two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Mahmoud's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Nget, 43 years old father of four school children, lives in a rural area of Prey Kabbas District, Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near his house for more than twenty years. In total, he can make USD 2 per day from his farming.

Nget is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Through this loan, he hopes that it will help him to promote his healthy and living condition. He thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, gaseosas, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Maruja belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank. The member continues with her grocery store business. She is a responsible and dedicated person. She continues to sell her merchandise to her customers. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her scheduled payments. She would like to continue working in order to support her family.

The member request the loan to buy milk, soda water and sugar among others.

loans.use: to buy milk, soda water and sugar among others.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old. She is single and has one child. Her business is operating a pharmacy and a mobile money transfer business. She has been in the business for six years. She earns a monthly income of twenty six thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase human drugs and increase mobile money transfer float.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her child and also increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to grow to a wholesale supplier of human drugs and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase human drugs and increase mobile money transfer float.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sreymao is a 36-year-old married mother of two dependent children. Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and they manage to save about 25,000KHR each day for future needs.

Sreymao’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. The first loan has helped Sreymao better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sreymao wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are loyal. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to add M-pesa float. She will use the anticipated profits to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to increase the power generated at his house, and with this, have more light hours after sunset.

loans.name: Ardita

texts.en:
Ardita is 27 years old and a married mother of three; 8 are the oldest and 2 is the youngest and they live in the northern part of the country. She needs this loan to pay for an immediate scheduled surgery of her mother-in-law.

Ardita is in the photograph with her in-laws, Dila and Pal and her youngest child. They live under the same roof as usually rural families do and their incomes are as follows: retirement pension of father-in-law is $108/month and $75/month mother-in-law and an employment income of her husband in a monthly amount of $242.

Sometimes Pal who is talented at making the local musical instrument made of poplar wood branches called ‘çiftelia’ makes them based on orders from different gift shops and he receives little cash from it as well as much as $50/per item.

loans.use: to pay for a immediate scheduled surgery of her mother-in-law

loans.name: Florim

texts.en:
Florim is 29 years old father of two. He works as a hairdresser, gained experience by working for a long time in various places. Now he is the owner of his own salon and is very proud of his business.

Until now he has worked only for men and now is planning to work also for female clients. Florim is in need for a loan in order to to purchase the materials needed by adding tools and other inventory for female customer. He is planning to employee his wife in his salon, as she has taken some hair dressing courses.

Florim and his wife are very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase materials and adding tools for his hairdressing salon and other inventory for female customers.

loans.name: Pialo

texts.fr: Pialo est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans qui habite à Agoè. Mère de trois enfants, Pialo est une marchande de fournitures scolaire et divers qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des fournitures scolaire et divers, Pialo nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son mari à couvrir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Pialo is a married, 45-year-old woman who lives in Agoè. She has three children. Pialo sells school supplies and miscellaneous goods. She purchases supplies at the market three times a month and resells them from the front of her home in order to make an income.

Pialo needs this loan so that she can order a stock of school supplies and sundry goods. She hopes to make a good profit margin in order to help her husband cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of notebooks, 2 piles of onions, and 10 brooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light his house and with this give the chance to his children to do homework after the sunset.

loans.name: Pheat

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Prey Chhor district of Battambang province, Pheat is aged 37 years and married. She has five dependent children; three are in school while another two are too young for school. To support the big family, she and her husband have been farming rice and cassava for 19 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 
Pheat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and her children’s education.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current agribusiness to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland in order to receive good crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yi's Group

texts.en:
Yi is 36 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province. She has four dependent children to take care of, two of whom are in school while the other two are too young for school. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for 16 years. To earn more income, her husband also works as a paid worker. They can earn approximately 12US$ per day and save about 6US$ each day for future needs.

This is the second micro loan for Yi’s group with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Yi will use her portion to buy seed and fertilizers to support her rice farm. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers to support her rice farm.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father for four kids; two sons and two daughters. He works as a paint worker in a general service office, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Mahmoud's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thanking KIVA and its supporters from the bottom of her heart for a number of loans received in the past which certainly helped sustain her store and thus covered her family's needs. 

Once again she is seeking assistance in the amount of 30000 PHP loan to refill her store with fresh and packaged food items like fish, chicken, vegetables, canned goods, instant noodles, oil, eggs and beverages which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past five years which sustained her family's basic needs and send her children to school. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting her receivables, she is grateful that God somehow provides for their immediate needs.

Alma's simple dream is for her store to become a big grocery store someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables and packaged grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rezell

texts.en:
Rezell is a 33 years old business woman, a wife of Eustaguio from Manila, Philippines. She’s managing her own sari-sari store business which she started year 2010. Basically, the “sari-sari” is a Tagalog word which means “variety of choices”. Rezell dreams to have her store expanded, providing wide array of product choices. She’s also selling viands for lunch and dinner. Rezell is continually formulating on marketing strategies for the business’ success since this really helped her sustain their daily expenses and other basic needs.

Rezell wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for supporting new entrepreneurs like her. She is earning for about Php 12 000 each month which is just enough for their monthly expenses. Rezell really wanted to have complete products to sell which will increase her daily sales. With this, she applied for a Php 12,000 loan that she’ll use to buy variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products to add to her variety store and supporting capital for buying daily ingredients for her food stall business.

Rezell has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy variety of grocery items to add for her variety store and supporting capital for buying daily ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Originally of the Kampong Cham province, Lean is 36 years old and married mother of two young children. The sources of her income to support her family’s living are from rice cropping on one hectare area of farmland and working as a labor worker. She has involved in her farming for 18 years and she earns daily income about 6.5USD per day. The insects have destroyed her rice crop, so her rice did not grow well this year and causes her to have not enough working capital to do farming again for this season.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan and the previous loan has helped her to buy more plots of farmland. She will manage her entire new loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee in order to get higher yield than last year. She hopes that her rice farming can earn her more income to upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to get higher yield as well as her income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Salout's Group

texts.en:
Age of 46 and a resident from Siem Reap province, Salout is a mother blessed with five children. Nowadays, she needs to support on three children and one of whom is in school. To earn a living, she grows rice and vegetables as the main sources of income which she has been with for 28 years. Her rice did not grow well because it has destroyed by floods. Salout can save from her daily income about 4USD per day for her family’s daily need.

In a group of two, she is the group leader. For Salout, this is her first Kiva loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy wood to renovate her old house. She hopes that she can have a proper house to stay and provide her family’s members more comfortable and safe.

loans.use: to buy wood to renovate her old house so that she can have a proper house to live in and protect her children in safety.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hidelia

texts.en:
Hidelia lives in Dili B and she is a business woman. She has been involving in business activities since 2009 with her own working capital and she make her best on it. She has very high interest in doing business. She has an small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will used this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including aqua, noodles, glue, chips, sugar, biscuits and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy aqua, noodles, glue, chips, sugar, biscuits and other things to sell.

loans.name: Niyameddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin is 39 years old. He lives in Mahmudlu village of the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has two children. One of the children study in high school and the other studies music. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from native land Fuzuli city.

Niyamaddin has a few cows and he has been in the animal breeding business for 9 years. He has applied to Komak company. Now he needs a loan in amount of 1500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy hay and straw for his animals for the coming winter. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw for his animals for the coming winter

loans.name: Eldeniz

texts.en: Eldeniz was born in Fuzuli city in 1977. He is married and has two children who are 13 and 15 years old and study in high school. Eldeniz’s wife is a housewife. Eldeniz is an IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. He is a taxi driver. Eldeniz is a hard-working man and loves his job. Now he needs a loan in the amount of 1900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy new tires for his taxi. Eldeniz is thankful to Kiva and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay labor farm for her cocoland

loans.name: Riorita

texts.en: Riorita finds better ways of living by selling her vegetables in the market. She plants vegetables in her backyard and it helps a lot in sustaining the daily needs of her family. Her previous loan was successfully repaid. She was able to go to the neighboring villages to promote and sell her vegetables. Recently, she took a new loan primarily to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable in order to produce and deliver more vegetables in the market. In the future, Riorita wants to improve her business as well as the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Darjo

texts.en:
Darjo is a single man in his early 20s and since he was 17 he started operating an auto shop as seen in the picture. Together with his father, they generate approximate daily gross earnings of $40 and some other little money from the body parts they sell out of the same shop.

Darjo lives with his parents and 16-year-old sister in the city of Elbasan. He is requesting this loan to buy tools and auto replacement parts.

Darjo’s plans are that he expands the business and employs a younger man instead of having his father working all day, while he’s been on medication from some previous organ failure.

loans.use: to buy tools and replacement parts for the auto shop he's been operating for the past three years

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
A 37-year-old farmer from Kratie province, Sreymom is a single mother of two children. She is growing cassava for the main income and is working for others for a fee for additional income. She has been involved in her farming business for years. Her businesses earn her about USD8 per day. Limited rainfall and overgrown with weeds in farmland are the obstacles to her cassava farming business.

Sreymom has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already. This time, she is leading a five-member group to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic weedicide to remove weeds and keep some for using when harvesting season comes. She dreams to get more yields and expand her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic weedicide to remove weeds and keep some for using when harvesting season comes.

loans.name: Oy

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Oy is 39 years old. She is a mother of eight children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young to get in school. For her family, she grows rice on one hectare area of farmland for 21 years. Moreover, she works as a labor for others to get more income for her family’s living. Her rice has grown not well because it was destroyed by insects.

For Oy, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan completely. She can get a decent motorbike for her family via her past loan. She will use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer and seed to input her rice farmland to increase her crop yield. She hopes that her rice grow well and earn her with good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to input her rice farmland in order to increase her crop yield as well as her income to support her children's studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nhen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Ou Raing Ov district of Tbaung Khmum province, Nhen is aged 47 years and married. She has five dependent children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 28 years and they supplement family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 25,000KHR per day and manages them to save about 12,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is the first micro loan for Nhen with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Ask the leader, Nhen will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use some of it to spend on building a decent latrine for using in her family. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Ou Raing Ov District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of Prey Veng province’s Sithor Kandal district, La is 45 years old and married with two dependent children; one is in school while another one is too young for school. To make a living and support her family, La and her husband have been farming rice and fishing as their primary businesses for 25 years. The current businesses earn her about 10 USD per day to support her family’s needs. Drought has been the main challenge for her business.

This is the second microloan for La with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan has helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, La will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use some portion of it to pay for labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Modi

texts.fr: Veuve de 66 ans, Modi est une femme qui vit à Baguida avec ses trois enfants à charge. Modi est une artisane qui tisse les nattes à domicile et les revendent au marché. Pour commander le nécessaire pour la fabrication, Modi se rend une fois par mois au marché.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera de cette activité, Modi va pouvoir réaliser son objectif et contribuer à l’avancement de la famille.
texts.en:
Modi is sixty-six years old, a widow and responsible for three children. She lives in Baguida and makes floor mats at home. She sells her mats at the market. Once a month Modi goes to the market to buy her raw materials.

Modi will use her earnings to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 16 lots of raw materials to make mats.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has been involved in opening a furniture shop since 2009. She started her business with her own working capital. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and cows. Angelina is married and her husband is a carpentry.

Angelina has a furniture shop in her house. So she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her capital, because she wants to buy additional materials, including wooden beams, wooden boards, wood glue, drilling machines, cutting machines and other materials to use. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, wooden boards, wood glue, drilling machines, cutting machines and other materials to use.

loans.name: Johnpaul's Group

texts.en: JohnPaul is a father of 4 and a very responsible man. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment. As a mill machine operator, life is not very easy for him considering the low monthly take-home pay. One of his yearly challenges is paying his children's school fees and caring for his aged parents, but with the support of his wife, a petty trader, they have been able to pay the school fees in two installments while supporting their family. Early this year he joined Nke Anyi Cooperative to enable him access to funds to process and store palm oil this season. He hopes that his profit from this loan will make life much easier, especially paying his rent and his children’s' school fees. He is very grateful to all who read through and support this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 27 años de edad, separada, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 9 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrigerio.
Ella es buena madre, amigable y muy precavida. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por el comercio en general y manufactura en todas las áreas. 
Maria es morena de cabello negro lacio y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la segunda de la derecha, viste blusa celeste). Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con piso de tierra que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio para alimentar a su familia la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cereales, venta de polainas, taller de llaves, venta de pañales, venta de ropa deportiva y venta de carne. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerio, el menú diario varía según los alimentos de temporada, mayormente vende; Jugos, avena, sodas, Maní o frutos secos, Sandwiches, emparedados, Frutas, Ensaladas, Bebidas calientes y otros, “vendo ambulantemente y tengo clientes fijos a los que reparto diariamente diferentes refrigerios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un kiosco en su casa, ella desea comprar insumos como; carne, frutas, cereales y otros para preparar refrigerios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar refrigerios.
texts.en:
Maria is a 27 year old woman. She is separated and she has 3 children aged 7, 9, and 11. Her business is selling snacks.
She is a good mother, friendly and very cautious. She does her business in the South side of the city, characterized by commerce in general and manufacturing in all areas.
Maria is dark skinned, with long, straight black hair and slim physique. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish (she is the second on the right, wearing a celeste shirt). She lives her life together with her children who go to school. They live in a house that they own, made of wood with a floor made of dirt that has all basic services. The need to improve her business to feed her family led her to form a bank of people with businesses such as: cereal sales, a legging sales, key workshop, diaper sales, sport clothing sales, and meat sales.
Her business is snack sales. The daily menu varies according to the food of the season. Primarily she sells juices, oatmeal, sodas, peanuts or dried fruit, sandwiches, fruits, salads, hot drinks and other. “I sell as a street vendor and I have fixed clients to whom I distribute different snacks on a daily basis,” she says. The advantage of her business is that she has fixed clients. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy kitchen supplies at wholesale. Her dream is to open a kiosk in her home. She wants to buy supplies such as meat, fruit, cereals, and others to prepare snacks. This is the first sequence of loan with the institution in the 3 years that she has had this occupation.
It is for these reasons that Maria asks for a loan, to buy supplies to prepare snacks.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare snacks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina toils the land and grows vegetables and fruits, such as eggplant and watermelon. She has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years now. She is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. Her eldest is 24 and the youngest is 14 years old. Her husband is a carpenter.

She needs funds to sustain her main source of income. She has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, plant vitamins, and sprayers. These are useful tools that enable her to improve the harvest of her farm. Thus, her earnings will improve and settle her obligation slowly.

In the future, Cristina would like to improve her livelihood to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, plant vitamins, and sprayers.

loans.name: Alfred,

texts.en:
Alfred is married dealing in produce business plus a monthly salary to supplement his incomes. Alfred desires to construct a residential house. He has almost all the materials but lacks a few like timber and iron sheets. He would be grateful if borrowed money to complete his budget and start off the construction process.He will be able to pay back in installments without any set backs, as he has stable sources of income.

He requests for money to buy timber, and iron sheets for constructing his house. Alfred is a trustworthy client having paid his first loan well.

loans.use: to buy timber and iron sheets for constructing his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for 13 years and earns a monthly income of forty thousand Kenya shillings. 


This is her 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, rice, detergents etc. for sale.  


She will use the profits from expanded business to improve the living standard of her family. Her hopes and dreams are to grow from a small scale trader to a large scale trader.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, rice, detergents etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en:
Alianca started her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 100.00.  She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have a good management for her business. So she has one idea to requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management, because she said with borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day.

 She is taking this loan because she wants to buy additional supplies  according to what people like such as slippers, sugar, salts,soaps, eggs, sardines,cooking oils, detergents, candies, milks, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.  She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that.

loans.use: To buy slippers, sugar, salts,soaps, eggs, sardines,cooking oils, detergents, candies, milks, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Samoeurn is a mother of three schoolchildren living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province and she is 34 years old. Her main incomes which she can support on her family’s living are from growing cassava and rice cropping. She has been involved her businesses for 16 years and she can save from her daily income about 11 USD per day. She did not get good yield from her farms in this year and it is her main challenge.

In a group of two, she is the group leader and this is her third cycle with VisionFund. She fully repaid her past loans successfully and her family’s living has improved than before. She will use her portion of loan to purchase fertilizer to input on her cassava and rice farm in order to produce more yields than last year. She wishes that she can earn a decent income to upgrade her living condition and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve on her rice farm and her cassava farm to get good yield than before.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srann

texts.en:
A villager of Kroch Chhma district, Kampong Cham province, Srann is a 64-year-old widowed woman who has one child. She is selling some grocery items and growing corn to earn main sources of family income. Additionally, she is earning supplemental income through raising cows. She has been in these businesses for 46 years. High competitive in selling business and lower outputs harvested from crop are the challenges that Srann faces.
She is new to VisionFund and she will use her loan to buy more grocery items to replenish her store so as to attract customers to buy more and the portion left will be used to build a small barn for crops storage purpose. She hopes that she can earn good income to better support family’s needs and upgrade the standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to replenish her store to attract customers and to build a small barn to store cassava crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession. He drives a jeep in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the jeep's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Nazia has availed Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the jeep to provide better facilities to his customers. Nazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is 33 years old and married with three children living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum province’s Dambae district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava, which they have been doing for ten years. The current business earns them about 15 USD per day and they manage to save about 6 USD each day for their future needs.

Yet’s group consists of three female members who live in the same village. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Yet wants to use her portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Aninam

texts.fr: Aninam est âgée de 40 ans et est une femme mariée. Aninam vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge  à Agoè où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs et vend aussi des produits alimentaires pour ses clients qui en trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Aninam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire commander des sacs de maïs, des cossettes et des sachets de bombom afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son activité.
texts.en: Aninam is 40 years old and married. She lives with her four dependent children in Agoè. Aninam cooks corn porridge for sale and also sells food products to better meet her customers' needs. She stocks up at the market twice a month and would like to order bags of corn, “cossettes” made from dried yam and packets of candy in order to earn a good profit margin and be able to support her children’s education and better manage her business.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of corn, 15 bowls f dry yam snacks and three packs of candy.

loans.name: Akossiwa  Rosaline

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Akossiwa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et du maïs qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akossiwa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et des bols de maïs afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a married woman who is responsible for two children. She lives in Baguida and sells charcoal and maize. She buys her supplies from the market and sells them from in front of her house.

Akossiwa is requesting this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and bowls of maize. Her increased earnings will be used to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family and pay for a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal and 20 bowls of maize.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une veuve femme âgée de 49 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Dédé est une revendeuse de maïs qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à son domicile pour atteindre son objectif. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Dédé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de faire face aux différents problèmes qu’elle éprouve quotidiennement et prendre bien en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dédé is forty-nine years old, a widow and mother to four children. She lives in Baguida and sells maize. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells them from her home.

Dédé is requesting this loan to buy more sacks of maize. Her resulting earnings will help her cope with the problems she faces on a daily basis and help her take care of her children-

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 20-years-old single young man from Khan younis city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Haitham is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Haitham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Haitham will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Haitham appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Business Administration.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 20-years-old single young man from Jinan city. His father works in a construction field where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.
Islam is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.
Islam appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay for his first semester study expenses at university in Business Administration.

loans.name: An-An

texts.en:
An-an and her husband owned a tricycle that gives them a daily income. It helps them be sustained each day. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy tires and tricycle accessories. They have been operating this business for almost five years.

 In the future, An-an wishes to start other business that would help them increase their livelihood to have better means of living. Additionally, she is 24 years old woman and a mother of a three years old son. She is from Albuera, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy tires and tricycle accessories

loans.name: Timoteo Jr.

texts.en:
Timoteo can't fully give the needs of his family because of the little income that he can get out of his work. So he decided to engaged in raising pigs. He raised pigs and when they reach the marketable age, he will sell them in the market. He earns good profit on it. And because of this business, he was able to pay his previous loan.

Recently, he availed a loan to buy feeds for the pigs so that he can produce a good quality of pigs and can deliver more pigs to supply his customer demand and this will result a greater income. 

Timoteo's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for his pigs

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en: Haydee is a 28-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three children ages nine, seven and five years old. Her husband is a security guard while Haydee is engaged in hog raising business. She has been doing this for six years. She is asking a loan to buy piglets hoping to improve their livelihood. Haydee wishes to improve her hog raising business and have a sustainable life in the future.

loans.use: to buy to buy piglets

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta  has been earning for her grocery store for many years. In working on it, she earn more profit. In fact, she was able to repaid her loan back to GDMPC. Recently,she availed a loan to buy more goods to sell to her customers. Julieta's plan for the future is to save money out from his business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 7 years and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in fashion. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of tailoring materials. His business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tailoring materials

loans.name: Nadiah

texts.en:
Nadiah used her previous loan to buy clothing to sell. She says that the previous loan helped her in her business since she was able to meet the increased demand of her customers. With the profits she was able to pay school fees for her children and is very grateful.

However, Nadia still has the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the demand and high taxes, but her dream is to be the leading supplier of bedding.

She still sells clothing and bedding. The business she operates is in a busy market located in the center of town.

Nadia is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets and blankets to sell.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
A mother of one child living in Kampong Cham province, Phoeun is 57 years old. She has grown rice as her single source of income to support herself for 39 years. The price of rice is lower than before and this is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first time for Phoeun with VisionFund. She will spend her loan to buy an oxcart and more fertilizer to support her rice crop to produce higher yields than last year. She hopes that she can get higher yields from her rice than before, so she can earn more income to upgrade her family’s living conditions and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy an oxcart and more fertilizer to increase the yield of her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en:
Micaela raises cows, hogs and sheep for a living and also cultivates corn to feed her animals. Her largest source of revenue is the sale of adult hogs for their meat. She looks forward to start saving money by displacing LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizer on her farm.

Indeed, by in-putting the raw manure in her biodigester, the bacteria and natural methanisation process will transform it into renewable energy (biogas) to cook and heat water, as well as organic fertilizer for her field. Micaela will not only save money, but also increase the yield of her crop in a sustainable manner, while reducing emissions of greenhouse gases and protecting underground water sources. Cooking with biogas will eliminate the toxic smoke produced by burning wood in the kitchen, reducing the risk of lung and other diseases for her family.

This loan represents 27% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa bidigester.

loans.name: Jeovana Lizbette

texts.en:
Jeovana is a 29 year old single mother, she has one young daughter, and they live together on a house Jeovana owns. Jeovana is an employee for a headhunter enterprise and she also makes a living out of a stationary store that she owns. Kubo looks up to Jeovana because she has made her way through live, she managed to get a successful stationary, a new job and a house of her own, all meanwhile she is raising a young child.

She bought her house knowing she needed to make some improvements to it and she has been up to it lately, so now she wants to fix two of the bathrooms, by installing the plumbing system and toilets.
In order to repair this bathrooms she is asking for a 15,000 MXN loan, with this loan she will be able to install a shower and a pipe system.

loans.use: to fix two of her house bathrooms

loans.name: Famille Juvenal Group

texts.fr: Avec son premier crédit, Juvénal et son épouse ont pu entretenir leur champ, assurer la scolarisation de leurs enfants et l'alimentation familiale. Heureusement pour eux, ils n'ont pas rencontré d'obstacles tout au long du crédit. Juvénal souhaite améliorer l'entretien de leur espace cultural à travers un deuxième crédit qui aura certainement un impact à la longue sur la  qualité et la quantité du produit. Il aspire également à un renforcement de ses autres activités secondaires à savoir la vente du café et des poissons salés.
texts.en:
Juvénal and his wife used their first loan to take care of their field, pay for schooling for their children and feed their family. Luckily they didn't encounter any difficulties over the loan cycle.

Juvénal would like to further improve the field so he has requested this second loan. This will improve the field for a long time to come, which will improve the quality and quantity of the crop.

Juvénal would also like to strengthen his other businesses - selling coffee and salted fish.

loans.use: to tend his coffee field.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a 33-year-old, married Woman from Jenin City. She lives with her family in a small, old house where she is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on her for support. Nuha has a greenhouses for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the city. It is a good business and provides her a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Nuha could not save cash from last season, she took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy some tomato seedlings and pesticides for her greenhouse, for this season. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more tomato seedlings for her farm

loans.name: La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 3, 11 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ zona caracterizada por alojar a los sobrevivientes del desborde del rio años atrás, ahora convertida en campo de producción manufacturera.
Jaqueline es morena como la tierra, de cabello negro y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha, viste calza azul y polera celeste). La necesidad por pagar los gastos de sus hijos la hizo formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, servicio de limpieza, llantería, panadería y venta de verduras. Su negocio es la venta de perfumes, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en ferias y áreas comerciales, “mi trabajo no tiene horario eso me ayuda a velar por mis hijos…” comenta. La venta de su negocio es que los productos que vende son baratos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería por mayor como, cremas, perfumes, lociones y otros. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea comprar un stock de perfumes por mayor para abaratar costos y mejorar sus ventas por el bien de sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la intuición en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jaqueline solicita un préstamo para comprar perfumes por mayor y con los beneficios cuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is a 35-year old woman who lives with her husband and has four children aged 1, 3, 11, and 17. To earn her living she sells cosmetics. She is a good mother, enterprising and very optimistic. Her business is located in the Plan 3000 neighbourhood which is where the survivors of the river flood some years ago are lodged. Now the area is a manufacturing centre.

Jaqueline is dark complexioned, like the earth, has black hair and is short in height. Her native language is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. (In the photo she is first on the right wearing black pants and a blue t-shirt.) It was the need to pay for her children's expenses that made her form a community bank with businesses such as food sales, secondhand clothing sales, leather crafts, cleaning service, tire sales, baker, and vegetable sales.

Jaqueline's business is peddling perfume in the streets, at markets, and in business districts. She says that she doesn't have a fixed schedule which is helpful as she can watch her children. Her business advantage is that her prices are low; a disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy merchandise in bulk, such as cream, perfume, lotions etc. Her dream is to open a store.

Now she wishes to buy perfume at wholesale prices so she can lower costs and increase sales so she can better provide for her children. This is the first loan with the institution in the three years that she has had a her business.

loans.use: buy perfume at wholesale prices

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a strong willed woman who do everything for the good of her family. She needed a capital for her hog raising business that she asks for a loan from PAglaum MPC where she is an active member. Pacita is grateful to the cooperative because it really empowers her as a woman and as a mother.Recently, she avails a loan to buy additional heads of piglet & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglet & purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Providing jobs, increasing available crop output, buying a home, paying for her children’s education: these are just some of the things going around Lynette’s mind. Lynette loves animals, in particular, her dairy cows! In the picture, she can be seen playing with one. Dairy farming is a good business in Nkubu (a rural market where farmers from Mailikumi sell their produce).

Lynette would like to produce more milk from her cows in the future. In order to realize her goal, she needs to ensure that the environment her cows live in is comfortable and conducive to maximum productivity. It is for this reason that Lynette is seeking a loan to introduce cow barns at her farm.

Having a cowshed in place paves the way for the introduction of confined feeding, which enables the cows to save energy and feed more. Returns from this investment will enable Lynette to increase the number of cows at her farm and grow her family income.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is known in Tudela area of her delicious and palatable "pan bisaya" (native way of cooking bread). She vend her breads to the town and even to the neighboring towns. She also have regular costumers that visits her house to buy her products. Due to increasing demands that she asks from the coop an amount for additional capitalization to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, margarine, leavening and others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, margarine, leavening and others

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen is 51 years old and married with four children; three of them are still her dependents. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs, which they have been doing for 33 years. The current business earns them about 80,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her business is drought.

Chen’s group consists of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. Chen successfully used the first loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Moutian Group

texts.fr: Daniel est un cultivateur éleveur âgé de 33 ans, il vit au Mali avec sa femme et ses deux enfants  âgés de 4 à 2 ans non scolarisés. Il fait l’élevage de mouton depuis quatre ans. C’est lui qui tient la corde des deux moutons  devant les membres du groupe.  Il s’approvisionne et vend ses  produits dans les villages et marchés environnant de sa localité. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de moutons pour revendre,  en vue de gagner de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins  de la famille : scolariser ses enfants, construire un habitat en dure pour  ses enfants). Les difficultés qui lui arrivent souvent dans  son activité est la mort de certains animaux.
texts.en:
Daniel is thirty-three years old and lives in Mali with his wife and their two children. The children are aged four and two years old and do not attend school.

Daniel is a farmer who has been rearing sheep for four years. He is seen in the photo holding the sheep's rope. He buys and sells his animals in the local villages and markets.

Daniel has requested this loan from the field partner, RMCR, to buy many sheep to sell on. His earnings will be used to meet the needs of his family, such as schooling for his children and building a solid home for them all. The main difficulty that Daniel encounters in his business is the death of some of his animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep for selling on.

loans.name: El Bibosi _74 Group

texts.es:
María continúa con su actividad de fabricación de cajas para regalos. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de material de trabajo. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Su siguiente meta es mejorar su negocio. En esta oportunidad la banca es presidida por Cinthia, que es una mujer de 35 años, casada, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
Ella es buena madre, paciente y muy generosa. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista’ de la ciudad área central comercial. 
Cinthia es trigueña de cabello largo y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa rosa). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza ambulando en ferias, mercados y áreas comerciales, “tengo la necesidad de ampliar mi stock para mejorar las ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa rota continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ampliar el stock y mejorar las ventas. Su sueño es mejorar sus ventas Ella desea comprar ropa usada por mayor para ampliar su stock y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Cinthia solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa usada por mayor para ampliar su stock y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is continuing her gift box-making business. She invested her previous loan in more work supplies. She made her repayments punctually. Her next goal is to improve her business.

Currently the president of the bank is Cinthia who is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 13. To earn her living she sells used clothing. She is a good mother, patient and very generous. Her business is located in the Mutualista area of the town, in the central commercial district.

Cinthia is dark-skinned with long hair and a robust physique. Her native language is Grananí, and she also speaks Spanish. (In the photo she is first on the left wearing a pink blouse). Her husband works in the transportation business. Her children attend school. They live in a rented house made of bricks which has all the basic services.

Cinthia sells secondhand clothing at fairs, markets and in business districts. She needs to increase stock so she can improve sales. The advantage of her business is that her stock of clothing is always changing; the disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy more stock and increase sales. Her dream is to increase sales so she wishes to obtain a loan to buy used clothing in bulk so she can sell more. This is her fifth loan with the institution in the three years that she's had her business.

loans.use: buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, along with her partner, not only formed a loving union, but they also managed to set up a mixed farming business. Both work seven days a week to position the farm so that it endures over time. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and farming. Florence hails from Siongiroi, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. Florence, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Florence has always ensured that her family has food on the table. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school.

Florence detests living in poverty, and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market, and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow, profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her children to school.

Through your loan, Florence will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living. She will also improve the standard of living of others in the area. Florence is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
As a mother of three lovely angels, Rose's great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Rose and fills her with enthusiasm. Rose has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. On her farm, she grows maize, has five dairy cows, and keeps goats and pigs. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns.

Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products, because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. Rose's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Rose formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. Rose is seeking a loan to buy pigs and is planning to become a full-fledged pig farmer. Through the loan she will sell pork meat, which has a high demand in her remote area. With this loan, Rose is going to grow into a very successful pig farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Rose hopes to succeed, thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people that support small-holder farmers.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 49 years old, single and lives in Bonga, Maria, Siquijor. He operates and run a parlor or salon that is his major source of income. He is the main hair dresser and make-up artist in his salon. Antonio is known in their place for his effeminate characteristics including the way he dresses and appears in public. He is also a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC.

Recently, he availed a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase bags of cement, plywood, steel rods and to pay for labor cost for house repair.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, steel rods and to pay labor cost for house repair.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai is 51 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from salary and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 34 years old and lives with her family in the Thika area of Kenya. She is blessed with three children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future. Consolata was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 6 years. She also has a side hustle motorbike business that she does. She is the only female motorbike rider in her village.

Consolata is kindly seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and farm implements. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into smaller pieces. Through the chaff cutter she will be able to feed her cows properly. With the loan, she will also be able to buy high quality animal feed, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production and dairy farming. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques. Using high-quality feed and seeds will assure her of high milk production and a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Consolata is very visionary and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Consolata believes that, through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background.
This loan will be Consolata’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter, farm implements, high quality animal feeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Margaret is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps sheep. Margaret has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: "I have to do something for my family."

Margaret joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Margaret is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Margaret to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

For women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Margaret feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Margaret will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase.

Margaret is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Margaret will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ablagan Dzouli

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Ablagan est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans résidant à Agoè. Ablagan est une coiffeuse qui expose des mèches et produits de beauté dans son salon de coiffure. Ablagan s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et revend dans son salon de coiffure. Ablagan nécessite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de mèches et des unités de pommades en vue de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablagan is twenty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Agoè and works as a hairdresser. She also sells hair extensions and beauty products in her hairdressing salon. Ablagon buys her supplies four times a month from the market.

Ablagon has requested this loan to order dozens of hair extensions and hair pomades. Her earnings will help her husband provide for their children and pay for food and healthcare for the family.

loans.use: to buy 4

loans.name: Mekaamba

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans, Mekaamba est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge. Mekaamba vit à Agoè et est une revendeuse des balaies qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Mekaamba sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de balaies en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mekaamba is twenty-six years old, married and responsible for two children. She lives in Agoè and sells brooms. She buys her stock twice a month from the market and resells it from the front of her home.

Mekaamba has requested this loan to order dozens more brooms to increase her stock levels. Her increased earnings will help her husband provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 57 dozen brooms.

loans.name: Niem

texts.en:
Mrs. Niem is 40 years old, married and has two children. She has been raising hogs for almost 15 years now. This is her main source of income. Aside from raising hogs, she also grows and sells chickens.

She is in need of capital to support her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and additional pigs. With these, she could maximize the resources available and improve both sources of income. She dreams of handling both sources of income successfully, to continue to support the education of her children, so they have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional pigs to improve sources of income.

loans.name: Central 1 Group

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, optimista y muy decidida. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural que acopia gran parte de la producción agrícola para ser comercializada en la ciudad.
Irene es morena de cabello rojizo y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (sentada viste polera negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de refrescos, venta de comida rápida, servicio de moto taxi, llantería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, librería y tienda de abarrotes. Su negocio es la venta de ‘Kjaras’ que es una comida elaborada con carne de cerdo, maíz hervido y papas, “cocino sólo esta comida porque el tiempo de preparación es largo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de muebles de comedor. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Irene solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de comedor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Irene is a 28-year old woman who lives with her husband and 8-year old son. She earns her living selling food. She is a good mother, optimistic and very dedicated. Her business is located in the rural area of El Torno which is part of the large agricultural area growing produce to sell in the town.

Irene has dark skin, reddish-brown hair and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. (In the photo she is sitting down and wearing a black t-shirt.) Her husband is a farmer, and her son attends school. They live in their own house made of wood, and it only has electricity.

Irene's wish to improve her business led her to form a community bank which has businesses such as soft drinks sales, fast food sales, motorbike taxi service, tire sales, secondhand clothing sales, stationery store, and grocery store. Her business is selling Kjaras which is a dish made from pork, boiled corn, and potato. She explains that this is the only food she makes as it takes a long time to prepare. The advantage of her business is that sales are made daily; the disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy furniture for the restaurant. Her dream is to have a stable business.

Irene wishes to buy tables and chairs for her business. This is her first loan in the two years she has had her business.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Working in the fields is one of the hardest jobs nowadays due to the great effort that must be made to get ahead in it, but Hellen is a smallholder farmer who has never given up regardless of bad weather or unfortunate circumstances. She is always willing to get the resources her family needs.

Hellen, 61, loves dairy farming! A very large portion of her farm is allocated for dairy only. Besides her attachment to cows, what makes dairy farming attractive to Hellen is the thriving milk market in Kenyenya where she hails from. To grow the dairy business, Hellen is seeking support from individual international lenders.

With the contribution from Kiva lenders, Hellen is going to construct proper housing for her dairy animals. The housing will provide shelter, protection, and a hygienic environment conducive to her animals' well-being. The housing also paves way for the introduction of a zero-grazing model which has proved successful and profitable in multiple dairy farms.

Invest in Hellen and empower a progressive farmer, a wife, and a mother from Kenyenya.

loans.use: To construct a cowshade

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a smallholder farmer who is 75 years of age. She is a fighter of a woman, enterprising and honest. She wants to fight to make sure her children and grandchildren lack nothing. She resides with her husband with whom she has been blessed with 9 lovely children.

Eunice has been actively involved in farming for the last 35 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry. Sorghum will be used to give the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will lay more eggs of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will also get an increased output of poultry meat and this will increase her income and profit margins. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions. Support this great grand mum who is not deterred by difficulty so that she can achieve a good future for her grandchildren and children.

loans.use: To buy good quality breeds of poultry

loans.name: Safatou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 37 ans, Safatou est une femme qui habite à Agoè. Ayant deux enfants à sa charge, Safatou est une revendeuse des objets en plastique. Safatou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Safatou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines en plastiques afin de satisfaire parfaitement aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir à certaines charges et besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safatou is thirty-seven years old, married and responsible for two children. She lives in Agoè and sells plastic products. She buys her stock twice a month from the market and resells it on foot, locally.

Safatou has requested this loan to order dozens more plastic buckets to satisfy the needs of her customers. Her increased earnings will provide for some of the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen plastic buckets.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 45-years-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children.
Her prints advertisement banners and logos on order for many years. For this purposes he utilizes various paints brushes and pieces of white cloths.
He wants to grow his business so he can easily generate more income than in the past so he can cherish his children and can bear the medical expenses of his family.

Therefore, Gulshan has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy white cloth, paint and brushes for advertisement banners writing. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family.
She hopes that the Kiva lenders will support her and is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of white cloth, paint and brushes for her husband's banner writing services.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans résidant à Agoè. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Kossiwa est une marchande des céréales qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend au marché également. Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs  en vue de faire des bénéfices et aider son mari à bien prendre soins de leurs enfants et les inscrire dans des écoles de haut niveau scolaire.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is thirty-seven years old, married and responsible for two children. She lives in Agoè and sells cereals. She buys her stock five times a month from the market and also sells it at the market.

Kossiwa has requested this loan to order sacks of maize to increase her profits. These will help her husband to provide for their children and register them at good quality schools.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham Province, Bo is 52 years old and a father of five dependent children.

Bo has grown rice and cassava as his main source of income to improve his family's conditions for 34 years. Moreover, he can get extra income via working as a labourer for others. His cassava has been destroyed by insects, so he sells his cassava at lower prices than last year. Bo can save about $7.70 USD from his daily income for his family.

Bo leads a group of two to seek his first micro loan with VisionFund. Bo will use his entire loan portion to purchase fertilizer to support his farm and to buy more organic pesticides to ensure that his cassava grows well.

He hopes that his family can live in better conditions in the future after getting this loan.
