loans.use: to purchase more organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to support his cassava farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon and wife(both in the picture stand in-front of their house) live with 2 children in Kamleng Phe Village. Phon works as Village chief. Beside paper work as Village Chief, Phon does farming with his wife to support family expense. As a farmer and also a village chief, Phon wants to have a reliable energy source to run his farm smoothly.

However, his house is in remote area. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery, the whole family is in pitch black condition until morning.

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can do his paper work at night.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Kanleng Phe Village, Kouk Banteay Commune, Rolea P

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs.Van is 39 years old, married with two children. She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in a rural area. She is borrowing a loan through QBWDF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from cultivation. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song and wife are farmers living in Chhoung Preal village with 2 children. Song wants to expand business start from small to bigger and bigger business. With the help of wife and support from children, Song never loses hope and hard work willing. He wants to get up early morning and go late to spend more time on work; however, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. He has to get up when the sun raises high enough to see thing clearly and go back home early before the road is too dark to go. As a result, he decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home systems. He believes he will have enough energy for his family usage and also improve his working hours.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Thelia

texts.en:
Thelia has mastered the business of buying and selling dried fish. She has a stall in local market where she primarily sells various kinds of dried fish.

Thelia is financed by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. The she loan she is taking this time is in the amount of 8,000 PHP in order to purchase inventory of dried fish for her buy & sell business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of dried fish for her buy & sell business.

loans.name: Junbai- 02 Group

texts.en:
Janaki lives with her teenaged child and husband in Assam in the Northeastern part of India. She runs a small clothing business at home. She realized the need to increase her savings to secure her children’s future. She feels that their existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is seeking a loan to purchase saris, nighties, blouses, salwar pieces, etc.

The other members of the group are also involved in various income generating activities and want to expand their businesses. Hence they decided to form a group and applied for a loan. They are well aware of the group rules and have agreed to abide by them. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her clothing business and sell saris, blouses, salwar pieces, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 48-year-old mother with a total willingness to work. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for tea farming. Florence has three children whom she adores and cherishes, and a handsome husband who always paints a smile on Florence's face.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years, and is making great strides. She has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling, and personal business. These ventures have enabled her to send her children to school and feed her family. Florence has planted many trees on her compound. She also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed her dairy cow, thereby enhancing her milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Florence is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture and she wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Florence is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in her area.

With her increased profits, Florence is sure that she will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of her family. Florence, with her entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that she can achieve her dream of owning her own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Florence save more effectively, and through her accumulated profits, she plans to add value to her milk through packaging. She also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Akoelé

texts.fr: Agée de 50, Akoelé est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses cinq enfants à charge à Agoè. Akoelé prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Akoelé s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour  commander des sacs de maïs et du sucre afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoelé is fifty years old, married and responsible for five children. She lives in Agoè and prepares and sells maize porridge for her customers. She enjoys her work. Three times a month, she buys her supplies from the market.

Akoelé has requested this loan to order more sacks of maize and sugar to increase her profit levels. Her earnings will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of maize and 1 sack of sugar.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude, 25, is happily married and blessed with two adorable children. She is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kebeneti, a remote village in Kericho. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and has gained a lot of experience. She also has another small, personal venture. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Getrude has been selling maize, milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and loves, as she said, “the increased profits I enjoy.” The Kericho area is very populated, so the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Getrude’s biggest challenge, however, is being unable to take advantage of this high demand for her poultry products. She lacks the money to buy more chickens, and so she is seeking a 55,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to do so.

Being a woman, accessing funds can be very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo she is able to do so and is grateful for it. As a result of this loan, Getrude will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and in the local market. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more in profits, expand her poultry business into other markets, and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her family’s life together, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a woman with a lot of honesty, wisdom and is a go-getter. She is very industrious and resides in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. Julia has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Julia is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandi Hills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Julia could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Julia, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Julia believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Julia to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a 24-year-old married mum with a beautiful family. They all live in a town called Nandihills. This town doesn’t offer the best opportunities, but this honest mum has learned to deal with that. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea-growing regions, lending it the nickname “tea area of Kenya.”

For the past 10 years, Marion has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Marion passionately loves poultry farming. The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists small-scale farmers by providing loans and training. Marion is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Marion will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business. Help Marion make her dreams come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Nandihills is a remote town in the Rift valley area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Lilian is a smallholder farmer who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses.

The Nandihills area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Lilian finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farm, so she is seeking a loan of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 28 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Monica has a handsome husband and five children that she really admires and would do anything for so that they never lack anything.

Through practicing dairy and crop farming, she has always been able to provide food for her family and also meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last ten years, and this has helped her earn profits. She is seeking a loan for KES 30,000 to buy poultry. Through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Nandi Hills, which is densely populated and has a ready market for eggs and poultry.

Because of the immense knowledge that Monica has, and also because of the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products. She also believes that through word of mouth she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Monica and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Sebastian, a 66-year-old who is so humble and honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. Sebastian has a lovely family, whom he really adores so much, and will always do anything good to prevent them from ever going to bed with hungry stomachs.

Sebastian hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white-collar job, but these realities did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Sebastian has been farming for the past twenty years. Through these years, he has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips.

Sebastian practices mixed farming (crop and goat farming). With his profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs. He is very enterprising, and he is seeking a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Sebastian wants to take advantage of various conditions -- favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products -- and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Sebastian turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Sebastian hopes that he will improve his living conditions through this loan. By the end of the first year, his dreams and projections are that he will not only be selling in the local market, but also in international markets through the export of fruits and vegetables. Through these endeavours, he will be able to assure his family a secure future.

Sebastian is not a selfish man, and he wants to help society, which is why he will employ people on his horticulture farm; hence, have an impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is an energetic smallholder farmer, a person who always has a smile drawn on her face. Fifteen years ago, Ruth started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Kiptere, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Ruth believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a wife, mother, and farmer with 15 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Kapsowar, Kenya with her five children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Grace completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever-smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Grace has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.

Grace chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Grace’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children. Her desires to move forward are admirable and what she proposes, she achieves. Grace is working with a purpose and that purpose is to improve the conditions of her home. She knows that with the helping hand of Juhudi Kilimo (a field partner) and the lenders from the Kiva portal, she'll achieve her goal.

loans.use: To pay for quality breeds of poultry

loans.name: Guido Ebelio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de la variedad de flora y fauna.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Guido un hombre luchador mantiene una sólida relación de casados de la cual tienen dos hijos que estudia uno en el colegio y otro en la universidad, la esposa trabaja para ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
Don Guido tiene en su casa el negocio de vulcanizadora y cambio de paquetes para volquetas tiene muchos años de experiencia es un negocio al que le dedica un promedio de 10 horas diarias ya que tiene mucha acogida por su buen trabajo, cumplimiento y dedicación.
Solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos para su negocio ya que por la demanda que tiene necesita más herramientas de trabajo.
El señor Guido agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the "canton of love," is located in the north-western part of the Pichincha Province. This canton is visited frequently by national tourists and foreigners who enjoy the variety of flora and fauna.

Guido lives and has his business in this canton. He is a determined man who has a very strong marital relationship, from which he has two children. One is studying in grade school, the other in college, and his wife works to help with household expenses.

In his house, Guido has his tire repair shop and replaces springs on dump trucks. He has many years of experience, and it is a business to which he devotes an average of 10 hours a day. He has received a lot of welcome because of his good work, compliance and dedication.

He asks for the loan to buy spare parts for his business, since the demand on him has caused him to need more work tools.

Guido thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunities given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools that he needs in his repair shop to take in more clients.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is an adorable, affectionate, striving, and hardworking mother who is the head of a family. She lives in a remote village in Siongiroi, in the South Rift region of Kenya. Nelly passionately loves dairy farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops, milk, and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family.

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. She has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a high quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and the price of milk has been going up recently. Nelly, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, which will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Nelly said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Nelly hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products.

This young woman does not want to stop. She hopes to progress every day, and in partnership with Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, become a great dairy farmer. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as cooperative. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another bicyle and expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, microfinance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Norah, an ever smiling, hardworking and honest mum. She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Norah earns income through selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for the past two years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandi Hills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and to thus improve her income.

Norah’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements in life, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Norah has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with her finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Norah is visionary, and with her accumulated profits she hopes to be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Elizabeth (pictured above), from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Elizabeth is 58 years old and a proud mother of angelic-looking children, whom she really adores and cherishes. In addition to doing some small business, Elizabeth is a very hardworking farmer. She has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Elizabeth practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows.

Although Elizabeth has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest lately, because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds, and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds, so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Elizabeth will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Using this loan, Elizabeth will be able to expand her horticulture business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Elizabeth will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses.

She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day, to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. You can help Elizabeth with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds, and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Las Populares Group

texts.es:
Marcia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, soñadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los damnificados del desborde del rio años atrás.
Marcia es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha viste polera negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como electricista, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño de mejorar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocio como; venta de productos de limpieza, venta de refrescos, servicio de limpieza, venta de refrigerios, venta de productos médicos naturales, venta de cosméticos y artesanía en cuero. Su negocio es la venta de comida, como; ‘majao’ que es una comida a base de carne deshidrata molida, plátanos hervidos y arroz, “inicie con implementos mínimos, ahora necesito mejorarlo para satisfacer a mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mobiliario e utensilios de cocina. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar muebles y utensilios de cocina para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcia solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles y utensilios de cocina para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Marcia is a 28 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has no children. Her business is selling food. She is independent, a dreamer and very hard-working. She does her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood which is known for taking in the people displaced by a flood years ago.

Marcia is dark skinned, short and robust. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (In the photo she is on the right wearing a black shirt). She shares her life with her partner who works as an electrician. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement that has all the basic services.

Her dream is to improve her business. This led her to form a communal bank with businesses such as: the sale of cleaning products, soft drink sales, a cleaning service, refrigerator sales, the sale of natural medicines, cosmetic sales and leather handicrafts.

Her business is selling meals such as 'majao' which is a meal made with ground dried meat, boiled plantains and rice. "I started with the minimal implements now I need to improve this to satisfy my customers" she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has no competition there and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy furniture and cooking utensils.

She dreams of having a stable business. She wants to buy furniture and cooking utensils to serve more clients. This is her first loan with the institution in the year that she has been operating this business.

For these reasons Marcia is requesting a loan to to buy furniture and cooking utensils to serve more clients.

loans.use: to buy furniture and cooking utensils to serve more clients.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en: Donato makes good earning on his farming activities in Tudela. This is how he supports his family and able to send his children to school. He wants to increase his farm yield especially that he has high cost of living when his children entered college. Donato approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase spraying machine for insecticides. He has high hopes that he will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase spraying machine for insecticides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, and she is 54 years of age. She and her husband have 3 adult children.

Victoria joined Paglaum MPC and appreciates the programs and services of this co-op. Because of her desire to help her family, she works in selling fish in the local public market. She has had this source of income for 20 years now.

In need of additional working capital, she has requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is happy that she can support her children's education, which is her main priority and cause of her financial hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Malibay, Philippines branch. She is 50 years old and currently running a variety store or a Sari-sari store business, “Sari-sari” is a Tagalog word which means “variety of choices.” Here you can buy grocery items by piece or by volume, kilos of rice, and bottled drinks. She’s able to somehow sustain their day-to-day expenses because of the business since each month she’s earning 25,000 PHP.

She is a long time member of CCT, where she takes advantage every time they conduct business mentoring. CCT also inform members about what Kiva has to offer. All over the globe, there are lenders who are considerate in helping other people in need, that’s why Lucila applied for a loan amount of 30,000 PHP, so that she’ll be able to add grocery items to her variety store business. She’s hoping that CCT will consider her application since it would be of great help if ever granted. She wants to thank in advance all of the lenders, CCT and Kiva.

On a weekly basis, Lucila regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add grocery items to her variety store business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a smallholder farmer from the village of Ndalu in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is the mother of four lovely children. At a tender age, Florence's passion for farming and education drove her to start practicing mixed farming. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. When you ask, she’ll tell you her most valuable asset is her two-acre farm. But it wasn't always this way. For a long time, Florence’s farm couldn't even sustain her family.

In 2014, Florence heard about Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that serves smallholder farmers, and their partnership with Kiva. And from that day, life has never been the same. Like many farmers in the region, Florence keeps a dairy cow and poultry, and has a side hustle business (a motorbike business) and grows different varieties of crops. Kitale has a thriving market for dairy products. Florence has sustained herself through dairy farming. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them.

Florence dreams of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Florence is kindly requesting 52,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more milk for both consumption and sales.

With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Florence will be able to cover the high cost of farm production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high input costs. However, with increased income, Florence will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living. You can help Florence with a loan and get her closer to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a divorced woman who has a lot of willpower and can overcome all the obstacles in her life. She lives with her parents in Irbid.

Amal decided to do her best and she works hard to be able to help her parents and to be a productive woman.

She opened her small business which sells ready-to-wear clothes at her home and she works hard to provide a living for her parents. She is a very ambitious and patient woman.

Now she wants to buy more clothes and new products to sell, but she does not have enough money so she decided to apply for a loan. This loan will help her to increase her income, to be able to cover the treatment expenses for her parents, to improve the standard of living for her and her parents, to meet her needs and to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and new products to sell

loans.name: Taruma Group

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Taruma’, la misma tiene un área urbana a lo largo de la carretera principal asfaltada, las viviendas están distribuidas en forma ordenada y un poco dispersas, no cuenta con alcantarillado.
Mirtha es de físico robusto, tez morena y cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español (de pie, la primera de la derecha, carga a su niña en brazos). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, servicio de lavandería, artesanía en cuero, tejido de sombreros de sao, librería y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la panadería, esta se realiza con los alimentos del lugar como el ‘cuñapé’ a base de almidón de yuca, pan de leche a base de leche, pan de arroz a base arroz, “el trabajo del panadero dura toda la semana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina como harina; de yuca, de arroz, de maíz, etc. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar diferentes tipos de harina por quintal para trabajar durante toda la semana. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mirtha solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por quintal para hacer pan tradicional.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 29 year old woman who lives with her partner and has 3 children of 5, 10 and 12 years old. She has a bakery business. She is a good mother, consistent and very independent. She runs her business in Taruma, in an urban area along the main paved road. The houses are distributed in an organized way, a little scattered and without a sewage system.

Mirtha has a robust physique, dark complexion and long black hair. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish (she is the first one standing on the right side, holding her daughter). She shares her life with her partner who works in transportation and with her children who attend school. They live in their own home built of wood and they have electricity.

The need to improve her business drove her to establish a community bank with businesses, such as; food sales, sale of second hand clothing, vegetable sales, fruit sales, laundry services, leather handicrafts, weaving straw hats, bookstore and convenience stores.

She has a bakery business and she makes "cuñapé" made of cassava starch, sweet milk bread made with milk, rice bread made with rice. "A baker works the entire week" she comments. The advantage of her business is that the sales are continuous, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase the different types of flours, such as cassava flour, rice flour, corn flour, etc. Her dream is to have a stable business. She would like to purchase different types of flour in bulk to work all week. This is her first loan cycle with the organization in the 4 years that she has been doing this type of work.

For these reasons Mirtha is requesting a loan, to purchase different types of flour in bulk to make traditional breads.

loans.use: to purchase different types of flour in bulk to make traditional bread.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 37-year-old mother. She is a happy mother, because just a few years ago the greatest joy arrived at her home -- her infant daughter, whom she loves and gives everything for. Gladys farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows and does a side-hustle business. Gladys has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. "I have to do something for my family," she said. Gladys mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Gladys is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads. As a result, transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products, such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes, require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan Gladys is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Gladys feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Gladys will never again suffer losses due to delays in the delivery of her produce to the market. In addition, she will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future. Make a loan now and be part of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, for fast transport of her farm products to market.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
HELLO, LENDERS! Meet Milcah (an ever-smiling mum). She is a smallholder farmer and lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. Farming has helped her not only to survive, but to become an entrepreneur. At her age that is not common, but she knows that it doesn’t come with an age limit. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. The Kitale area is a place that has produced some of the world's top elite athletes and is always referred to as the “bread basket” of Kenya, because 90% of maize consumed in Kenya comes from that region. Kitale has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming.

Milcah is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming. Through all the years she has been farming, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Milcah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mother, Milcah has taken care of her family, and she has supported them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Although Milcah reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing, which is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies, is the lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Milcah is seeking a loan of KES 80,000, which will enable her to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Milcah is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. With the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

Milcah is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality of life and securing her children's future. Milcah has gone through the repayment schedule and amount, and she is comfortable with the repayment plan. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 29-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kitale area of Kenya, and is blessed with a lovely family, which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Rose was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy farming. She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kitale is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Rose, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk.

She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. You can help Rose with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a youthful, 27-year-old farmer from a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village, because of her resilience despite personal challenges, and because of her passion to support her family as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough, and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Caroline has always shown the resilience to beat all odds.

Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Caroline started practicing mixed farming. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. Caroline's sources of income are a small side-hustle business and selling vegetables, milk, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Caroline is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits, because the products will still be fresh.

Caroline is very determined to succeed, and she is much disciplined with her finances. She plans that through accumulated profits, she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and for her family. Caroline's dream is to provide a secure future for her children by paying tuition fees for their educations. Through your loan you will help her to realize her dream. You can be part of Caroline’s dream -- make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, so she can deliver her produce speedily to market.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a youthful 35-year-old farmer, from Cherangani, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village, because of her resilience despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver.

The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Ruth has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Ruth started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. Her sources of income are vegetables, crops, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market.

The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Ruth is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits, because the products will still be fresh. Ruth is very determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans that she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and her children through accumulated profits. Ruth’s dream is to provide a secure future for her children by paying tuition fees for them. You will help her realize her dream through your loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora madre soltera que trabaja en una empresa como secretaria, necesita la graduación de unos lentes ya que padece miopía y sufre de fuertes dolores de cabeza que en ocasiones le impiden trabajar, además su hija necesita un tratamiento dental, pues sus encías sangran y tiene mucho dolor lo que le dificulta masticar bien sus alimentos. Desafortunadamente con sus ingresos no puede solventar los dos gastos.
texts.en:
She is a woman who is a single mother and works at a company as a secretary.

She needs a prescription for corrective lenses as she suffers from myopia and endures intense headaches which at times, impede her work. Her daughter also needs dental work as she has bleeding gums and is in a lot of pain which makes it hard to chew her food well.

Unfortunately, with the income she makes she is unable to afford the costs.

loans.use: pay for dental and ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru:
Абдулмумин 52 лет. Он проживает в районе Руми. Абдулмумин отец троих сыновей. Он занимается в родном районе животноводством. Ему в работе помогает старший сын. Он 6 лет своей жизни занимается этой деятельностью. Абдулмумин любит домашних животных, по этой причине он занимается животноводством. Он во дворе выращивает домашних животных. Абдулмумин покупает скота и откармливает их 40-50 дней, потом вывозит на продажу на скотном рынке. Он берет кредит, чтобы  купить несколько голов скота и расширить деятельность. 
Абдулмумин верит в Вас и в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Abdulmumin is 52 years old. He lives in the Rumy region. Abdulmumin is the father of three sons. He rears animals in his native region. His eldest son helps him in his work. He has been doing this work for the past six years of his life. Abdulmumin loves animals, and so for this reason he rears animals. He raises domestic animals in his yard. Abdulmumin buys cattle and feeds them up for 40-50 days, then takes them for sale at the cattle market. He is taking a loan in order to buy a few heads of cattle and to expand his business. Abdulmumin believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to expand his animal rearing business by buying a few heads of cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old. She is an honest, sensible, charismatic, and hard-working woman. She is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

Caroline is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, growing maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Caroline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not discouraged her. She states: “I have to do something for my family."

Caroline joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Caroline is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Caroline to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Caroline feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Caroline will never suffer losses due to delays in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Caroline is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Caroline will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this super incredible woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The only thing on Elizabeth’s mind at the moment is success. She has to work hard and always stay strong, through all of the adversities that may arise. Elizabeth, a youthful 44-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected and seen as a mentor by her neighbors and fellow farmers. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Elizabeth is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables. She also does some “side-hustle” business, and she has dairy cows.

Elizabeth has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up, and she states: “I have to do something for my family.“ Elizabeth joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Elizabeth is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Elizabeth to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle for women in Kenya, but Elizabeth feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan will be astronomical, because Elizabeth will never again suffer losses due to delays in delivering her produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume, also, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Elizabeth is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with the farm work. Elizabeth will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future. Kindly lend to Elizabeth, and help her to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, to help her deliver her perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Pauline started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Jarange, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy cow and dairy goat farming are close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cows. That makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk sales, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Pauline believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have increased milk production. She will save the money she has had to use to treat her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Pauline patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria de 51 años residenciada en Baranoa, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico con raíces indígenas y como parte de su herencia ancestral quedó impregnada en su gastronomía algunos platos típicos como el bollo; un alimento elaborado a base de maíz, yuca o plátano que se envuelve en hojas de maíz y se cocina en agua hirviendo.  Ana ayudaba a su madre también oriunda de esta localidad en la elaboración de bollos y con el pasar del tiempo decidió iniciar su propio negocio, en la actualidad cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en esta actividad con la que ha ofrecido a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella vive en compañía de su cónyuge y es madre de tres hijos de los cuales aún uno es menor de edad y depende económicamente de ellos. Todos los días realiza su producción a partir de las 6 a.m. y comercializa entre sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, así mismo sus compras las realiza en tiendas del sector y graneros del municipio. Para mantener un stock de materias primas está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual comprará maíz y un molino, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y continuar en su negocio muy motivada.  Su meta a futuro es adecuar un local y realizar mejoras locativas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a 51-year-old micro-entrepreneur, who lives in Baranoa. This municipality, located in the Atlántico department, has indigenous roots, and its ancestral legacy has been infused into the gastronomy. One of the region's traditional dishes is the "bollo," which is a bun made of corn, cassava, or plantain; wrapped in corn leaves; and cooked in boiling water.

Ana used to help her mother, also from this region, to make "bollos." With the passing of time, Ana decided to set up her own business and, currently,  has 25 years of experience. This occupation has enabled her to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Ana lives with her husband and has three children, one of whom is still a minor and relies on them for financial support.

She starts working at 6:00 a.m. every day and sells her products to her neighbours, friends, and relatives. She purchases her supplies at the stores in the area and at the granaries in the municipality.  

To maintain a stock of raw materials, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy corn and a mill. With this purchase, she will be able to improve her working conditions and continue to run her business highly motivated.

Her future goal is to set up a food stand and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy corn and a mill.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Singereri is a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Pamellah is a small-holder farmer from Kitale who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses.

The Kitale area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Pamellah finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farm, so she is seeking a loan of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income will be used to repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a very hard-working and helpful woman, and everything she does is for her family's well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale along with her husband and four children. She strives to give her children a decent life and a good education.

Selly has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also affects productivity.

Selly is seeking a loan to buy good quality seed and fertilizer which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Selly and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Hugo Lucio

texts.es:
Hugo continúa con su negocio de reparación de impresoras y electrodomésticos. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de material de trabajo para reparación de electrodomésticos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio continúa funcionando y trabajando con las pocas herramientas que tiene, “algunas máquinas tiene piezas que son imposibles de reparar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de nuevas herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es trabajar con todas las herramientas necesarias, él desea realizar la compra de 1 osciloscopio que es un instrumento de visualización electrónico para la representación gráfica de señales eléctricas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Hugo solicita un préstamo para la compra de 1 osciloscopio para reparar electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Hugo continues with his repair of printers and appliances business. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of material for appliance repair work.

The payment of dues was timely. Currently, his business continues to function and he continues working with the few tools he has, "some machines have parts that are beyond repair ..." he comments. 

The advantage of his business is that it has regular customers, the downside is the lack of capital to purchase new tools.

His dream is to work with all the necessary tools.  He wants to purchase 1 oscilloscope which is an electronic instrument which displays the graphical representation of electrical signals. 

This is the 2nd sequence loan with this institution.  He has been developing this business independently for 20 years.  It is for these reasons that Hugo is requesting a loan for the purchase of 1 oscilloscope to repair appliances.

loans.use: for the purchase of 1 oscilloscope to repair appliances.

loans.name: Abdurahmat

texts.ru: Целеустремленный 29 летный мужчина Абдурахмат. Он житель района Джоми. Абдурахмат верный муж и отец одного ребенка. Абдурахмат в своем родном районе занимается животноводством и земледелием. Он на все успевает. У него имеется не большой земельный участок, где выращивает растение. Абдурахмат в основном разводит мелко рогатого скота. Уже  3 года он выращивает скота. У него уже есть опыт работы. Опыт получил от своих родителей. Его родители тоже были простыми дехканами. Абдурахмат  составил план расширить животноводческую деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести пару скота для продвижения бизнеса. Абдурахмат не когда не боялся трудиться, потому что он так воспитан и так вырос. Абдурахмат очень надеется на финансирование. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This ambitious 29-year-old man is Abdurahmat. He is a resident of the Jomi region. Abdurahmat is a faithful husband and the father of a child. Abdurahmat rears animals and grows crops in his native region. He manages to find time for everything. He has a small plot of land where he grows crops. Abdurahmat mainly rears horned livestock. He has been rearing livestock for three years. He has experience in this work. He got his experience from his parents. His parents were also simple farmers. Abdurahmat has made a plan to expand his animal rearing business and increase the size of his herd. He has applied for a loan in order to buy a couple of livestock to progress his business. Abdurahmat has never been afraid of hard work because he was raised and grew up that way. Abdurahmat very much hopes for financing. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to expand his animal rearing business and increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is the true definition of a hard worker and a happy mother. She is a farmer in Kitale, growing maize, raising poultry, and engaged in dairy farming. She produces milk and eggs for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence.

Margaret also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses which she does. Margaret is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene.

She has been in the farming business for at least 10 years and has no plans to quit as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. With your loan, Margaret will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing.

The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Priscila Isabel

texts.es:
Priscila es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por la industria manufacturera en general.
Priscila es de baja estatura, físico robusto y cabello rojizo. Su lengua materna es la Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como electricista y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, como, azúcar, fideo, aceite, arroz, huevo, refrescos, golosinas y otros, “solo me dedico a mi negocio porque por mi edad ya no existen trabajos para mí…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es las ventas son diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un congelador para conservar los alimentos frescos. Su sueño es estabilizar su tienda, ella desea comprar un congelador para congelar y mantener los alimentos frescos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Priscila solicita un préstamo para comprar un congelador para congelar y mantener los alimentos frescos.
texts.en:
Priscilla is a 57 year old woman, is married, has a son aged 16, and her business is selling groceries in her neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, enterprising and hardworking.  Her business is done in the south of the city, area characterized by the manufacturing industry in general.

Priscilla is short, has a robust physique and reddish hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and speaks Spanish.  She shares her life with her husband who works as an electrician and her son who is studying in school.

She lives in hew own home built of brick and has all the basic services.   

Her business is selling groceries, like, sugar, noodles, oil, rice, eggs, soda, candy and other.   "I only work in my business because at my age there are no other jobs for me ..." she comments. 

The advantage of her business is that sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a freezer to keep food fresh.
 
Her dream is to make her store stable.  She would like to purchase a freezer to freeze and keep food fresh. 

This is her first sequence loan with the institution and she has been at her business for one year.

It is for these reasons that Priscilla is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer to freeze and keep food fresh.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to freeze and keep food fresh.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes,a 35-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Agnes who, with hard and honest work, make this a very productive town.

Agnes is eager to get ahead. She is married and lives with her family. She is blessed with four children who motivate her to persevere because she wants to provide for them a better future.

Dairy, poultry, a side motorbike business and crop-farming produce food and provide a basis for income generation and employment for Agnes.

However, the full potential of agriculture for food and income generation is not realized because Agnes still uses traditional tools for crop production which results in low productivity of land and labor. Low agricultural productivity also contributes to poor health and poverty.

Agnes is seeking a loan to buy low-cost, manually operated farm implements that are modified to fit local needs. Your loan will help supply Agnes with the appropriate tools required to improve agricultural productivity and profitability.

She knows that, with the help of the Kiva lenders, she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy low-cost, manually operated farm implements.

loans.name: Mercianah

texts.en:
Mercianah is 30 years old and a hard-worker. She is dedicated and responsible and knows how to use her skills as a farmer. A humble woman, Mercianah is creative and knows how to make the most of opportunities. She lives in Naitiri, a remote village in Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with children.

Mercianah has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Mercianah has been selling milk and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, Mercianah has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated so demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. Mercianah stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming so she is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Mercianah feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and extend her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Sayhon

texts.ru: Сайхон 50 летняя женщина из района Пяндж. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Дети взрослые, трудолюбивые и самостоятельные дети.  Ее муж тоже не плохой человек. Он заботливый и честный житель. Муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов в районе. Сайхон сильная, активная дехканка. Она во дворе выращивает домашнее животных. Сайхон 6 лет назад освоила деятельность мужа и решила сохранить деятельность и идти по его стопам. Доход от животноводческой деятельности обеспечить ее семью. Сайхон любить доить  коров и обеспечить семью с молочными продуктами. Она сейчас решила взять кредит и за счет кредита хочет купить несколько крупнорогатого скота. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей. Сайхон будет очень рада на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sayhon is a 50-year-old woman from the Pyandj region. She is married and the mother of three children. Her children are grown up, hard-working and independent. Her husband is also not a bad person. He is a caring and honest resident. Her husband works in home renovation in the area. Sayhon is a strong, active farmer. She rears domestic animals in the yard. Six years ago, Sayhon mastered her husband's business and decided to preserve this activity and follow in his footsteps. The income from the animal rearing business provides for her family. Sayhon loves to milk the cows and provide her family with dairy products. Now she has decided to take a loan, and use it to buy a few cattle. The requested loan will help her to achieve her goals. Sayhon will be very glad of your support.

loans.use: to buy a few cattle.

loans.name: Km 6 El Bajio Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 4, 6, 9 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en su casa ubicada en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Juana es morena, de baja estatura y cabello largo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la segunda de la izquierda, viste capri azul y polera amarillo bajito), Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. En esta oportunidad toma el mando de la banca de emprendimiento para solicitar un crédito. Su negocio es la venta de almuerzo y cena; ella cocina a diario en su casa para vender almuerzo a medio día y por  las noches la cena, “cocinar es un trabajo agotador al que estoy acostumbrada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como, arroz, fideo, yuca, carne, verduras y otros. Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para su puesto de venta de comida. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para su puesto de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Juana is a 29-year-old single woman who has four children, ages 4, 6, 9, and 12. Her business is selling meals.

Juana is a good mother, very independent and hard-working. The business is located in her home in the city's southern zone, which is characterized by manufacturing of all types.

Juana is dark complected and short in stature with long hair. (In the photo, Juana is the short woman, second from the left, dressed in blue capri pants and a yellow top.) She shares her life with her children who are all in school. They live in a rented room constructed of wood that has all basic services.

Juana's business sells lunches at mid-day, and suppers in the evening. Her disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to purchase inputs for the business such as rice, beans, cassava, meat, vegetables, and other ingredients.

Her dream is to have a more established business. She wants to buy the inputs for the kitchen at wholesale. This is her third loan with this institution in the last two years, since she began her business.

These are Juana's motives for requesting a loan to buy inputs for the kitchen of her meal-selling business.

loans.use: purchase kitchen supplies for the stall where she prepares and sells meals.

loans.name: Los Cumplidos Group

texts.es:
Amelia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 6, 8, 12 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de anticuchos y gaseosas.
Ella es independiente, fuerte y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’, que Es un lugar especial para los lugareños, debido a que se encuentra la Virgen de Cotoca, denominada "Patrona del Oriente Boliviano".
Amelia es morena de baja estatura y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (al centro lleva una cartera marrón). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; artesanía en cuero, fabricación de sombreros de sao, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de productos naturales para la salud, llantería y cerrajería. Su negocio es la venta de anticuchos, el anticucho es una comida que se prepara con el corazón de la vaca cortado en trocitos y ensartado en un palito, se cocina a la parrilla, “el anticucho es por excelencia nocturno, Es un alimento que se relaciona con la noche…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja por las noches, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande, ella desea comprar muebles de comedor para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
