Es por esos motivos que Amelia solicita un préstamo para comprar muebles para su negocio.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 37 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has four children aged 6, 8, 12 and 14 years old. Her business is selling kebabs and soft drinks.

She is independent, strong and very hard working. Her business takes place in the ‘Cotoca’ area. It is a special place for the locals as the Virgin of Cotoca is located here. She is known as "the Patron Saint of Eastern Bolivia".

Amelia is dark skinned, short and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. (In the photo she is in the center with a brown purse) She shares her life with her partner who works as a builder and her children who study at school. They live in their own house made of wood which has all the basic services.

Her dream of excelling led her to form a communal bank with people with businesses such as: leather handicrafts, making straw hats, selling fruit, selling meals, selling natural products for the health, a tire shop and a metal shop.

Her business is selling (anticucho) kebabs. The kebab is a food that is prepared with cow hearts cut in pieces, strung on a skewer and cooked on a grill. "The anticucho is quintessential night food. It is food that is related to the night", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she works at night. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tables and chairs.

Her dream is to have a larger business. She wants to buy cafe furniture for her business. This is her first loan from the institution in the four years she has run this business.

For these reasons Amelia is requesting a loan to buy furniture for her business.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 29 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años, y su negocio es el cibercafé.
El es independiente, buen padre y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur caracterizada por la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas.
Jaime es de baja estatura, físico mediano y tez morena. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la atención de cibercafé; en un cuarto de su casa habilitó su negocio con 2 computadoras y una impresora, “mis equipos no abastecen la demanda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las rentas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de equipos de computación. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, él desea comprar 2 equipos de computación para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jaime solicita un préstamo para la compra de 2 equipos de computación para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 29 year-old man who is married and has two children, who are four and eight. His business is a cyber-café.

He is independent, very responsible and is a good father. He carries out his business in the southern region which is dominated by manufacturing and businesses of all types.

Jaime is short in stature, of medium build and dark complexion. He shares his life with his wife who also dedicates her time to this business, and with his children who are at school. They live in a brick house owned by the family which has all the basic facilities. His business is running a cyber-café. He set it up in a room in his house with two computers and a printer. He comments: "I do not have enough equipment to meet demand". The advantage of his business is that it makes daily income. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy computer equipment. His dream is to improve his business. He wants to buy two sets of computer equipment so that he can cater for more customers. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that he has been running this business.

It is for these reasons that Jaime is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy two sets of computer equipment so that he can cater for more customers.

loans.use: to buy two sets of computer equipment so he can cater for more customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is kind-hearted, well-organized, honest, industrious and entrepreneurial. Mary is a mother who makes sure her children never go to bed hungry. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. Mary never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Mary has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and learned important farming techniques. Mary practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education. Mary believes that education is the only key to success.

She is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to buy seed and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Mary wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Mary to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Mary hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Mary's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Mary is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for on her horticulture farm and have an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Lydia. She is a 30-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Lydia has been blessed with a lovely family.

For four years Lydia has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden. Any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Lydia is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming to grow crops for a better income

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of two from Chuka, a remote town in the central province of Kenya. She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Ann is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart.

Ann wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Ann will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Ann is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Ann awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
As a mother of two lovely angels, Frida's great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Frida and fills her with enthusiasm.

Frida has been practicing mixed farming for the past twelve years. On her farm, she grows maize, has two dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns.

Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. 

Frida's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Frida formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers.

Frida is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Frida is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer

All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Frida hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people who support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow

loans.name: Tete Ansanm Colombier

texts.en: Josiane is a 27-year-old leader who launched a rural organisation, two years ago, in the west Department of Haiti. In spite of taking care of her two children, she has not given up the management of the group which has 24 women and 6 men members. In 2014, she raised $721 dollars as the annual profit, after covering the expenses. The people Josiane is working with are operating very small economic activities. More than 50% of them are iron workers, 45% retailers of used clothes, and 5% small shop keepers. Josiane plays a key role in linking her group to Fonkoze to obtain credit via Zafen. The request, if granted, will help Josiane and her co-workers to cope with daily food and the transportation expenses for their children during the new school year. Moreover, they will invest 10% of their profits in housing and insurance in case of natural disaster. Josiane (middle) is pictured with Arnold (right) and Jane (left).

loans.use: to bulk-buy used clothing to retail.

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.ru: Мужчина, который не бояться трудности и всегда хочет стать успешным человеком, это Саидахмад.  Он из района Чиликул. Саидахмад родился и вырос в Чиликул, там он хорошо воспитывался. Сейчас он стал 52 летным мужчиной и у него имеется семья. Он уже стал дедом. У Саидахмад четверых сыновей. Сидахмад хочет заниматься животноводством. У него имеется коровник, корм для скота и огромное желание.  Он хочет заниматься животноводством. Саидахмад с такими планами обратился за кредитом, для купли скота. У него  не имеется денежных средств, и он решил взять кредит. За счет кредита хочет приобрести  несколько скота. Саидахмад верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Он ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: This is Saidahmad, a man who has never been afraid of difficulties and always wants to become a successful person. He is from the Jilikul region. Saidahmad was born and raised in Jilikul, where he was well educated. Now he has become a 52-year-old man and he has a family. He has already become a grandfather. Saidahmad has four sons. Saidahmad wants to rear animals. He has a cow shed, cattle feed and a great desire. With these plans, Saidahmad has applied for a loan to buy some cattle. He does not have funds, and he has decided to take a loan. He wants to buy a few cattle using hte loan. Saidahmad believes in you and in your support. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some cattle for a new animal rearing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
O senhor Mateus de 34 anos de idade é operário agrícola e comerciante, vive maritalmente a mais de 8 anos, pai de 4 filhos dos quais 1 a estudar os restantes 3 ainda menores de idade e vive na  casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  amendoim, feijão, arroz, farinha, açúcar, massas, e sardinhas para reforçar o seu negócio
O seu sonho é crescer no seu negócio, ter um estabelecimento próprio e melhorar as condições na sua casa.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros e conta com ajuda de sua esposa  que tambem e comerciante para supera-los e que com os empréstimos anteriores fez a sua actual casa e adquiriu alguns bens para o conforto familiar.
texts.en:
Mateus, 34, is a businessman and works in agriculture. He has been married for more than eight years, and is the father of four children; one of them goes to school, and three are still very young. He owns the house where he lives.

He says that with the requested amount, he is planning to buy peanuts, beans, rice, flour, sugar, different types of pasta, and sardines to strengthen his business.

His dreams are to expand his business, open his own establishment, and make some home improvements.

He says that his major challenge is financial in nature. Her wife, who is also a businesswoman, helps him to overcome them. Also, that with the previous loans he built his house and bought some goods for the comfort of his family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, beans, rice, flour sugar, different types of pasta, and sardines to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a humble and hardworking woman who has devoted a great part of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills. Judy is the mother of two children, and she has been in the agriculture business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. Judy has been relying on agriculture to make all of her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Judy remains positive and passionate about her economic activity.

Judy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This loan will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Judy will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely, since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Judy’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly. Kindly support the dream of a Kenyan woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase poultry to increase her farming business.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a hardworking farmer. He comes from the Nkubu area of Kenya where he has half an acre of farmland and keeps cattle, poultry, goats for a living. His crops are used mainly for food for his family and feed for his animals. He uses his income to meet his business and family needs. He married years ago and has 2 children.

Nicholas is seeking a loan to buy a water pipe. Due to the seasonal rainfalls, Nicholas irrigates his farm to prevent his crops from wilting and dying off. He needs to replace the piping system but he can't come up with the money required for a new pipe. Your loan will help Nicholas ensure that crop production goes on throughout the year, guaranteeing his family income and food security.

loans.use: to buy a water pipe for irrigation.

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a smallholder farmer, based in the South Rift area of Kenya. He is married and has two children.

He keeps livestock for a living and hopes to increase his herd in order to make better use of the available resources and to earn extra income.

Weldon is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The additional cow will expand his asset base and provide more income for him, which will make him more attractive to credit providers.

His plan is to rely on financial services to grow his business and elevate his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer and a good salesperson from Nandi Hills, Kenya. He raises livestock and practices crop farming for a living. Besides his core business, he generates additional income by playing a middleman in the cereal trade industry. His job is to aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell to his network of buyers at a margin.

Given that Richard can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock large volumes of cereals. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers which, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices, he will later sell at a higher price.

Income from this investment will help Richard generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 18 años y su negocio es la venta de comidas especiales.
El es buen padre, independiente y muy emprendedor. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Daniel es de baja estatura, piel morena y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Guarani y habla español. Su negocio es la venta de comidas especiales; él se encarga de vender comida a pedido y por días o semanales, cocinando para empaquetarlo en enviarlo a la hora convenida a sus clientes, “el negocio de la comida es muy amplio y siempre se abren nuevas formas de venderles a los clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la idea es innovadora, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar un horno industrial para cocinar comidas más elaboradas. Su sueño es tener un negocio reconocido. El desea comprar un horno industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a este3 negocio. 
Es por esos motivos que Daniel solicita un préstamo para la compra de un  horno industrial para agregar a su menú comidas más elaboradas.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 37-year-old man. He is married and has an 18-year-old son. He sells special food. He is a good father, and an independent and entrepreneurial man. His business is located in the south of the city, an area characterized by its manufacturing activities.

Daniel is short, has a dark complexion, and is of medium size. His mother tongue is Guarani, and he also speaks Spanish. He sells special food. He delivers his food daily or weekly. He cooks the food and packs it in order to send it to his customers on the agreed time. “The food business is very dynamic, and there’s always new ways of selling to my customers,” he says. His business has the advantage of being innovative. The disadvantage is that he lacks the capital he needs to buy an industrial oven to cook better food. His dream is to have a popular business.

He wants to buy an industrial oven. This is his first loan from the institution in three years that he has been in business. This is why Daniel is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven to offer better food in his menu.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven, and be able to offer better food in his menu.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Practicing mixed farming on her farm is what keeps Salome’s hopes alive since her dream is to succeed, improve her economic situation, and be able to support her family. She considers working hard and perseverance to be the most important things in life. She works tirelessly for eight hours every day to earn her livelihood.

Salome is a small dairy, crop and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her goats. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand.

Salome is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Macdalena

texts.en:
Macdalena’s objective is to improve her quality of life and live a dignified life. These objectives prompted her to begin mixed farming. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk and different varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is, “the increased profits I enjoy”. Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry and build poultry structures. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging. With the assistance of institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved. She will be able to buy more poultry and her poultry will have a comfortable place to stay in. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy poultry and build poultry structures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, age 50, is hopeful and happy at the idea that she can change her future and that of her family. She resides in Chuka, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Dorcas enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Dorcas has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Dorcas will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.
You can help this strong willed woman to do great things in her farming business and her life. A loan can do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is an energetic and beautiful, young 28-year-old woman. Born in a rural area, she has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since she was a little girl, she has demonstrated her talents and knack for the farming business.

In 2010, Ann ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Five years down the line, Ann is deep into commercial dairy, poultry, and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments has helped elevate the quality of life led by her children, who are in school.

Ann has a big heart and always thinks about her family. Ann wants to apply for financial assistance to expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Ann will find your loan very handy.

With the KES 65,000, she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is an enterprising woman, intelligent, responsible, and capable. She lives in a rural area in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area high in poverty but full of enterprising people who, with knowledge and attitude, will, and enthusiasm want to be successful. She is 43 years old and a proud mother of angelic-looking children who she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Ruth is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Ruth practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows.

Although Ruth has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Ruth will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Through this loan, Ruth will be able to expand her horticulture business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change.

With your loan, Ruth will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children a proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Esiter

texts.en:
Esiter is a diligent smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is married and has five children. She practices both livestock and crop farming for a living.

Esiter is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle for transporting goods to and from the market. With a motorcycle, Esiter will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better than the local markets.

Increase in income from this intervention will help Esiter to scale up her business and improve the quality of life being led by her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер прекрасный человек  с открытой душой. Отец троих детей. Алишер  просто хороший человек, на которого можно положиться. Ему 39 лет. Алишер из района Пяндж. Он там же живет со своей семьей и детьми. В Пяндже прекрасная погода, свежий воздух, есть все условия для развития растениеводство и животноводство. Он 15 лет занимается растениеводством, и этим он хочет в дальнейшем заняться. Ему бы хотелось купить минеральные удобрение для обработки землю, но только финансы не позволяют. И поэтому Алишер просит в займы. Он хочет, чтобы получить качественный и богатый урожай. Ваша поддержка поможет  достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Alisher is a wonderful man with an open heart. He is the father of three children. Alisher is simply a good person, who you can rely on. He is 39 years old. Alisher is from the Pyandj region. He lives there with his family and children. The weather in Pyandj is great, the air is fresh and all the conditions for field crop cultivation and livestock breeding are in place.

Alisher has worked with field crop cultivation for 15 years, and he wants to continue this in the future. He would like to purchase mineral fertilizers to process the land, however he does not have enough money. Therefore Alisher applied for a loan. He would like to get a rich, high quality harvest. Your support will allow him to reach his goal.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim, 37 years old mother of three children, lives in a rural area of Kamchay Mear District, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works as a farmer on a small rice field near her house. Until now, it is more than ten years that she has been involving in this career which allows her to make USD 4 per day.

Yim would like to get loan from HKL, that is the first loan. for her to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Yim thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda who is in her late 50s is married with three kids, who are grown up.  She has been running a grocery business for fifteen years now.  She works from 08am to 04pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 
 
This will be Hilda’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the drinks in her grocery store and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.   She used the profit to repay a loan, bought a plot of land, bought a TV set and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the grocery store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Hilda will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her grocery store.

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 meses y otro de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la localidad de ‘el torno’ área rural de acopio de la producción agrícola local. 
Mary es morena de cabello negro y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (sentada, sostiene a su bebé). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja la tierra y con sus hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica.  El deseo por mejorar su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; moto taxi, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa usada, artesanía en cuero, venta de semillas, servicio de lavandería y venta de carne de pollo. Su negocio es la venta de verduras, como; zapallo, yuca, lechugas y otros, “inicié vendiendo ambulantemente, ahora deseo vender por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las verduras se venden a diario, la desventaja es que se deben vender antes de que se marchiten. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos, ella desea realizar la compra de verduras por mayor para comercializarlos en verdulerías particulares de la ciudad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras por mayor para comercializarlas en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mary, 36, lives with her husband and has two children, a six-month-old and a 12-year-old. She's a good mother, tenacious and very patient. Mary (seated and holding her baby) is short and dark with black hair. Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, a farmer, and her children, the oldest of whom attends school. They live in their own house, which is made of wood and only has electricity.

Mary's business is selling vegetables. She runs her business in a market in the town of El Torno, a rural collection center for local agricultural production.

A desire to improve her business motivated her to form a bank with people with businesses: motorcycle taxi, food sales, soft drink sales, used clothing sales, leather crafts, seed sales, laundry services, and chicken meat sales. Her business is selling pumpkin, yuca, lettuce, and other vegetables. "I started selling as a street vendor. Now I want to sell wholesale," she said. The advantage of her business is that vegetables sell every day. The disadvantage is that they have to be sold before they go bad.

She wants to buy vegetables wholesale to sell in produce shops in the city. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the seven years she has been in this line of work.

Her dream is to improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale to sell in the city

loans.name: Los Hijos De Dios Group

texts.es:
Gabriela continúa con su negocio de venta de fideo. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de fideo por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. En esta oportunidad la banca es liderada por:
Beatriz es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 10, 12, 15 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan.
Ella es buena madre, generosa y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ área rural que se encarga del acopio de la producción del campo para su distribución en la ciudad.
Beatriz es morena de cabello gris y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada a la izquierda, viste chamarra gris). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de pan; ella se ocupa de preparar la harina para hornearlo en forma de pan y venderla, “lo bueno de este trabajo es que no se puede parar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harina por quintal. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea comprar harina de yuca, maíz y trigo por quintal. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 2 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por quintal.
texts.en:
Gabriela continues selling noodles. He used the loan she received to buy noodles in bulk. She paid the installments according to plan because she did not have any problem. This time, the group is led by:

Beatriz, a 50-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has four children aged 10, 12, 15, and 17. She sells bread. She is a good mother, and a generous and enterprising woman. She works in “El Torno,” a rural area where agricultural produce are gathered and sent to the city.

Beatriz has a dark complexion and gray hair. She is chubby. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she also speaks Spanish. She is seated to the left, and is wearing a gray sweater. She shares her life with her partner, who works, and her children, who go to school. They own the house where they live, which is built with wood and is only served with electricity.

She sells bread. She prepares the flour to bake it and sell the bread. “What I like about this job is that I can’t stop,” she says. She sells her bread every day, which is an advantage. The disadvantage is that she lacks the capital she needs to buy flour by the quintal. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

She wants to buy cassava, corn, and wheat flour by the quintal. This is her second loan from the institution in two years that she has been in business. This is why Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy different types of flour by the quintal.

loans.use: to buy different types of flour by the quintal.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 6 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘uyustus’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. 
Elsa es de piel morena, baja estatura y cabello negro. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a l comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños, como, vestidos, pantalones, buzos, poleras, chalecos y otros, “mi madrina vende ropa e iniciamos el negocio, ya cuento con clientes continuos y me quiero independizar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa en su barrio, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial para independizarse y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elsa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para independizarse.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 27-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has an eight-year-old son and a six-year-old daughter. She earns a living making children's clothing.

She is a good mother, patient, and very kind. She runs her business in the Uyustus area, which is known for its informal trade.

Elsa is short. She has a tanned complexion and black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who is a merchant, and her children, who go to school. They live in a rented house, which is made of brick and is equipped with basic utilities.

She runs a business making children's clothing such as dresses, pants, tracksuits, T-shirts, vests, and other items. "My godmother sells clothing, and we started a business. I already have a customer base, and I would like to become independent," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has a customer base, but the disadvantage is that she lacks the money to buy an industrial sewing machine.

Her dream is to open a clothing store in her neighbourhood. 

She wants to buy an industrial sewing machine to become independent and fulfill her pending orders.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been following this occupation.

For these reasons, Elsa is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can become independent.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can become independent.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is a 30-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five children ages 12, 11, nine, seven and four years old. She is engaged in mat weaving business to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and works hard to help her husband to provide the needs of their family. Thus, Janice is requesting a loan to buy materials like “buri leaves” (the largest palm of the Philippines) and colored dye. In the future, she wishes to have her own capital to run her business.

loans.use: to buy buri leaves and colored dye

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 26 year old cereal trader at Voi Kenya. She is a married mother of one whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last seven years doing well.

This is her second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after repaying back her loan well she will use the money to purchase maize, beans,green grams for resale and the anticipated profit to purchase more stock during this harvest seasons, she hopes to grow this business more more in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, green grams for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells electronics and phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics and phone accessories. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics and phone accessories.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman, with 3 children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of materials. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have increased profits within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a smallholder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya.

She practices maize farming for subsistence. Her income is seasonal and comes from selling maize/corn. Evaline wants to diversify her farm by starting an activity that will complement crop farming and generate regular income.

She is seeking a loan to buy sheep. Sheep will not only do well in the mountainous area where she comes from, but they will also provide her with wool and meat for income.

Evaline plans to see how the first loan will work out before she makes up her mind to go for a second one which will be used to scale the business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 28 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband.

Sarah has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began five years ago.

Sarah, tired of working just to survive, wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Sarah’s family, and a commodity for trade.

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Sarah, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting, and for feeding her family.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Murugi is a typical village in the Chuka area of Kenya where people living there suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Esther, a mother of three, has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses.

The Chuka area has high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Esther finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary mum, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Sros's Group

texts.en: Sros’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sros makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид трудолюбивый и ответственный дехканин. Он сам работает на своей земле и кормит свою семью своим нажитом трудом. Абдувохид 56 лет. У него  жена и четверых детей. Несмотря на свой возраст, он трудится все время, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Абдувохид на своем земельном участке выращивает кукуруза. Он готовится осеннему посеву. И для посева нужны средства, которых у него нет, поэтому он срочно нуждается в деньгах. Абдувохид за счет кредита хочет купить семена лук, морковь, картофель и минеральные удобрение.
texts.en:
Abduvohid is a hardworking and responsible dekhan farmer. He works on his land and feeds his family through his work. Abduvohid is 56 years old. He has a wife and four children. Despite his age he works all the time in order to feed his family.

Abduvohid grows sweet corn on his plot of land. He is preparing for the the fall sowing, and he needs money for the sowing, which he doesn't have. Therefore he urgently needs money. Abduvohid would like to use the money to purchase seeds of onion, carrots and potatoes, as well as mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of onion, carrots and potatoes, as well as mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop.

loans.name: Liela

texts.en: Liela is 38 years old, married with 3 school age kids. She is in retailing business of various consumable goods and household products. She finds this type of business easy to sell because it is basic to simple households. Recently, she asks from Paglaum MPC an amount for additional capitalization. The loaned amount of PHP 14,900.00 will be used to restock store with canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent powder & bar, bath soap, shampoo and others.

loans.use: to restock store with canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent powder & bar, bath soap, shampoo and others

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is 61 years old. She is a smallholder farmer based in Nandihills, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. The adversity that has followed her has not been an obstacle for this woman to leave her dreams behind and want to succeed. For four years, Selly has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. 

Despite prevailing animal diseases, Selly finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Selly is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seeds to start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. She has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Irene is one of the hardest-working women on planet earth. She is a 48-year-old go-getter from Kapsara, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Irene has defied all the odds and has farmed for five years. Her primary sources of income are growing crops and raising animals. She earns additional income through a side hustle business.

Irene is content with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman. She hasn't had formal employment but always worked hard on her farm to provide her children and family with decent meals. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging. Irene feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. Irene is well disciplined with finances and she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Irene so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jazmin Elizabeth

texts.en:
Jazmin is a 42 year old happily married woman who has two daughters, but neither she or her husband provide for them, since both are now married and live with their new families. Her biggest happiness is knowing that her daughters have been able to get a good life of their own and know their are both married.

Jazmin supports her house by selling catchpenny jewelry and she also sell silver stuff. Her business is completely legitimate. She informs her client that the jewelry is replica. Anyway, she has managed to create a successful business, that has provided for her a house in harsh times.

Her business has an increasing demand and she has been struggling to meet with it. In order to solve the current situation she is looking for a 15,750.00 loan. With this she will be able to buy silver and restock and buy some rough materials to create more catchpenny products.

loans.use: to stock and buy rough material

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
For many years, dairy farming has been Jane's economic activity. She loves her job and hopes to expand her dairy business in the years to come. When she is not working, she is a committed housewife and a mother to 3 children. She was raised in Nandi Hills area of Kenya where she now lives with her husband, who is also a farmer.  
Currently, she is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family decent diets and better income. 
She loves to feed people and that is why she finds her business fulfilling. Your loan will help her elevate her livelihood by producing more food for her family and others in the community.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Zouhera

texts.fr: Zouhera est âgée de 45 ans et est une femme mariée. Zouhera vit avec ses trois enfants et son mari à Agoè où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs accompagner des gâteaux pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Zouhera s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et de la farine du blé en vue de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et pouvoir ainsi aider son mari à  promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Zouhera is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three  children in Agoè. Zouhera prepares corn porridge for sale, also selling cakes to better meet her customers' needs. Zouhera stocks up three times a month at the market. She is applying for this loan to order bags of corn and wheat flour in order to make a good profit margin and be able to help her husband provide for their children's education and household needs.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn and one bag of wheat.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a rural smallholder farmer from central Kenya. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She does dairy and crop farming for a living. Her income sources are milk, maize, and bananas.

Anna is seeking a loan to buy a water storage tank. The tank is easy to install and will serve Anna's residence and farm with fresh and clean water for years to come. She will also save a lot by harvesting rainwater.

Through this loan, Anna will have enough water stored for her home and farm use during dry periods.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Zulfizor

texts.ru:
Зулфизору 36 лет. Она разведенная женщина и мать двоих одного ребенка. Зулфизор добрая и гостеприимная женщина. Она около 10 лет занимается земледелием.
   В этом году Зулфизор посадила морковь и картофель. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Зулфизор надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить удобрения. Но на такое количество удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Зулфизор верит в Вас и Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfizor is 36 years old. She is a divorced woman and the mother of two children. Zulfizor is a good and welcoming woman. She has worked with field crop cultivation for around 10 years. This year Zulfizor sowed carrots and potatoes. There is still a little time left before the harvest. 

Currently Zulfizor needs to process the land with mineral fertilizers. She plans to get a rich and high quality harvest, and therefore she would like to purchase fertilizers. However she does not have enough money for this amount of harvest. She requests a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. Zulfizor trusts in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam was raised in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she now lives with her husband and two children and conducts her business. She does dairy and horticulture farming and has been successful in growing the value of the business over the years.

Currently, she is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family a decent diet and better income. The additional land will also provide more grazing area for her animals.

She loves to feed people and that is why she finds her business fulfilling. Your loan will help her elevate her livelihood by producing more food for her family and others in the community.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is an ever-smiling rural farmer in Kitale, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is blessed with a lovely family, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. On her farm she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize, and when she is not farming Jesca does some side hustle business. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!"

Today, Jesca is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Jesca is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and livelihood.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow to increase her herd and plan for zero-grazing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Lydia, a rural smallholder mixed-farmer from Central Kenya. She is married to a local businessman and they have three children. Lydia is looking to start a side business for extra income and she has the perfect idea that she needs your help to implement.

Lydia is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to aggregate cereal produce from other rural farmers. Once she has built a stock, she plans to sell the produce to wholesale buyers and retail outlets at a sustainable profit margin. Income from this investment will be used to clear the loan obligation and what remains will be rolled back into the business for growth.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is a smallholder farmer from Central Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. His wife completed advanced diploma and does farming too. They live in a modest home which seats on a 2.4 acre farmland and is connected to the power grid. 
Obadiah is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to install a bio-gas system and finalize the construction of a cowshed. Even though his home has electricity connection, Obadiah believes that bio-gas will effectively produce clean, non-polluting, and low cost fuel from dung and other organic waste on his farm. Part of the loan will also be used to improve on the cowshed's drainage system so that organic waste can collect in the bio-gas chamber. 
Juhudi Kilimo urges lenders to help promote entrepreneurs, like Obadia, who are investing in clean and renewable energy in order to improve their living standards and environment. This loan will help Obadiah's family to improve sanitation and, in a small way, reduce the pressure on forests.

loans.use: to install a bio-gas system and build a cowshed.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He practices livestock and crop farming to make a living and provide for his family. Much of his income goes to household expenses.  
The challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Enock is facing is poor access to transportation services. Enock is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 
With the motorcycle, Enock will be able to distribute his produce far and wide. His business will benefit from new business networks and opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Almost all the farmers in Africa struggle to make their way in this world because of unemployment and lack of financing from established financial institutions. This is true for Florence, 32, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya and is a loving mother. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8 and 12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Florence is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.
You can help Florence to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael at 30 years old works as a smallholder farmer. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 5 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Abigael has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Abigael mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. 

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Abigael is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Abigael is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Abigael feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Abigael will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.
Like Abigael, many poor smallholder farmers await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, microfinance institutions (M.F.I.s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Emmy, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 40 years of age. She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of five lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Emmy’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandi Hills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Emmy’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Emmy has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Emmy is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 28 years of age, dedicated body and soul to her farming business and to her husband. She resides in Nandi Hills, Kenya.

She has been practicing farming for five years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Jackline enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Jackline has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Jackline will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

You can help this devoted mother to accomplish her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
With four children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Rose, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in. 

Rose is seeking a loan worth 50,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Rose access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Rose’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Rose!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in central province of Kenya. Dairy farming to Stephen is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been doing dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.
Stephen is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies. 
The impact this loan will have on Stephen and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation, and increase in income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, he also does dairy, poultry, and tree farming for extra food and income. His highest expenses are food and his children's education.

Erick is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to plant and enhance his farm’s fertility, for higher productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Erick’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a woman with all the spirit for work, who resides in a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. For the past five years, Margaret has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been planting different varieties of crops and some personal business she engages in to earn additional income. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Margaret passionately loves dairy farming. Villagers have nicknamed her Mrs. Cow. Margaret sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing the milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it is a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This milk production will immediately translate to increased profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan. The extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Margaret is very visionary, and she intends to start adding value to her milk business. All that she patiently waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. His highest annual expense is food and education.   
The major challenge that Jacob is facing is poor access to transportation services. Jacob is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 
With the motorcycle, Jacob will be able to distribute his produce in new locations far from his home. Your loan investment will enable Jacob to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce, grow interdependent relationships and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a farm transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a smallholder farmer practicing livestock and crop farming to make a living. Her husband is a teacher and together they were blessed with four children. She enjoys farming for it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Nkubu area of Kenya, where Gladys is from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Nkubu now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Gladys is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is an experienced 53-year-old woman. She is a person who has battled to get ahead throughout her life. She is based in Siongiroi, which is a small rural town in the south rift of Kenya. Anna and her husband have been blessed with a lovely family. She is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. Anna is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Anna has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Anna mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Anna is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Anna is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Anna feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Anna will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her children and siblings of a secure future.
You can help this lady to achieve her ambition - make a loan, please.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for timely delivery of her farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Jane, a young rural smallholder farmer doing livestock and crop farming for a living. She is married to a local businessman and has two children. She makes a decent income from farming but needs to make more if she is to meet the growing demands of her family.

Jane is seeking a loan of KES 15,000 to buy cereal produce from local farmers. Her plan is to sell the same produce but at a higher price in a distant market which offers better prices.

If the first round works out well, she will take a second loan to scale her business. Having an alternative source of income will generate more income for her family and spread business-related risks.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a smallholder farmer doing livestock and crop farming for a living. Her husband farms too and together they have three children in their teens. Her family enjoys farming because it provides them with the basic necessities of life. Jane keeps cattle and goats and grows tea, maize/corn and bananas.

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production and control weeds and pests through the application of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna and her family live and work on a half an acre farm in the Kitale area of Kenya. She's married and has four children. Lorna keeps dairy cattle and grows crops such as maize, vegetables and fodder. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home.

The biggest growth constraint for Lorna is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests.

With your lending, Lorna will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of sewing and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Asia, because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts.
