He wants to meet the demand of bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Asia humbly has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Asia is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello lender! Meet Catherine, a youthful 20-year-old mum and a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chuka, in the Central region of Kenya. Catherine is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with a lovely child. For the past five years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, fruits, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Catherine has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family" she said. Catherine mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Catherine is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she suffers so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Catherine is going to achieve her dream and goals through this loan. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Catherine feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Catherine will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and increase her income level. Catherine is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Catherine will improve her living conditions and assure her child and of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a 59 years-old, guardian of agricultural products warehouse from Ungheni region in Moldova. He is married and has 3 children and 5 grandchildren. Mihail has worked for 20 years as a mechanic and 4 years as a driver.

Additionally, he has established a small farm. His wife Elena is disabled and Mihail is forced to work alone at his farm. Now, he grows corn and raises ducks, gooses and chickens for all his big family.

Mihail wants to purchase a mill for grinding corn for his domestic animals and to grant service to grind for other villagers.
This loan will help Mihai to increase his income and improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mill for grinding corn.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Mrs. Thuan is 44 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are  main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity  and  selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Uno Group

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad caracterizada por su creciente producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Rosalia es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (al centro, lleva una cartera blanca). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de micro y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Los deseos por cumplir sus metas la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocio como; venta de comida, venta de telas, confección de sombreros, artesanía en cuero, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de empanadas. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos por catálogo, ella se encarga de buscar clientes en oficinas y sitios comerciales para venderles zapatos a pedido por catálogo, “camino largas distancias bajo el sol porque cuento con muchos clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que conoce muchos clientes, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de zapatos, ella desea comprar zapatos por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos por mayor para entregar a sus clientes por catálogo.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 34 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has two children of 10 and 16 years of age. Her business is shoe sales. She is an entrepreneur, a good mother, and a very hard worker.

She carries out her business in the southern zone of the city which is characterized by its growing manufacturing production in all the areas. Rosalia has tan skin, is short in stature and has a medium physique. Her native tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (she is in the middle carrying a white purse). She shares her life with her partner who works as a minibus driver and with her children who are both in school. They live in their own home which is made of wood and counts on the basic services.

The desire to meet her goals lead her to form a bank of persons with a business like food sales, fabric sales, hat making, leather craft-work, baby clothes sales, drink sales, a bookstore, and empanada sales. Her business is catalog shoe sales. She takes charge of looking for customers in offices and places of business to sell them shoes by placing orders through a catalog. She comments, "I walk long distances under the sun because I rely on a lot of customers..." The advantage of her business is that she knows many clients and the disadvantage is the competition. Her dream is to open a shoe store.

She wishes to buy shoes wholesale. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that she has done this work. It is for these reasons that Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale through a catalog to deliver to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale through a catalog to deliver to her clients.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima runs a hog-fattening business in Dipolog City. She is 74 years old and married with one adult-aged child. She was able to support her only child in school until it graduated from college and landed a good job. She is grateful to Paglaum MPC which provides her with the needed financial support for her business. Recently she requested a loan to purchase additional bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Surrya

texts.en:
Surrya is 32 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeup services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color and lotion for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zareen

texts.en:
Zareen is 48, living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

Zareenis very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more milk in bulk for her husband's milk selling shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 24-year-old smallholder farmer from a small rural town in North Rift, Kenya. She is married and has a child. Her husband runs a small hardware shop and she does dairy and crop farming to produce food and generate a bit of income for her family.

Rose is seeking a loan to buy important farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, herbicides and pesticides. With your loan, she will have enough supplies for the coming crop season. Certified quality seeds and fertilizers will reduce the odds of crop failure due to diseases and climatic conditions just as quality herbicides and pesticides will reduce destruction of crops and produce due to weeds and pests.

Income generated from this business will help grow her business and settle household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 40 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic headlight and accessories of motorbikes. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw material. He also manufactures the small metallic spare parts of motorbike. 
Due to inflation; he wants to increase his production so he can provide better living facilities to his family. Due to low savings and inflation; he does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw material for manufacturing additional spare parts.

Therefore, Nargis has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crushed plastic raw material and metal for manufacturing motorbike's spare parts. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of each of her children, including their school fees, diet and health. For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses. 

Nargis is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic and metallic raw materials for her husband's motorbike's spare parts manufacturing business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Meet Rose, a rural smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. Rose is married to a fellow farmer and has six children. Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. However, they are involved in other agricultural activities such as growing bananas, vegetables, fruits and cereals.

The biggest problem being faced by farmers from Nkubu is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from Nkubu like Rose now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Rose is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sa Ath

texts.en: Sa ath, a young farmer, lives with mother in Chhoung Preal village that is far away from power grid. Beside farming, Sa ath works in a factory to earn fix income for family.  Farming over 30 years, Sa ath's mother still helps her does farming. Sa ath wants her mother to live in better condition. However, her house is in off power grid area. She and her mother have to take turn going to charge battery every 2 or 3 days. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, Sa ath decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home energy. She believes solar home energy can enhance her family living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Mrs. Nhi is 34 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store and requested a loan through QBWDF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.She  has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
As a farmer generation, Em living with husband and a child continues her family business. She is a hard working farmer. She and her husband always get up early to prepare their equipment to do farming. They put all their effort in order to make their family live in better condition.

However, their current power won’t make them achieve his goal. It is a money and time consuming. Em has to go to charge battery every 2 or 3 days. After she finds out that solar energy is the source he needs, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for good quality solar home systems. She believes solar home system can reduce her burden and make her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Kampong Basrov Village, Chhulsa Commune, Chhulkiri

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam is 53 years old, married. There are three people in her family. She has been practicing agro-forestry for the last 15 years. She wants to apply for her loan to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming. She has also earns additional income chicken raising activity. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hope is to improve family living standards. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming.

loans.name: Samphas

texts.en:
Samphas and husband live in Chhoung Preal village with 2 children. Samphas works as factory worker in near by village and spend some free time helping her husband farming. In early morning, she gets up early to feed the pigs and prepare equipment for her husband to go to farm. Samphas needs a reliable energy to light her house and her feeding farm. She is not happy with her current energy since it's a time and money consuming. She has go spend time and money go to charge the battery every 2 or 3 days.

As a result, Samphas decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy reliable solar home energy. She believe this device can help her runs business smoothly and reduces the utility cost.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La socia Zenobia  pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de  venta de comida,  la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua elaborando diversos platos para su clientes que le solicitan como arroz con pollo, saltados, sopas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia Zenobia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, carnes, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco" communal bank and continues to work at her business selling cooked meals. Zenobia is responsible and continues to produce various dishes for her customers, including chicken and rice, stir fries, soups and more. Zenobia has had the business for some time, and it is going well thanks to her perseverance at the business every day. Zenobia wants to continue with this business in order to keep on supporting her family.

Zenobia is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

Zenobia is applying for this loan in order to buy oil, meats, pastas and more.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, pasta and more.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia Honorata continua con su negocio de  tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende lo que son  productos  de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la  socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
La socia Honorata se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Honorata continues working at her grocery shop. She sells staple products, such as rice, sugar, pasta and more. She has had the business for some time, and it is going well thanks to her perseverance at the business every day. This business allows Honorata to move forward with her family.

Honorata is applying for a loan in order to buy rice and sugar.

Honorata is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda has been in the farming business for almost 19 years. She is financed by Paglaum MPC. She's having good fortune with it and has managed her account well.

Roseminda expanded her farming activities very recently; she's into vegetable farming. In order to have sufficient inventory of fertilizers, she has asked for a loan from the cooperative. The amount will be used to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and compost

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 42 years old, is married and a resident of Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market.

Nida joined Paglaum MPC to avail herself of a loan because she wanted to buy more fish. But aside from financial assistance she received, she says that she also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Aldiojojan

texts.en:
Aldiojojan has actively driven and sent passengers to designated areas safely. He has been doing this for many years. It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too. Recently, he took a loan to renew licenses and registration of his motor vehicle. The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately.

With this loan, Aldiojojan is expecting to pursue his job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to his customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: to renew licenses and registration of his motorcycle

location.town: P-4, SAN VICENTE BAJO, OROQ. CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some ingredients such as; rice, cooking oil, soy sauce, noodle, etc

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
At the age of 44, Oun, who is married and blessed with five children, is a resident from Kampong Cham province where rice-growing business has been running as the main business for 26 years. Sometimes, Oun works for others for a fee to supplement income. This family’s income is about USD13 per day and Oun can save about USD6 each day after daily expenses.

The challenge to her farming business is to harvest lower-than-expected outputs caused by water shortage.
Oun is now leading a group member to apply for a loan which will be her second cycle with VisionFund. Previous loan has enabled her to improve her living standard gradually. For this new loan, it will be used to boost the crop yields by purchasing rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer. She hopes to generate more income to achieve her dream of buying a motorcycle and buying an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to boost the crop yields by purchasing rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province, Samnang is 24 years old and a mother of one kid. She is a carpenter and this is her main single source of her income. She can save her daily income to support her family about 2.5 USD per day and she has been with this business for ages.

She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and this is her third micro loan. The previous loans, her family’s business has improved gradually. She leads a group of two to seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy more paint to support her business to get more income for her family. She wishes that she can earn more income to expand her business to be bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy color paint to support on her business to get more income to improve her family's living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick resides in Calamba with his family. Patrick has for many years owned and operated a transport service to earn a living. He was able to support the needs of his family's daily needs and was able to send his children in school. Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle used for the transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future

loans.use: repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Shabnam has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, she has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw and its body with the contribution of savings.
Shabnam is a 35-year-old woman, living with her four children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw and its body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells precious artificial jewelry for rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case, for the attraction of customers.

He is the family's sole source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy precious artificial jewelry, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy precious jewelry for her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin's cafeteria has been improving after taking his previous loan used for the business. He offers more viands to his customers and it was really earning well. He has successfully repaid his previous loan and now he want to expand his business.

Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell as well as additional utensils to cater to his increasing number of customers. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell as well as additional utensils to cater to his increasing number of customers.

location.town: P-6, POBLACION 2, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita’s variety store business is continually growing. She considered Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders participating in the Kiva program as God’s medium of blessing to her. She is thankful for the financial assistance she had previously received. She used the amount to buy grocery items for her variety store business, and as a result, she was able to attract more customers.

For eight years until now, she has the business and able to support her children’s educational expenses. However, Anecita doesn’t have her own place to run the business and she really wanted to no longer lease for a space.

Anecita is not satisfied about the recent status of the business as she always think of ways on how to step-up. To increase her revenue, Anita applied for a loan of Php 19,000. Some of the amount will be used as a revolving fund while the remaining for added grocery items, breads, bottled drinks and other products for her variety store business.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Anecita spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
When you look at Phillis, 86 she is the true definition of a hard worker . She is a farmer in Nkubu. Phillis is involved in maize, poultry, and dairy farming. She engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Phillis also grows bananas for food and sales.

These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which, in fact, she does. Phillis is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has been in the farming business for at least 10 years.

She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. With your loan, she will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her grandchildren’s education. Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: (86) to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Almost all the farmers in Africa struggle to make their way in this world because of unemployment and lack of financing from established financial institutions. This is true for Jane, 54, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is a loving mother.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past fifteen years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8 and 12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Jane is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a rural, smallholder farmer from the eastern part of Kenya. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Lucy does mixed farming and cereal trading. As a cereal trader, she acts as a go-between, connecting buyers and sellers and arranging logistics.

Through her connections, she can arrange a sale more easily and in bigger quantities than regular. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy more cereals from farmers because she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce in order to make sustainable returns. The money will help her to meet the basic needs of her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy farm cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Electina

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Electina, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 69 years of age. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of seven lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Electina’s primary source of income has been selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 25 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Kitale area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Electina has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Electina is quite visionary and with her accumulated profits hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Joanito

texts.en: Joanito built his house a few years ago, but now his funds are not sufficient to buy more materials to complete his house. He has plans to plaster, post doors, and install a window. Juanito is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to purchase the materials and complete his house. He will buy more materials such as sand, cement, nails, a window, a pinto, and other materials to use. Juanito is very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because he hopes this will allow him to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, nails, a window, a pinto, and other materials.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a rural smallholder farmer from Kerugoya, Kenya. His wife does farming too. He has 2 adult children and 1 is still in school. Timothy's main income sources are milk, eggs, vegetables and coffee. Last year, he successfully serviced a KES 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo and this year, he applied for more.

Timonthy is seeking a KES 60,000 loan to buy poultry and construct a cowshed. He will use half the amount to buy at least 50 heads of poultry and the other half to buy building materials for the construction of a shelter for his farm animals.
This investment will not only increase Timothy's asset base and income but also improve animal husbandry practices on his farm.

loans.use: to buy poultry and construct a cowshed

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
45-year-old Tapasi lives with her four children (two sons and two daughters) and husband in a rural village in Khagrabari in Coochbihar district. She is a very hardworking woman. After managing her household work she involves herself in Bidi binding work to earn more money to support the family. Her husband is involved with a vegetable business. All of her children are studying in different grades.

Tapasi’s elder daughter Paromita is 19 years old and she is pursuing her bachelor degree from Coochbehar Mahila College. She is studying very hard to get a good result in her upcoming exam. Tapasi wants to provide good education to all of her children. But their income is not sufficient for the six-member family, thus to bear education costs for four children is too difficult for them.

But Tapasi is very determined to give support to her daughter Paromita, as she badly needs books and the help of private tutor to score good marks in her upcoming examination. Thus Tapasi applied for a loan to Kiva via BJS.

The loan amount will utilize for purchasing books and study materials, paying exam fees, college fees, enrolling her in a good private coaching classes etc.
Tapasi and her daughter Paromita (as in the photo standing side by side) are very thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to bear the cost of a Bachelor degree education for her daughter.

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en: Chheang’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chheang works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jeanisita

texts.en:
Jeanisita operates a grocery store that sells assorted goods. She works hard every day in order to provide income for her family and improve their living situation.

Jeanisita is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. This will allow her to increase her sales.

Jeanisita's goal is to develop her business and increase her profits so she can repair her house and ensure a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa has been earning well by selling her vegetables in the market. For more than six years, it covered her daily expenditures, and she considered it as the main source of income. Nimfa successfully repaid her previous loan for she is earning well from these activities.

Recently, she took a new loan for the purpose of buying new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her vegetable farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest

location.town: P3, Nangcaan, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 43 year old woman, a environmentally conscious housewife, and a mother to three teenagers. Economic necessity has driven her to seek alternatives to generate an income that complements what her husband generates to maintain the household. She is a farmer in Nkubu. She engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Lilian also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which, in fact, she does.

Lilian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative.

However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. With your loan, Lilian will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams! A loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
The only thing on Purity’s mind is success; she is a mother at the moment. She has to work hard and always stay strong through all of the adversities that may arise. Purity is a youthful, 31-year-old farmer from Kanyakine, a remote village in Nkubu area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. According to residents, the people of Kanyakine are forgotten or ignored by the county government of Nkubu. But within the remote village of Kanyakine Purity is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions.
She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, which is in the central region of Kenya. Purity is blessed with one child. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables.

Purity also has dairy cows. Purity has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family“.

Purity joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

She applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Purity is from a remote village that has poor roads, poor terrain and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market.

This loan will help Purity to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Purity feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

The benefits of this loan will be astronomical, because Purity will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivering her produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Purity is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with the farm work. Purity will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

Kindly lend to Purity to keep her big smile because she believes that it takes someone to help someone!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her deliver her perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Nkubu, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of endless rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean house Ann has been able to raise two children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming Ann can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m. she arises to go to her farm in the remote village of Nkumbo. Because of her great knowledge of farming, farmers from her village view her as a mentor. Listening to her referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake her for an Agricultural Extension Officer.

Demand for beef cattle has been high and Ann wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality breed of beef cow. Beef farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Ann has already identified the breed of beef cow that she wants. Ann always says that, “To become a successful beef farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” Marketing of her beef cattle to butcheries and slaughter houses will not be a challenge, because she will sell the beef directly to the market and also to big slaughtering houses. Through the loan, Ann will not only benefit from income, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Ann has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via KIVA are there to make her dream come true. Ann chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Ann underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Ann plans to permanently improve her living conditions, and to secure the future of her school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. She plans that through increased income, she will be able to buy more beef cows and build a slaughter house.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of beef cow.

loans.name: Sody's Group

texts.en: Sody is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in high school and the youngest one is still too young for school. Sody lives in the Chhloung district of Kratie province. For 21 years, she has been growing cassava to support her family. Moreover, she works as a labor for others to get more income. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Sody leads a group of four to request a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pesticide to support her cassava farm to increase her crop yield. She wishes she could get more income to improve her living condition in the future and to support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her income to save for her children's educational costs.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and equally responsible for all of them.
She belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses.

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, and iron's rods to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Asiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.
She is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Khoteja

texts.en:
Khoteja is a hardworking woman of Khagrabari who works hard to meet the daily needs of her family. Her husband is a mason who also engaged himself to meet the household requirements. She is 30 years old and a mother of two daughters. One of her daughters, Babli, is 18 years old and reads in grade 11 at Kalabagan High School.

Khoteja looks after her children and engages in bidi-binding work in her spare time. The small income she and her husband derive from their work hardly meets their household requirements. It is difficult for them to manage the educational fees of their elder daughter due to their low income.

Her daughter Babli got good marks in her Secondary Board Exam and wants to do better in the coming examinations. So, she wants to join coaching classes for proper guidance. She also needs different reference books and other education materials so that she can pass out, securing good marks. She has a dream to be a teacher in the future.

So, Khoteja is applying for an education loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. With the loan, she will bear all educational expenses without any delay so that her daughter Babli can join the new session on time and can continue her further education.

Khoteja and Babli (in the photo) are very happy for the loan and convey thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education in grade 11.

loans.name: Mareza

texts.en:
Maresa is a 34 years old, married and has 3 children to provide for. To earn a living and able to help her husband in providing for her family, she is engaged in rice production. She plants rice and sells it in the market. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of our commodities and so that she can support the needs of her children in sending them in school.

She gained access from GDMPC and asking for a financial assistance to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm, so that she can produce a good quality of rice and can deliver more rice that will generate more income.

Maresa plan for the future to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has been earning for her grocery store for many years. In fact, she was able to repaid his loan back to GDMPC. She was able to help her child in buying the food supplement of her grand daughter. She aims to increase her income so she decided to take a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell, to increase her inventory stock and in order to provide the needs of her loyal customers.

Editha's plan for the future is to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma owns and managed a piggery business, which she has been doing for five years. In working this business, she was able to pay her previous loan. Norma is requesting a loan again  from GDMPC which she will use to purchase feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her small number of pigs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana was able to manage her farm that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm was still doing well and was giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Juana expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.name: Visaminda

texts.en: Visaminda is married; she's already 63 years old. She manage her vegetable garden just to earn for a living.She want to increase her income and asking for financial assistance from GDMPC. He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. She availed the loan to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables in order to produce plenty of eggplants in the market.With this loan, she is hopeful to earn well and be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables garden

location.town: San Agustine, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
With the help of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), Kiva and lenders, Aida is able to run her food business with no worries at all. Aida says she was indeed thankful as her previous loan was used as a supplementary capital to buy raw ingredients she needed to operate her business.

Aside from her food stall business, Aida is also a tricycle operator and owns a videoke machine. Those businesses helped her a lot in sustaining her family’s needs. She is applying for another loan of Php 25,000 to have additional fund which she can utilize to buy other necessities for her businesses. She is working hard towards success as she wants to purchase another unit of tricycle. She is hoping that her request will be considered once again.

Aida regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to have additional revolving funds to buy necessities for her businesses.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works on her own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for 12 years, and she earns well from it. She also has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for farm inputs.

Currently, she is taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for the next crop. She wants to expand her farming business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for the next crop

location.town: P-3, SANTA ANA, ALORAN, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of 8 who does dairy farming to provide for her family. Her husband does farming too. She started farming many years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing dairy, poultry and horticultural farming on a small-scale basis. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 
As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.   
Mary hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Siongiroi, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of endless rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean mud house Recho has been able to raise 9 children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming Recho can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m. she arises to go to her farm in the remote village of Kipsuter.

However, the biggest challenge Recho faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village. She is seeking a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.
Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Recho is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and she will be able to pay back the loan.

Recho is very motivated because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. Triumph in her efforts to elevate the family’s life will do her proud.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow of good quality.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of 3 children doing dairy and poultry farming for a living. Hellen started farming to help her husband, who is a local businessman, in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 
As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.   
Hellen hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay, who is a resident in Kampong Cham province, is 36 years old and she is married. She has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she is growing rice and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her farming business for 16 years. Her daily income earned from both of her businesses is about USD10 and she can save approximately about USD7 per day. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her business.

This will be the first time for Nay with VisionFund. As the leader of a group of two members, she will use her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to boost the crop yields. She hopes that she can raise more income so as to be able to buy a new motorcycle to use in business and daily life.

loans.use: To buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to boost the crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal learned about the Fresh Life Toilets franchise through her brother Alex, who owns and operates two facilities.

Since she relocated to Nairobi's Tassia area, she has witnessed poor sewerage systems existing in her area. The situation had caused Racheal not to establish toilet facilities for her tenants, which has had an adverse impact on her rental units business as well as overall poor sanitation practices by her tenants.

She is motivated to join the Fresh Life Toilets movement so as to reduce tenant turnover caused by the lack of toilets at the plot as well as to offer her tenants a hygienic and sanitary toilet option.

She is seeking to purchase and operate one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: to pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Johara

texts.en:
Johara is a 40-year-old housewife who also does some sewing work for meeting the daily needs of her family. She lives with her husband and children in Khagrabari under Cooch Behar district. She is a mother of one son and one daughter. Her son is a very brilliant and studious student of B.A., second year, and her daughter reads in only class IV.

Johara's husband has a small stationery shop, but whatever he earns is spent for household expenses. He finds it difficult to maintain the family and at the same time cover their children's education expenses. He is neither able to pay their fees, nor give them necessary educational articles.

Aniruddha is doing his B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) at A.B.N Shill College. He is very attentive to his studies and tries hard to score good marks in examinations, with an aim to be a teacher in the future. Johara feels that her son can do better if he gets adequate study materials and the educational fees are paid on time.

So, Johara is requesting an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase her son’s necessary study materials, pay college fees, exam fees, and private tutors' fees.

Johara and Aniruddha (in the photo) are very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son's bachelor's degree educational expenses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Mohammad has a medical analysis laboratory in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new modern analysis device at his lab. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new modern analysis device at his lab

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng, 60 years old mother of six, one in school and the others are married, lives in a rural area of Pea Reang District, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a small rice field near her house for more than twenty years. In total, she can make USD 6 per day from her farming.

Neng is taking a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, she hopes that it will help her to promote her healthy and living condition. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has six adult children. She owns and operates a farm, raising crops to earn a living. For many years, farming has enabled her to provide for the needs of her family and to send her children to school. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy fertilizer.

Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for costs to replant coconut. She wants to improve her farm because it is her main source of income, and she wants to ensure a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for costs to replant coconut

location.town: P-1, SANTA ANA, ALORAN, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Being a housewife, Leonisa wants to earn income while at home. She’s grateful as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped her in terms of monetary by approving her previous loan application. She also want to thank lenders who lend a helping hand. The previous loan aided her to sustain their essential needs and support for the business.

According to Leonisa, sometimes there are customers who forget to pay for the tailoring service which she considers a challenge in the business. It is Leonisa’s goal to increase her revolving fund used for business and profit to support their daily needs. Any business needs enough capital to flourish. This year, Leonisa decided to apply for a Php 20,000 loan to buy materials such as cloth, thread and other necessities and also keep some of the amount as a revolving capital for the future needs in business.

Leonisa regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cloth, thread and other necessities for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fence her farmland

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, La is a 33-year-old married mother of two dependent children. To better support the family, she has involved in rice farming while her husband helps to earn extra income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 10USD per day and she manages to save about US2D each day for the future needs. Her rice crops have been destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her business. 
This is group loan for La’s group and she has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already. The past loan has helped La to better support her family and increase the business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, La, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fee in plowing the fee. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Nur is an entrepreneur from Khagrabari in Coochbehar district. She has two sons and one daughter. Her sons and daughter are all students in different grades.

Her husband is a Toto driver. His monthly income is insufficient to continue his family’s needs. Most of his income is spent on the family expenses. Her only daughter Sabana is a 15-year-old girl who reads in grade 11 in Coochbehar Uchcha Balika Vidyalaya. Recently, she passed her secondary board examination and got good marks. She is intelligent enough but she needs guidance from tutors. Unfortunately, Nur and her husband are unable to help her daughter with her education but they want to give a better education to Sabana to enable her to lead a better life. But their household income is not adequate to meet her all educational expenses.

This is why Nur has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. She will use the loan amount to pay her daughter’s educational fees and necessary study materials. She strongly believes that her daughter will benefit from these materials and will secure good marks in the forthcoming exam.

Nur and Sabana (shown in the photo) both are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To afford the educational costs of grade 11 for her only daughter.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a rural housewife from Khagrabari. She is a 44-year-old woman and mother of a son. She is illiterate but can sign her name. Ratna’s husband has a small clothing business. His income is inconsistent and insufficient to cover all the household costs of a family of three.

Ratna's only son, 19-year-old Gopal, studies in his first year in BT and Evening College for his B.A. He is an average student but if he could have private tuition, then he would do much better in his graduation level exams. In spite of being illiterate, Ratna pays more attention to her son's education.

Due to a lack of money, Ratna was feeling helpless about managing her son's educational materials and fees. So she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase educational materials and pay all the educational fees for her son. The loan will also help her to provide private tuition to her son for the subjects he needs. Now, Ratna is rather comfortable about her son's education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her economically.

Ratna and her son Gopal (shown in the photo) thank BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs of her only son.

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en:
Mahran is a 31-year-old, married man from Dier El Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father of two sons. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Mahran took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahran will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Mahran's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Mahran appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a small dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming, for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cows. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. 

Jane is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 57 year old woman. Adversity has followed her but hasn't been an obstacle for her to want to succeed and realize her dream of improving her living conditions. Fifteen years ago she started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Maota, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya.

Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit.

Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Susan believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Susan waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Annah, who is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 3 children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Nandi Hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 30 years old. She lives at Khagrabari with her husband and only daughter. Laxmi is a homemaker and her husband Subir has a small bakery business.

Laxmi's daughter, 17-year-old Susmita, is a student in grade 12 in Kalabagan High School. She is a meritorious student and obtained good marks in all her regular subjects in the last session. She wants to be a teacher and make her career in the teaching sector. At present, she needs the guidance of a private tutor because she is going to appear for the Higher Secondary Board exam next year. But her father's income is barely enough to manage all the costs of her education. Her father is unable to pay her education fees and purchase study materials all together at the same time. Moreover, providing private tuition to her is crucial now. Susmita doesn’t want to drop her education at any cost.

So, Laxmi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her daughter to fulfill her dream. She will pay Susmita's educational fees and purchase necessary educational materials for her with the loan money. The loan will help a hardworking student not to discontinue her education just because of financial limitations.

Laxmi and Susmita (shown in the photo) convey their gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay the educational fees for her daughter’s education in grade 12.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabela is a 34-year-old widow, living with her three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband had been running a paan shop and been offering betel leaf and cold drinks in his locality. Her husband has died suddenly due to a fatal disease. This shop is only source of income for whole family and she does not want to let it go.

Now her son looks after his father's business even in young age. He has been learning that how to prepare betel leaf and become very expert in preparing paan. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income.
Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, etc. to sell.
Nabeela thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, etc, for her son's betel leaf shop.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en:
Toeur, 41, lives with family members in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three schoolchildren. She earns income to support her family living via growing rubber and rice cropping for 23 years. Her rubber tree did not grow well because of floods and this is her main challenge. She can save her income for daily about 10 USD per day.

She leads a group of three to seeking a new loan and this is her first time with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion in order to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to support her rubber farm and her rice crop to grow well this year. She hopes that she can earn more income from her businesses to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her rubber farm and her rice crop to grow well this year.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is aged 45 years and married with 11 children. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for twenty-seven years to make a living. With the current business, she can earn about 50,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and is able to save about 30,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is Ra’s group loan with VisionFund and they all have never been with VisionFund before. She is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income and also hopes to extend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita earns a living by engaging in food vending business. She sold home meals and snack foods to the local in her place. She is 50 years old married woman with seven children. Three of her children are still attending school. Aside from from vending, she also sells seaweed and sea shells as supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like straw, softie, laborer's fee and supplies for food vending. These tools are vital in improving her livelihood. She could now purchase additional goods and able to roll-out her capital. Slowly her income will augment and she could provide her family with healthy diets.


In the future,she is hoping and determined that her both sources will be managed successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials like straw,softie, laborer's fee and supplies for food vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more stock of mobile phone credits

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help entrepreneurs lacking capital to run the business. She’s grateful that CCT granted his previous loan of Php 14,000 and also want to thank lenders for participating with Kiva. The amount was used to buy grocery products for her variety store business. There is an increase on her daily sales as a result. However the daily profit is just enough for their day-to-day expenditures.

She aspires to invest for their own house and lot someday and to have an established savings for their future. Delsa aims to have more array of products to offer to clients. That’s why she decided to apply for another loan worth Php 18,000. She will buy additional products to stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items needed in her variety store.

Delsa is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items and other products she needs to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 46 years old. She is married and supports four children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables and farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase stock of kale, cabbages, tomatoes and carrots for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings, as well as meet the family budget.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to a big level business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of kale, cabbages, tomatoes and carrots for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be less  animal feeds during dry season. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy a freezer for storing milk. Her business goal is to she will have a bigger business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing milk

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
In the past, Zenaida didn’t know how to get supplementary capital to buy necessities for her food business since some of her earnings are being used to pay bills and other expenses. She’s grateful when Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved her previous loan of Php 12,000 for she was able to buy daily ingredients needed in her food stall business. She wants to thank lenders for the financial provision.

Running a business is very challenging for Zenaida wherein she considers capital as a big factor. She applied for another loan, this time amounting to Pho 10,000, which she will add to her revolving fund needed in buying daily ingredients for her food business.
