She’s praying that lenders would consider once again her story. The amount will really help on the business’ growth as she dreams of having her own restaurant someday.

On a weekly basis, Zenaida regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to improve her food stall business by acquiring more stocks of ingredients needed in her recipes.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of Php 10,000 was granted and was used as additional capital for the business. She bought grocery items and other products for the business. Currently, she’s earning for about Php 6,000 every month.

Celia dreams to have a one one-stop-shop or a supermarket someday where she can offer complete products and on demand items. Competition on the same business line is what she considers a challenge. Most of her customers are her neighbors, that’s why she could not avoid to lend them products. To compensate, Celia decided to apply for another loan of Php 8,000 to add stocks of items such as bottled drinks, school supplies and grocery items. Celia is hopeful that CCT will once more grant her request for her business to have wide variety of choices.

She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: That's Group

texts.en:
That, 35, lives with family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children and three of whom are still in school. For her living, she grows rice and cassava to earn income for her family. She also works as a labor for others to earn more income. The insects had destroyed her cassava farm, so her cassava did not grow well. She has been involved with her business for 17 years and earns her about 11 USD per day.

For That, she is a group leader of three members to seeking a new loan and this is her second cycle with VisionFund. The past loan has helped on her family’s living better than before. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to input on her cassava farm to produce good yield. She hopes that her family condition upgrade than before and she can get more income to support on her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to use on her cassava farm, to make a higher yield than last year.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Prakriti

texts.en:
43-year-old Prakriti is a homemaker, hails from Falakata, Alipurduar district, and is a mother of an only son. Prakriti always strives hard so that her child receives a proper education which she was deprived of in her childhood due to her family’s financial issues. Prakriti studied up to Higher Secondary grade and her husband is a graduate.

Prakriti's husband is a teacher at a primary school in the local area and his limited income is spent on household expenses. Somehow they have managed their son's education costs but now they are unable to provide adequate study materials for their son.

Prakriti's son, 12-year-old Sumit, is a student in grade 7 in Parangerpar Sishu Kalyan High School. He is a serious and studious boy. He has a long-cherished dream to be a teacher. But his parents are unable to provide the private lessons and school fees regularly and it is creating a burden on them. So Sumit thinks that his dream will be unfulfilled due to lack of money.

In this situation Sumit’s mother Prakriti has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to continue her son’s education further.

With the help of this loan she will purchase her son's study materials and pay his school fees. She will also enroll her son in some private tutoring center to help him improve so that he can be one step closer to his goal.

Prakriti and Sumit (as in the picture) are very much thankful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs of her son.

loans.name: Samila

texts.en:
Samila is a typical rural housewife who lives in a small village named Parengerpar in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She has four children, three sons and a daughter. Among them two sons are students in a local school and the eldest one is a carpenter. Her daughter has got married. Samila is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is a 45-year-old homemaker and her husband is a rickshaw driver.

One of her sons, Sahinur, is only 15 years old and is studying in grade 10 in Falakata High school (H.S). Being an average student, Sahinur tries his level best to score good marks. Next year he should appear for the Secondary board examination, so he needs the help of private tutoring now. But, with their tireless effort, his father and elder brother are able to earn only a very minimum income for the family’s daily needs. Education expenses create a burden on them. But Samila is very determined to provide higher education to her son Sahinur. So she has come forward and applied for an education loan from Kiva via BJS.

Samila will utilize the loan to pay school fees, private tutoring fees, and exam fees and to purchase necessary books and other study materials for her son Sahinur. She hopes her son will achieve a light of hope and do better in his upcoming examinations.

Samila and Sahinur (as in the photo) convey their thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To bear the education costs for her son.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van is 58 years old, and she is married with two children, one of whom is dependent on her. She is a resident of Battambang province, is a widowed woman, and sustains the family by growing rice and working for others for a fee in her free time. She earns about USD 11.00 per day, and she can save approximately about USD 5.00 each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge to her farming business.

This will be her fourth time to borrow from VisionFund and, the past loans, which are already paid back, have enabled her to improve both her living conditions and her farming business.

As the leader of three member group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes that she can produce larger yields so as to expand her rice farming business and meet her family’s needs on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so as to meet her family’s needs on time.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 38-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father of two daughters.

He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Shadi took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN), which will enable him to buy a solar power system for heating water for the family house.

By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Shadi's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She considers CCT and lenders as God’s extension of blessing since the loan amount of Php 15,000 that she applied before was granted to her. She is very grateful that the amount helped her buy additional products for her variety store causing her monthly sales to continually increase..

Lydia wants to save money for her family’s future and make the business grow. Lydia is once again applying for a loan worth Php 15,000. She will use the loan to pay for additional stocks of grocery items for the store.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Lydia spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items for her variety store business. .

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: In 2003, Erlinda sign up for membership to gain access to financial services of Paglaum MPC. She ventures into hog raising business to augment their monthly income knowingly her husbands' income cannot suffice heir family needs. Currently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been doing mixed-farming for many years and has grown her farm business tremendously. She was raised in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she now lives with her husband and 3 children. Caroline's main income source is milk and maize/corn. 
Currently, she is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family decent diets and better income. 
She loves to feed people and that is why he finds her business fulfilling. Your loan will help her elevate her livelihood by producing more food for her family and others in the community.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Kiminini in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Mary is happily married and the proud mother of a lovely family, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Mary to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in, then that person is Mary. She will not let you down.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of 10 children. She started farming many years ago to help her husband, a farmer, in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing dairy and crop farming. She keeps poultry, but for subsistence purposes. 
As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase food and income from poultry products, mainly eggs, chicks and meat.   
Mary hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, aged 23, is hopeful and happy at the idea she can change her future and that of her family. The lack of job opportunities has meant that this responsible and brave young mum has become an independent smallholder farmer a trade that she learned from her parents. Other than doing some small business, Nancy is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.

Nancy practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Nancy has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Nancy will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.
You can help this hard worker mother to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Seat is 59-year-old man and a father blessed with seven children. Nowadays, he needs to support one child.

He grows cassava and rice as his main source of income to support his family's living conditions. Moreover, he works as a laborer for others to earn extra income. His cassava has not produced a good yield, and this is his main challenge.

Seat has been involved with this business for 41 years, and he can save from his income about 14.00 USD per day. This is his first time to borrow from VisionFund, and he leads a group of six members in seeking this loan.

As the group leader, he will use his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to use on his cassava and rice farm in order to produce larger yields than before for his family.

He hopes that this loan can help him to upgrade his living conditions more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use on his cassava and his rice farm to produce good yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 22-year-old, single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in a general store, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Shadi took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Shadi's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 50 years old married woman with two children from ages 17 and 20 year old respectively.
She operates a tricycle transportation services. She earns an income out of the rent from the vehicle.
In addition to that, she also engages in buying and selling of coconut, banana and mangoes as a supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like tires,chain, pay maintenance and stocks like banana, coconut and mangoes. With these, it will maintain the flow of the inventory of stocks, thus, enables her to roll out her capital. Thus, continue to provide her family with healthy diets.

With these, she could be able to expand her business, for her to support the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like tires ,chain, pay maintenance and also stocks like banana, coconut and mangoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in a general store, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Maran's family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as; water spinach, chili, tomato, carrots, cabbage etc

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat lives in a wooden house in Kampong Cham province, is age 29 years old and he has a young child. The main source of his income is from growing rice for 4 years and he can earn additional income via working at garment factory to improve his family’s living. He is able to earn income around 8USD per day. After expenses, he can save about 5USD each day. Because of drought, he cannot get good yield recently. 
This is Sarat’s first time to get a loan with VisioFund. This first loan, he will use it to renovate his old house. He hopes to keep his family members are healthy, safety and make his house more comfortable.

loans.use: to renovate his old house to keep his family members are healthy, safety and make his house more comfortable. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kratie district of Kratie province, Srean is a 40-year-old married mother of two children who are still small for school. Cassava growing has been the main source of her family’s income for 7 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manage to save about 15,000KHR each day for the future needs.

Srean’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. The first loan has helped Srean better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Srean, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava and use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Srun, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 58 years old and a mother of four dependent children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and working as a labor to harvesting for others farm to get supplement income. The drought is her main challenge that she has faced in her rice farm. She can save her daily income about 11 USD per day which has been with her 41 years.

In a group of four, she is the leader of group to seeking this new loan. For Srun, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan completely. Her family’s business has improved well than before with her past loan. She will spend her portion of loan to purchase more fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve her farming to get good yield. She hopes this loan can make her farm produce more yields and earns her more income to upgrade her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve on her farming in order to produce more yields for her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Laiheang's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in a rural village of Battambang province, Laiheang, 19, is a mother of a small child. Growing orange and pepper are the primary sources of her family’s income. She can get additional income via working for others for a fee to support her living condition. Lacking of working capital to support her business is the main challenge of her. 
This is Laiheang’s second loan with VisionFund and her past loan which enabled her to have better house to stay than before was fully repaid. She is now leading a group of two to get a new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good outputs. She hopes that this second loan will help her to get more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs as well as her income in order to save for future need.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
A local resident living in a wooden house in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Ly is 24-year-old and a married mother of a small child. To make a living, she works at garment factory and grows rice as the main sources of income. She can earn supplement income via working as labor worker. These businesses have been with her for 6 years. Her daily income is about 9USD per day and she can save around 5USD each day after expenses. Insect pests meant her rice has not grown well.

For Ly, she has never been with VisionFund and this is the first time of her to apply for a loan. Through this loan, she is going to buy a plot of farmland to expand her farming area and increase the crop yield. She hopes to get high yield to earn good income so that she can improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand her farming area so to increase the crop yield as well as her income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Mariée, Akoua est femme de 38 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Agoè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Akoua prépare et vend de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchoukoudou» et vend aussi du bois de chauffage à son domicile. Akou s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Akou désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil et des rangés de bois de chauffage afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Akoua is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Agoè with her two children. In order to make a living and provide for the needs of her children, Akoua makes and sells a local alcoholic drink called "Tchoukoudou," and also sells firewood from her home. Akou buys her supplies three times a month from the market and earns a good profit margin thanks to her business. She is requesting this credit to buy bags of millet and rows of firewood so that she can maximize her profit and help her husband take care of their children, particularly by prioritizing their education.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of millet and 1 stack of firewood.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 63-year-old man from Clarin, Bohol. He is married and has four adult children. Alberto and his wife are running a sari-sari store business to earn a living. They have been doing this for almost 35 years. They raised their children through this business.

They wish to improve this business to have a sustainable means of living in the future. Thus, Alberto is asking a loan to buy a sacks of milled rice to sell in order to increase their earnings. He also buys additional grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks and sugar.

loans.use: to buy milled rice, chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks and sugar

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a sari-sari store owner from Calape, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. One of these children is a school aged child aged 17 years old. Alicia has been engaged in this business for four years to earn a living while her husband works hard as a carpenter. They work together to provide the needs of their children. Thus, Alicia is asking a loan to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, food seasoning, assorted foods like chips and biscuits, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink. In the future, she wishes to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, food seasoning, assorted food like chips and biscuits, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Maida

texts.en:
Maida who is in her early 30's is single with three kids who are still in school. She has been running a wine shop for six years now. She works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maid's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to import wines from out side the country and to increase on her usual stock. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to pay school fees, built her own house, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the  wine stock to meet her customer request. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Maida will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on the  wine stock to meet her customer request.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kratie district of Kratie province, Mom is aged 26 years and married. She has two small children to take care of. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming rice and working for others for a fee. Drought has been the main challenge for her business. The current business earns her about KHR60,000 per day to meet her family’s need.

Mom has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is seeking for another loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice growing. She hopes this loan will help her to earn a large income for supporting her family, and also enable to save some money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice growing

loans.name: Yoerm

texts.en:
Yoerm is 28 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She has two dependent children to take care of, one of whom is in school while another one is too young for school. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 10 years. To earn additional income, her husband works for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn approximately 60,000KHR per day and save about 30,000KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the fourth micro loan for Yoerm with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Lina is 30-year-old and she is a mother of a young child. Nowadays, she grows cucumber to support her family’s living condition. Moreover, she sells fish to earn more income. She has involved in her job for 12 years. To support her living, she can earn income about 12USD per day and save around 5USD each day after expenses. The price of crop is decreasing and it was destroyed by insect pests recently, these are the main challenges for her in earning income to support her family.

Lacking funds to support her business, she decides to request a loan with VisionFund and this is the first time of her. In a group of two women, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire portion of loan in order to buy fertilizer to grow good quality of crop. She hopes that this new loan will help her to get more income and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow good quality of crop in order to sell it in a higher price to increase her income and upgrade her standard of living.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
A resident in Battambang province, Saret is 43 years old. She has three dependent children to support. She and her husband have run rice-farming business for years. In her free time, she works as paid worker to earn additional income. The challenge to her business is limited rainfall which causes her crop to produce lower outputs. 
She forms a group of three members to apply for a new loan from VisionFund. Past loans have helped her to uplift the lifestyle. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and to spend on farmland preparation fees. She hopes she can raise more income and meet family’s needs on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and to spend on farmland preparation fees.

loans.name: Hanin

texts.en:
Hanin is married women, her husband is working as a constructor who barely can provide his two children all their needs with this high cost of living.
Hanin decided to establish a small business through a small room inside her house trying to generate a second source of income. She started to sell Stationery Tools  to the kids who lives in the same area and there was a good turnout since it’s the only available store in the region.
So Hanin is seeking to take a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Alibdaa to buy more goods she need such as papers, pens, files and toys. This loan will help Hanin to expand her business and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy more papers, pens, files and toys for her store

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is 23 years old woman married and a mother of three kids, she’s working very hard to help her husband and save her children from poverty and educate them. 
Fida owns a poultry farm at the village and she requested a Loan of $1500 through Kiva partner Alibdaa in order to buy more chicks and feed to expand her farm and generate more Income to improve her family living standard. Fida has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed to expand her farm

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district, Yoern is aged 51 years and widowed mother of three children. To make a living and support her children, Yoern has been farming rice as primary business for 20 years and she supplements the income by working as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 70,000KHR per day. Lacking of working capital is the main challenge for her family’s business.  
This is the sixth micro loan for Yoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Yoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is a 30-year old college undergraduate who lives in Victorias City. She is married to Regie, a tricycle driver. They have 3 children aged 10, 9 and 7, all of them are still in elementary. Charry was working as an overseas foreign worker in Kuwait, but currently has a home business. Their total monthly family income of only P14,000 ($303) is not enough to provide for their basic needs.

Thus, when Charry qualified for the 2-month call center training program of BagoSphere, she found hope that there's actually a chance for her to uplift her family's life in a few months. Charry dream's to have a successful career in a BPO industry. Your loan assistance might just make her reach that.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Salin's Group

texts.en:
Salin is aged 35 years and married with three children living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district. She and her husband earn a living through selling grocery items for several years, and sometimes working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about US$15 per day and manages them to save about US$3 each day for the future needs.
Salin’s group consists of two female members who have never been members of VisionFund before. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a divorced women who has suffered a lot through her life journey. After getting divorced she returned to her parents house to take care of her disabled father and nowadays she decided to repair some damages before winter so she's requesting a loan from Kiva partner Alibdaa with an amount of $500 in order to pay for the paint expenses. This loan will enable Ilham to live a better and healthier life.

loans.use: to pay for the paint expenses for her parents house

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou lives in a wooden house in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She is 34 years old and a married mother of three dependent children who are all schoolchildren.

Growing cassava and rice are the primary sources of her income. Chanthou has involved in her job for 16 years. Recently, the insect pests affected her crop, so she cannot sell it for good profit.

After successfully repaying the entire previous loan which enabled her to have more household supplies, she has requested a second loan with VisionFund Cambodia.

As a group leader, Chanthou will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and pay for labor fees in order to increase the productivity of her crops.

She hopes to get more income in order to have enough money to send her children to school and upgrade her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crops in order to get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a determined women, married and with five children. One of them is mentally disabled. They live in a rural village around Hebron and her mother taught her how to take care of animals since she was young. Fifteen years ago she launched her own farm inside her house and she started to sell milk, cheese and meat in the area in order to survive. Nawal is asking for a loan to buy four sheep to generate more products and sell them and even sell the sheep after fattening. She's looking forward to expand and sell more to enhance her family living standards.

loans.use: to buy four more sheep to her farm

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en: Shorouq is married women and expecting her first baby. She decided to have a new step in her life since she will have more responsibilities, She's a talented hair dresser and she has been working in a beauty salon for more than ten years so she requested a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Alibdaa to buy some beauty supplies to use it to primp her clients in a room at her house. She is working with all her efforts to ensure the success of her project and to expand in the near future, so that she can improve her life and provide her child a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies such as hair dryers, hair products and makeup for her business

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 45, is married and has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Battambang province.

The main income of this family comes from a pig and chicken raising business and from selling some snacks. Moreover, she buys recyclable items to resell and works as a paid worker in order to earn additional income. Lack of working capital to use to sustain the business’s growth is the main challenge to Chan.

She is now leading a four member group to apply for a loan, which will be her eighth time borrowing from VisionFund. Her past loans, which have been paid back complertely, have had a huge impact on her family. She can send her children to school, and buy them sufficient school materials.

As the group leader, Chan will use her loan to buy piglets and chickens to raise, and to buy feed to nourish them. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn a good income, to expand her business and to keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chickens to raise, and to buy feed to nourish them.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans résidant à Agoè. Yawa est une coiffeuse qui expose des marchandises dans son salon de coiffure. Yawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et revend dans son salon de coiffure. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de mèches, de tissages et autres en vue de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Yawa is a 43-year-old married woman living in Agoè with her two children. She is a hairdresser who sells products in her salon. She buys her supplies once a month from the market and sells them in her salon. She needs this loan to buy dozens of extensions, weaves, and other materials in order to earn a profit and help her husband care for their children and manage the nutrition and health needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen extensions, 5 dozen weaves, and 5 units of soap for the head.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
Marylen is a 35-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her oldest child is 13 years old and her youngest child is seven years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Marylen is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for three years. Aside from sari-sari business, she also buys and sells coconut wine and charcoal.

Marylen and her husband work hard to give the best life to their family. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods such as coffee, powdered milk, sugar, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, bread, noodles and spices. She will also buy fertilizer so that their farm will have a good harvest. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coffee, powdered milk, sugar, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, bread, noodles and spices, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr:
Veronique est une femme très courageuse et travailleuse de 37 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants de 8 et 10 ans. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. Elle est divorcée il y a maintenant 5 ans. C'était elle qui décidait de la séparation car Monsieur ne l'aidait point ni sur l'entretien du ménage ni sur l'éducation de leurs enfants.
Véronique était marchande des charbons en bois durant long temps, mais depuis 2011 elle changeait à exercer une activité de murisserie de banane. Les bananes sont des fruits non saisonnières. Elle a beaucoup de clients, et à part les livraisons et les commandes sur place, elle a son propre lieu de vente. 
Sa priorité actuelle est le développement et l'extension de son affaire afin de pouvoir augmenter le revenu pour qu'elle puisse améliorer le niveau de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Véronique is a hardworking, brave 37-year-old woman with two children, who are 8 and 10 years old. Both of her children attend private school. She has been divorced for 5 years. She was the one who decided to get the divorce, since her husband never helped her manage the house or educate their children.
Véronique sold charcoal for a long time, but in 2011 she changed her business to ripening bananas. The bananas are non-seasonal fruits. She has several clients, and she has her own stand, but she also makes deliveries. Her current priority is to develop and extend her business so that she can increase her revenue and improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 tons of green bananas.

loans.name: Wilver

texts.es: Wilver de 33 años  tiene como  objetivo seguir trabajando para darles una mejor calidad de  vida a sus tres hijas y que ellas puedan estudiar para que sean mujeres responsables en el futuro, tal como lo deseaba su esposa quien falleció hace algunos años. Vive en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras y  se dedica a la agricultura de hortalizas y café  desde hace doce años,  por lo tanto sabe que es un trabajo donde hay que levantarse temprano y seguir trabajando por las noches cuando es la  temporada de cosecha del café. Uno de sus  deseos es  encontrar una buena mujer y volver a casarse, además  le gustaría aumentar su producción en las cosechas y en un futuro poder comprar un vehículo para  salir a vender lo que produce. Actualmente las hijas de Wilver tienen una dificultad ya que no pueden estudiar por las noches ni hacer algunos trabajos que les asignan en la escuela por la falta de energía eléctrica, por esta razón Wilver está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un  Sistema Solar que le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida para él y sus niñas.
texts.en: Wilver is 33 and wants to keep working so he can provide his three daughters with a better quality of life and send them to school so they can be respectable women in the future, which is what his wife who passed away several years ago wanted.  He lives in the community of Olanchito, Honduras and he has been growing vegetables and coffee for 12 years, so he knows that for this work you have to get up early and keep working through the night when it's time to harvest the coffee.  One of his wishes is to find a good woman and get married again; he would also like to increase his harvest yields and in the future be able to buy a vehicle so he could go out and sell his produce.  Wilver's daughters are currently facing a problem because they cannot study or complete school assignments at night because they do not have electricity.  For this reason, Wilver is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras to get a solar power system, which would improve living conditions for himself and his girls.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system to provide his three daughters with better living conditions.

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en: Kimleng is a 20-year-old single man. He is a university student living in Phnom Penh city. Recently, Kimleng began working as an intern to get a salary to support his studies, as well as to improve his skills. He has been involved with this work for many months. This is Kimleng's first loan cycle with VisionFund. He will use his entire loan to prepare some necessary documents for his three-month vocational training abroad, such as a passport, visa, etc. He hopes to get good knowledge from this vocational training.

loans.use: to prepare some necessary documents for his three-month vocational training abroad, such as a passport, visa, etc.

loans.name: Famille Siringi Group

texts.fr: Le précédent crédit a permis à Imani d'entretenir son champ. Grâce aux revenus issus de cette activité, il a pu non seulement s'acheter une chèvre pour l'élevage familiale mais aussi activer sa petite affaire de vente des unités de communication. Avec la petite expérience qu'il a acquise avec ce crédit dans l'atténuation de ses problèmes familiaux, il aimerait en avoir un autre dans le même angle d'idées.
texts.en: Imani's previous loan allowed him to maintain his field. Thanks to the income generated by his business, he was able not only to buy a goat for his family to raise, but also to start his small side business of selling communication devices. Since he gained a little experience in alleviating his family's problems with his last loan, he would like to receive another in the same vein.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee field.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 28-year-old single man from Dier Al balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Yousef has a stall for selling shoes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Yousef took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's shoes to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's shoes to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hanan is a 30-year-old, married woman from Nablus City. She lives with her family in a small, old house she is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on her for support.

Hanan has a grocery store in the city for the sale of foodstuffs and basic household needs. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in the west bank not good. Hanan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new collection and some goods for her store. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: buy a new collection and some goods for her store.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is a 20-year old college undergraduate who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She belongs to a family of 9. Her father works as a construction worker and her mother is a housewife. Romela is the eldest in the family, she has 6 younger siblings who are still studying in college and in high school. The family's total monthly income of P10,000.00 ($217) is not enough to provide for their basic needs.

Romela would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow her to realize this goal. Romela aims to have a stable job with high salary and to help his family battle poverty. Your support in funding her loan will help Romela have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Sohaeb

texts.en:
Sohaeb is a bachelor's student with a major in English. He has ambition to improve his English language so that he can increase his challenge with the local market.

He works at a nearby small restaurant as a waiter after his university hours so that he can support his family of six and help them with their needs, as well as make payments to his university. He is applying for a loan to ease the load on his shoulders and pay his university payments. He will be so happy if he gets help to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to ease the load on his shoulders and pay his university payments.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom is a 22-year-old university student from Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her studying via working as an intern. This is Sokhom's first time seeking a loan with VisionFund. She will manage her loan to pay for preparing some documents include her visa and passport, as she has passed to join vocational training for three months in Singapore. She hopes that she can get more experience and improve her skills to pave the way to get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for preparing some documents including her visa and passport as she has passed to join three-month vocational training.

loans.name: Sereyroth

texts.en: A university student living in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia, Sereyroth is 19 years old. She works as an intern to support her studying. This is the first time Sereyroth has applied for a Kiva loan with VisionFund. She will use her entire loan to pay for preparing her visa and passport, as she has passed to join vocational training for three months in Singapore. She hopes to improve her skills in order to pave the way to get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for preparing her visa and passport to join vocational training for three months in Singapore.

loans.name: Vit

texts.en: Vit, 23, is a university student and lives in the Steung Mean Chey district of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. He works at an internship to get income to support his studies. This is Vit's first Kiva loan with VisionFund. He will spend his loan to pay for preparing his visa and passport, as he has passed to join vocational training for three months in Singapore. He hopes that he can get a good job after graduating to upgrade his family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for preparing his visa and passport, as he has passed to join vocational training for three months in Singapore.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Mrs. Oanh is a hardworking woman who is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Her income is mainly from husbandry and small business. With more than 15 years experience and support from her husband, her income enables her to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Mrs. Kieu is 36 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to feed and educate her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially her children's, but lack of capital prevents this. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan from husbandry and small business.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyet is a 60-year-old hardworking woman. She lives with two children. She would like to improve her living standards. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan from small business and husbandry.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a smallholder farmer from Kapsowar, a remote area in North Rift, Kenya, popularly known for livestock farming. Caroline's main income source is milk, but she is looking to start sheep farming in a bid to diversify. As with many agricultural enterprises, the profit margins in sheep farming are narrow. Therefore, raising sheep will be a part-time enterprise to Caroline.

To kick-start the business, Caroline is seeking a loan to buy sheep. As a sheep farmer, she will derive her income from the sales of lambs and wool. From the additional income, she plans to service her loan and meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a 25-year-old who is humble, honest and a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Rose has a lovely family, whom she really adores. She will always do anything good to prevent them from ever going to bed with hungry stomachs.

Rose hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job, but these realities did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Rose has been farming for the past five years. Through the years, she has gathered much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Rose practices mixed farming (dairy, animal and crop farming). With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs. She is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Rose wants to take advantage of various conditions such as favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products to reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Rose turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Rose hopes that she will improve her living conditions through this loan. By the end of the first year, her dreams and projections are that she will not only be selling in the local market but also in international markets through the export of fruits and vegetables. Through these endeavours, she will be able to assure her family a secure future. Rose is not a selfish mum and she wants to help society, which is why she will employ people on her horticulture farm, and hence have a positive impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette est une femme handicapée et vit seule avec son enfant dans un quartier animé de la ville. Pour assurer la vie quotidienne, elle tient une épicerie et à la fois elle fait aussi de la broderie. Ces œuvres sont souvent vendus aux touristes qui viennent visiter la ville.   
Paulette est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 4 ans. Les bénéfices des prêts précédents lui ont permis d’acheter un terrain pour construire une maison à l’avenir. Avec ce prêt, Paulette compte développer son activité de broderie. Elle va acheter du tissu et des fils à broder pour faire des nappes et des couvres lits qu’elle va vendre auprès des touristes.
Paulette a comme objectif de développer son atelier de broderie  et d’avoir beaucoup de clients. Elle compte aussi constituer beaucoup d’épargne pour son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Paulette is a disabled woman and lives alone with her child in a busy district in town. To ensure her livelihood day to day, she has a grocery store, and at the same time she also does embroidery. Her work is often sold to tourists visiting the town.

Paulette has been a borrower at Vahatra for four years. The profits from previous loans have enabled her to purchase a plot of land for building a house in the future. With her profits, she intends to develop her embroidery business. She is going to purchase some fabrics and thread to make tablecloths and bedspreads, which she will sell to tourists.

Paulette’s goal is to develop her sewing workshop and to have many customer. She is also counting on building up a lot of savings to be financially autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase some fabrics and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La socia Jacinta pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, la socia sigue   dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, tortas, gaseosas, pasteles, galletas entre otros en su kiosco escolar, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, galletas entre otros.
texts.en:
Jacinta belongs to the NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO communal bank. She continues to work at her business selling snacks, cakes, pastries, cookies and more in her school snack booth. She has had the business for some time and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible person and this is the way she supports her family.

She feels grateful for the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

She is asking for the loan to buy sodas, cookies and more.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies and more.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a smallholder farmer based in the Nyanza area of Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. Her main source of income is milk. Teresia aspires to grow her business, make better income and take good care of her family. 
One way of improving her business is by ensuring that her animals are healthy and productive. To do this, she needs a loan to source and buy the ingredients and additives that are right for the animals. From this loan investment, she hopes to not only improve the health of the cows, but also the quality of the meat and milk they produce.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has two children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy cow, sheep rearing, horticulture and tree farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.
In the Nandihills area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge, however, is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo, though, has partnered with KIVA to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Nandihills can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.
Sarah is seeking a 15,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.
Support her dream by giving Sarah a loan!

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Mayson's Group

texts.en:
Mayson & Lara are not only in partnership, they are mother and daughter. Mayson spent her time to raise her daughter and educate her and taught her sewing.

They decide to start their small home business, but they find that their reputation has spread faster than they could imagine.

They need more sewing machines, fabric and more space to fit all the products as well, therefore they applies for a loan to equal their reputation.

They could well draw a smile on each other's faces if they get the chance.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and yarns also they want to buy new sewing machines .

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is an energetic and beautiful young 34 year old woman. Born in Wekonye a rural village in Kitale, she has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since she was a little girl she has demonstrated her talents and knack for farming. Wekonye is a remote village in Kitale area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. According to residents, the people of Wekonye are forgotten or ignored by the county government of Kitale.

But within the remote village of Wekonye Linet is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Linet as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver. Linet started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 3 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Linet is seeking a loan to buy farm implements such as modern farming tools and seeds and also purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Linet will have more space to expand her business output. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her three children who are in public schools. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and more land for farming.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a mother of three, Nelly's great desire is to see her children grow to become a professional. Nelly has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize, has dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. Nelly's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Nelly formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo. Nelly is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Nelly is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. Nelly hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted Kiva lenders that support small holder farmers.

loans.use: buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Marie Jeanne a constitué beaucoup d’épargne grâce aux prêts qu’elle a contractés. 
Son activité se déroule bien, elle vend actuellement des sandales de pointures et de styles différents. Elle vend aussi des chaussures. 
Elle n’a pas eu de difficulté dans le remboursement de son prêt.
Pour ce prochain prêt, Marie Jeanne compte diversifier et augmenter son stock de chaussures. En effet, cette activité nécessite beaucoup de capital pour offrir plus de choix aux clients. Elle espère avoir beaucoup de clients et beaucoup de bénéfices.
Son rêve est de devenir grossiste en chaussures et sandales, ceci afin d’assurer l’avenir de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Jeanne has built up a large savings account, thanks to the loans she has obtained.

Her business is going well. She currently sells sandals of different sizes and styles. She also sells shoes.

She has not had any problems paying back her loans.

For this next loan, Marie Jeanne intends to diversify and increase her stock of shoes. Basically, this business needs a lot of capital to offer more choices to customers. She hopes to have many customers and a lot of profit.

Her dream is to become a wholesaler of shoes and sandals, thus to ensure the future for her four children.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and shoes

loans.name: Famille Mwendo Group

texts.fr: Etant au début d'une nouvelle saison culturale, Justin sollicite ce crédit afin démarrer les travaux d'entretien de ses caféiers. Le crédit précédent l'on aidé non seulement à faire de même mais aussi à assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants, leur alimentation et la prise en charge de leurs soins médicaux.
texts.en: Now that the new farming season has started, Justin is requesting this loan to begin work maintaining her coffee plants. The previous loan helped her not only to do this but also to ensure  that her children’s schooling, food, and medical costs were covered.

loans.use: to maintain a field of coffee plants

loans.name: Mahsud

texts.ru: 47 летный начинающий бизнес мен Махсуд. Он из района Руми. Махсуд семейный мужчина. У него трое детей. Жена домохозяйка и у нее тоже есть бизнес, который сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. Махсуд хочет заниматься торговлей деятельности. Он планирует приобрести больше дыни на продажу. Сейчас сезон дыни. Для старта нового бизнеса и для перевоза больше дыни у него нет денег. Махсуд решил обратиться к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете помочь ему начать бизнес. Он будет очень рад на Вашу поддержку
texts.en:
Mahsud is a 47-year-old beginning businessman. He is from the Rumy region. Mahsud is a family man, and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker, and she also has a business that allows her to earn her living from home.

Mahsud wants to work in trade. He plans to purchase many melons for resale. It is currently melon season, and Mahsud doesn't have the money to start a new business and transport a large amount of melons. Mahsud has decided to apply to you for a loan. You can help him start his business. He will be very glad to have your support.

loans.use: to start a new business and to transport many melons.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
El socio Adan  se dedica al negocio de venta de madera, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local más grande para vender su madera. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar madera.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Adan works in the wood selling business. He works from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. He has had this business for several years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a bigger locale to sell his wood. He is asking for the loan to buy wood.

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia Ricardina se sigue dedicando al negocio de empresa de comunicaciones,la socia es una persona responsable que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener una empresa propia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ricardina continues to work in the communications business. She is a responsible person who gets her family ahead with her work. Her dream is to have her own business. She is asking for the loan to buy a sound system for her house.


She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy goat.

loans.name: Famille Ndame Group

texts.fr: Les réalisations du crédit précédent de Désiré sont telles qu'il a pu scolariser ses enfants, construire une maison, l'achat d'une moto pour le transport (taxi) mais surtout l'agrandissement de son activité de culture de café. Ces réalisations l'incite à solliciter nouvellement un autre crédit dans le souhait de faire mieux et davantage.
texts.en: The previous loans which Désiré obtained were such that he could provide schooling for his children, build a house, buy a motorbike for transport (taxi), and especially expanding his business growing coffee. Having obtained the loans encourages him to request once again another loan with the wish of doing better and more.

loans.use: to maintain coffee plants

loans.name: Sajda

texts.en:
Sajda is 43 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 2 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Sajda buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and embroidery machines. Another person handles her transactions with her customer. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Sajda demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Sajda will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery for her use.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
El socio Segundo pertenece al banco comunal AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO.
El socio continúa dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a ejercer el servicio de transporte urbano, él socio es una persona responsable ,el socio lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le  va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundo belongs to the AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO communal bank.

He continues to work in the transportation business. He has been been working in the urban transportation service. He is a responsible person and has been working at his business for years. It is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his business every day. This is the way that he gets his family ahead.

He is asking for the loan to so maintenance on his car.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Doña Flor es una señora con 45 años de edad, divorciada y vive solo con un hijo menor de edad que tiene a cargo, el mismo cursa la secundaria. Actualmente jefa de hogar. Es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada por cumplir sus objetivos. Fue integrante de un banco mujer tiempo atrás, en el cual ella decidió salirse y descansar un rato con los financiamientos, pero éste grupo se caracterizó por su buen comportamiento de pago. Ella inició su negocio hace aproximadamente trece años, cuando tomó la decisión de divorciarse, en ese momento tuvo la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijos. Así ella empezó a generar ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, porque la ayuda económica que recibía del padre de sus hijos no cubría con todos los gastos de ellos. Vive en la comunidad llamada Maravilla de Roxana (rural). Acondicionó el cuarto del frente de la casa para poner su pulpería, la tiene bien enverjada y segura, además cuenta con los permisos necesarios para trabajarla como es la Patente y el Ministerio de Hacienda. Ella labora doce horas diarias en su negocio y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre cuando tiene que salir a hacer compras o tiene compromisos personales. Cuenta con proveedores que llegan a su comunidad a dejarle la mercadería y cerca de ella no tiene competencia. Trabaja con ventas a crédito a trabajadores de bananeras que hay en esa zona, pero la mayoría son de contado. Tiene una cartera consolidada de clientes, debido a ésto sus ventas le van a permitir asumir ésta obligación. Solicita financiamiento para reforzar su pulpería con mercadería y asi satisfacer a sus clientes. Su meta es crecer para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is 45 years old, divorced, and lives with her son, who attends high school. She is currently the head of the household. She is a hardworking and dedicated to achieving her goals. She used to be a member of a women's bank, but she decided to leave and take a break from loans for a while, but this group is known for making their payments.

She started her business about 13 years ago, when she decided to get divorced. She needed to get ahead with her children, so she started to generate income and provide the household necessities, since the financial help she received from the father of her children did not cover all the expenses.

She lives in a community called Maravilla de Roxana (rural). She set up the room in the front of her home to create a grocery store. It is well gated and secure, and she has the necessary business license and tax permits. She works twelve hours at her business, and her mother helps her when she has to go shopping or has personal meetings.

She has vendors who come to her community to leave merchandise and she has no competitors nearby. She sells on credit to banana workers in the area, but the majority of her sales are in cash. She has established customers, and thanks to these sales, she is able to take on this obligation. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her grocery store with merchandise to satisfy her customers. Her goal is to grow to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María es una clienta con trayectoria en la Fundación, tiene 63 años de edad, tuvo tres hijos y es casada. Actualmente vive con su esposo y un hijo mayor de edad. Es una señora trabajadora y con ganas de superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida. Es una mujer emprendedora, le gusta mantenerse activa y está muy comprometida con Dios y la Iglesia. Hace varios años ella se jubiló, después de haber trabajado más de veinticinco años para el estado, de ahí inició la actividad del comercio ambulante, las ventas por catálogos y más. Le va muy bien, gracias al buen trato y condiciones de pago que le brinda a sus clientes. El único hijo que vive con ella estudia en la universidad y ya está llevando los últimos cursos para concluir con su carrera, debido a ésto necesita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio y apoyar a éste en sus estudios. Siempre busca como apoyar más a sus hijos y a su esposo. Su actividad productiva ha sido financiada varias veces por la Fundación y siempre ha mostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Ella inició su actividad con capital propio hace varios años. Ahora cuenta con un patrimonio estable y una cartera de clientes sana. Sin embargo necesita capital de trabajo para invertir en más mercadería, aumentar su inventario y tener mejores ganancias, aprovechando las temporadas altas. Sus clientes son familiares, vecinos y funcionarios de diferentes empresas. Ahora quiere invertir nuevamente en perfumes finos y lociones refrescantes, por éste motivo busca otra vez financiamiento.
texts.en: Miss Teresa is an old client of the Foundation. She is 63 years old and married with three children. Currently, she lives with her husband and a son who is still underage. Miss Teresa is a hard working woman who strives to get ahead and improve her quality of life. She is an enterprising woman who likes to stay active and is very committed to God and the Church. Several years ago, she retired after having worked for the government for twenty five years. That was when she began to work as a street vendor, with catalog sales, and so on. She is doing very well thanks to the good service and payment terms she offers to customers. The only son still living with her is a university student and is finishing the last courses he needs to finish his degree. Because of this, she needs a loan to improve her business and support her son's studies. Miss Teresa is always seeking ways to better support her children and husband. Her businesses have been financed several times by the Foundation and she has always made timely payments. Miss Teresa established her businesses with her own funds several years ago. She now has stable assets and a healthy customer base. Nevertheless, she needs funds to invest in more merchandise, increase her inventory, and improve her profits, while taking advantage of the high season. Her clients are relatives, neighbors, and officers from various companies. She wants to once again invest in fine perfumes and refreshing lotions, and is therefore requesting a loan once again.

loans.use: to purchase fine lotions, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Consollata

texts.en:
HELLO, LENDERS! Meet Consollata who is a smallholder farmer and business lady (she owns a pool table) and lives in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. Farming has helped her not only survive but become an entrepreneur. At her age that is not that common, but she knows that farming doesn’t come with an age limit. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. The Nandi Hills area is a place that has produced some of the world's top elite athletes. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming.

Consollata is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming. Through all the years she has been farming, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, she offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mother, she has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Although Consollata reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Consollata is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Consollata is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

Consollata is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. She has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.
Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. His highest annual expense is food and education.

The major challenge that Benard is facing as a rural farmer is poor access to transportation services. Benard is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle, made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.

With the motorcycle, Benard will be able to distribute his produce in new locations far from his home. Your loan investment will enable Benard to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce, grow interdependent relationships with other people and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.ru: Давлатмо проживает в районе Темурмалик. Ей 49 года, она мать троих детей. Сыновьям 30 и 20 лет, и они семейные парни. Дочке 14 лет. Мужу 51 лет, и он занимается животноводством. Ее вторая невестка занимается шитьем женской одежды. У Давлатмо была мечта научиться мастерству кройки и шитья женской одежды, чтобы начать новую деятельность и зарабатывать на жизнь. Благодаря невестке она научилась этому ремеслу и теперь хотела бы начать свое швейное дело. Однако чтобы начать новый бизнес Давлатмо необходимо купить швейную машинку. С такими планами она обратилась за кредитом, за счет которого собирается приобрести электронную швейную машинку модели «YAMATA», а также другие швейные принадлежности.  Только Вы можете поддержать Давлатмо и она надеется на Вас. С помощью кредита она будет иметь работу и постоянный доход, что позволит улучшить финансовое положение их семьи.
texts.en:
