Davlatmo lives in the Temurmalik region. She is 49 years old, and she is the mother of 3 children. Her sons are 30 and 20 years old, and they have families. Her daughter is 14 years old. Davlatmo's husband is 51 years old, and he raises livestock for a living. Davlatmo's second daughter-in-law sews women's clothing for a living.

Davlatmo has dreamed of learning the trade of cutting out and sewing women's clothing so that she can start a new business and earn her living. Thanks to her daughter-in-law, she has learned the craft, and now she wants to start her own sewing business. However, to start her own business, Davlatmo needs to buy her own sewing machine.

To carry out these plans, Davlatmo has applied for a loan, with which she will purchase a "Yamata" brand electric sewing machine and other sewing accessories. Only you can support Davlatmo, and she is relying on you. With the help of the loan, she will be able to work and have a steady income, which will allow her to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy a Yamata brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is 48 years old. He is married and has six children. 

His business is farming and livestock trade, and he has been in these businesses for 20 years. 

He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the entire loan to buy more stock of assorted vegetables to sell. He will use the profits from his increased business to pay his children's school fees. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted vegetables to sell

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sell goats. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to have a bigger herd of goats within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a 40-year-old electrical goods dealer in Voi, Kenya. 

He is a father of one. He has been in this business for the last one year and has done well.

This is his second time borrowing to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase assorted electrical goods for his shop.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his child. 

He hopes to own a large shop for electrical appliances in future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted electrical goods for his shop.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Francis' business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Francis will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more meat. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She wants to see all her children go to school and this makes her work hard at her market stall for eight hours a day, where she sells fresh foods.

For five years she has realized that working hard is doing better for her family's standard of living. She dreams of expanding her fresh food selling to big markets, though unpredictable weather changes limit her plans.

Jane is asking for a loan to buy fresh foods like cassava flour and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like cassava flour and groundnuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Richard Agyei

texts.en:
“My name is Richard, pursuing a program in Business Administration at the Maranata University College, the loan is to help pay for my tuition fees”.
My chosen profession is one that is driven by passion and interest. It is a career which is of high demand in the corporate world. After completion I will be able to affect my community and family positively because of its human interest nature.
My wife and mum inspire me most because of their special interest for me to upgrade myself.  It is also born out of the determination to affect my community and environment positively.
In five to ten years, I wish to have become a top class business and corporate executive.
Without this loan I would have perhaps postponed my education or sell personal items to get money to pay for my fees.
 My advice to the world would be to never give up in life because whatever the situation, there is still a God sent opportunity from people such as the ones funding my scheme.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. 

His business is making wood carvings as well as farming, and he has done these for four years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. 

He will use the profits from expanded business to buy manure and additional fertilizer as well as renovate his house. 

His hopes and dreams are to diversify into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is a 28-year-old lady with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer, and has been growing food crops like bananas and tomatoes since 2013; she started with a hope of increasing her income.

She has future prospects of expanding her business and educating all her children to higher levels of learning. She faces challenges of high transport costs, prices and weather changes that destroy her crops.

Moreen needs a loan to pay for labor to weed, mulch and prune her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed, mulch and prune her banana plantation.

loans.name: Yiriwali Group

texts.fr: Seydna Oumar  C’est lui qui porte le chapeau bleu au milieu  sur la photo. Seydna Oumar est un agriculteur âgé de 59 ans. Il vit dans un village au Mali. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants, âgés de 20 à 3 ans dont 4 sont à l’école. Seydna Oumar fait le commerce des chevaux depuis trente  ans. Le commerce  des chevaux lui fait gagner beaucoup d’argent. Il rêve devenir un grand commerçant des équins pour fournir  beaucoup de clients  de son milieu en ces animaux très forts à la charrue et  pour son propre épanouissement. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages loin de chez lui et vend dans les villages environnants de sa localité. Son bénéfice mensuel  prévisionnel s’estime à 80 000FCFA par tête. Les difficultés qu’il rencontre sont généralement la lenteur de l’écoulement.
texts.en:
Seydna Oumar is the one wearing a blue hat in the middle of the photo. He is a farmer, 59 years old, living in a village in Mali. He is a married father of seven children, aged 3 to 20, of whom four are in school.

Seydna Oumar has been doing commerce in horses for thirty years, and it has earned him a lot of money. His dream is to become a major merchant of horses in order to provide many customers in his area very strong animals for plowing and to provide for his own development.

He gets his supplies in the villages not far from home and sells in nearby villages. His projected monthly profit is 80,000 francs CFA per head. The difficulties he encounters are generally slow sales.

loans.use: to purchase horses to resell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia Filomena se dedica al negocio de venta de artefactos como televisores, equipos de sonidos y licuadoras, la socia es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar televisores, equipos de sonido y licuadoras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Filomena, works in selling devices like televisions, sound equipment, and blenders. The borrower is a person who is hardworking and very responsible. Through this business, the borrower is able to provide for her family. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy televisions, sound equipment, and blenders.

The borrower is happy for the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy televisions, sound equipment, and blenders.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter and his family live in a rural home in the Nyanza area of Kenya. He has farmed for many years and shows no sign of stopping. He enjoys it, for it provides his family with a livelihood and source of income. He grows crops and trees and also has a dairy.

Peter's big challenge is a lack of capital to invest in modern tools. He is seeking a 45,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy modern farm equipment and construct a cow shed.

The expected outcome of this loan is an increase in farming efficiency and improved animal health, welfare and productivity. These positive outcomes will uplift Peter’s family's livelihood and elevate their living standards.

loans.use: to buy modern farm equipment and construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара, 60 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии, занимается животноводством и полеводством, на ежедневной основе продет экологически-чистое молоко местным заводам. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 4,0 Га земли выращивает люцерну для реализации.  Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, чтобы инвестировать в свой бизнес и увеличить поголовье. Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность помочь в постройке дома для сына.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 60 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary-level education, and she is now retired and on a pension. She raises animals and grows crops. On a daily basis, she seems organic milk to a local factory. She has 2 cows on her farm, and she grows alfalfa for resale on 4.0 hectares of land. The monthly income from her business is 18,000 som (KGS).

Gulnara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock, so that she can invest in her business and increase the headcount of her herd. She plans to invest her profits in developing her business, so that she will someday be able to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Zhasiyahan

texts.ru: Жасияхан, 60 лет, замужем, счастливая мама 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и помощи супруга и детей по хозяйству, Жасияхан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 17,900 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Жасияхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Zhasiyahan is 60 years old, married, and the happy mother of 3 children. She has a post-secondary education, and she has been raising animals for 5 years as a source of income for her family. Thanks to Zhasyahan's very hard work, and the help of her husband and children around the farm, she now has 2 cows. All of her activities bring in a monthly income of 17,900 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Zhasiyahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Zhasiyahan plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue developing her business, so that she will someday be able to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO.
La socia Juana Maria tiene 51 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometa a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Amanecer 15 de Agosto communal bank.

The borrower, Juana Maria, is 51 years old, has two children, and has a live-in partner. The borrower divides her daily activities, working to cultivate fruit. The borrower enjoys her business, which is going well thanks to the tenacity she shows every day at work. The borrower wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The borrower is grateful for the loan awarded and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco
La socia Nataly continúa dedicándose al negocio de  restaurant, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio de restaurante el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando  diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Amanecer 15 De Agosto” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which belongs to the La Convención province in the department of Cusco.

Nataly continues to work in her restaurant business.  She has been doing this for quite a while now, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day.  She still makes different dishes for the customers who come to her, such as baked chicken, soups, and meat stir-frys, among others.  This is how she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice and oil, among others.

She feels thankful for the loan and is committed to making her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and oil, among others

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de pan y venta de productos de belleza,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia .La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,azucar y leche para preparar pan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Hilda keeps working in her business of making bread and selling beauty products. The member is an enterprising and hardworking woman, who is supporting her family with this business. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar and milk to prepare bread. Hilda is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and milk to make bread.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Three-quarters of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Lucy, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya. She has now been practicing mixed farming for the past three years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

Lucy passionately loves dairy farming and, when asked what is most enjoyable about it, she stated, “Feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. Lucy sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed that will produce between ten and twenty liters of milk a day.

This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase Lucy's business enterprise. Lucy is very visionary and she intends, in the near future, to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling it. She also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, Lucy will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in the south rift area of Kenya. Dairy farming to him is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has had a dairy for years and is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Benard is seeking a 50,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on insurance for the cow as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies.

The impact this loan will have on Benard and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation and an increase in income. His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and insurance for it.

loans.name: Uulbu

texts.ru: Уулбу, 47 лет, вдова, мама 4 детей. Она работает налоговым инспектором в сельской управе, также с 1989 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с суммой в 1,000 сом (KGS), Уулбу сумела развить свой бизнес. В хозяйстве есть 14 коров, 30 овец и лошадь. На 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,42 Га собственной земли Уулбу выращивает ячмень. В целях расширения своей деятельности, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение 2 лошадей. Уулбу планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en:
Uulbu is a 47-year-old widow, and the mother of 4 children. She works as a tax inspector for the village administration. She has also raised animals and grown crops since 1989, which she began doing with the sum of 1,000 som (KGS), and has been able to develop her business since then. She has 14 cows, 30 sheep, and a horse on her farm. On 1.0 hectare of rented land, and 0.42 hectares of her own land, Uulbu grows barley.

In order to expand her activities, Uulbu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 horses. Uulbu plans to use the proceeds from her business to continue increasing her headcount of livestock and to pay for her oldest son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy two horses in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Preah Vihear province, On is 22 years old and a married mother of two dependent children. To make a living, she works as a handicraft to earn income for 4 years. She works for others for a fee to earn additional income as well. Due to having not enough working capital to fulfill her family’s need, so she decides to get a new loan with VisionFund and this is the fourth loan of her. The previous loans, she could afford to buy household supplies to be better support her living condition.

As the group leader of two, she will use her new loan portion to buy a decent latrine so that her family can live in a comfortable environment and avoid infectious diseases. She hopes that all her family members are healthy and they can perform their jobs better than before to earn good income to improve living standard.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine so that her family can live in a comfortable environment and protect her children from infectious diseases.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Hieb's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kratie province, Hieb is 53-year-old and she has two children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. To make a living, she grows cassava as the primary source of her family’s income for 15 years. She can get additional income via working for others for a fee as well. She can earn income about 9USD per day and she is able to save around 2USD each day. The price of cassava is decreasing so she cannot make good income as before and this is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family.

Due to a lack of working capital, she decides to apply for a loan with VisionFund and this is Hieb’s first loan cycle. As the group leader of three, she will use her portion of loan to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees to protect her crop from threatening by insect. She hopes that this first loan will help her to grow her crop healthily that allows her to sell it in a higher price in order to increase her income to save for future need.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being threatened by insects, so her crop will grow healthily

loans.name: Amakamono Group

texts.fr: Aissata Boukary  est la dame qui tient les pagnes traditionnels entre ses mains sur la photo. Elle est une  Malienne, âgée de quarante (40) ans, mariée et mère de six(6) enfants dont  trois(3) sont scolarisés. Son mari est un cultivateur. Aissata Boukary fait l’artisanat (la teinture des pagnes traditionnels) depuis vingt ans. Elle fait recourt auprès RMCR afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et  d’acheter beaucoup de rouleau  de pagne. Elle  fait  ses  achats  et  ses  ventes  dans  les  foire de sa localité . Avec  la teinture  elle  parvient  à  prendre en charge   les petits besoins  de  ses  enfants  et  de  la famille .  Elle est  souvent  confronter  à  des  situations   de méventes  et relève   les défis  avec  des  revendeurs  de sa localité. Dans les jours  à venir, Aissata  Boukary  aimerait  avoir  un prêt  plus élevé  pour  acheter  plus de rouleaux  de pagne  enfin d’avoir plus de profits et s’acheter une machine de teinture propre à elle.
texts.en:
Aissata Boukary is the woman holding traditional ‘pagne’ cloth in the photo. She is a Malian woman, 40 years old, and the married mother of six children, of whom three are in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Aissata Boukary has been an artisan in the dyeing of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for twenty years. She has turned to RMCR to increase her sales and to purchase many rolls of ‘pagne’ cloth. She makes her purchases and sales at the fairs in her town.

Through the dyeing of cloth, she manages to cover the sundry needs of her children and her family. She is often confronted with drops in sales and faces the challenges of retailers in her town.

In the days to come, Aissata Boukary would like to have a bigger loan to purchase more rolls of ‘pagne’ cloth, so as to have more profit and to buy her own machine for dyeing fabrics.

loans.use: to sell traditional 'pagne' cloth.

loans.name: Taeseer

texts.en:
Taeseer is a 42-year-old, Married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Taeseer has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Taeseer took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is in her early 50s and is married with three children who are grown up. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 08am to 04pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, built her house, bought a TV set, a radio and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store. She dreams of expanding her business into a Hotel.

Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group Kibondo which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el ngeocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Erika continues work with her business buying and selling clothing. She is a hard-working woman who through her work wants to get her family ahead. The members' dream is to expand her business. She is requesting the loan to buy pants, blouses and sweaters.

Erika is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and sweaters.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in the south rift area of Kenya. Dairy farming to him is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has had a dairy for years and is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Charles is seeking a 30,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on insurance for the cow as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies.

The impact this loan will have on Charles and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation and an increase in income. His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and insurance on it.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a sari-sari store owner.  He is 64 years old man and a resident of Calape, Bohol. He is married and has five children. Two of these children are still school aged children ages 19 and 17 years old. Francisco has been running his sari-sari store business for almost 30 years. Thus, he is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as spices, soft drinks, canned goods, chips, biscuits, candies, toiletries, laundry soap, and a sack of rice. In the future, he wishes to improve his business and to send all his children in college and finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy spices, soft drinks, canned goods, chips, biscuits, candies, toiletries, laundry soap, and a sack of rice

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a smallholder farmer from Kitale, Kenya, who very much loves cattle! He's been a dairy farmer for many years and his main source of income is milk.

George is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies. The impact this loan will have on George's family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation and increase in income. George's ultimate goal is to elevate his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chart's Group

texts.en:
Chart resides in Battambang province and she is 51 years old. This married woman has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Earning around USD20 per day and saving about USD7 each day, she and her husband are growing rice for the main source of income and they sometimes work for others for fees to supplement income. They have been involved in their farming business for years. The obstacle to her farming business is lack of working capital.
In a group of two members, she is the group leader and this is the third time for her with VisionFund. Chart’s past loans have enabled her to provide her family with enough food and hygienic shelter. Chart will use her loan to support cassava farming business through paying for land preparation and labors fees and purchasing cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost the crop yields. She hopes she can upgrade the standard of living and better support her children’s studying until they finish school.

loans.use: to support her cassava farming business through paying for land preparation and labors fees and purchasing cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost the crop yields.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost her vegetable growing by buying farm inputs.

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
Chhen, 43, the farmer living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of two children. Nowadays, she grows rice to support her family’s living for 25 years and works for others for a fee to get additional income. She can make income about 12USD per day. Destroying by insects, her crop could not produce high yield as before.

For Chhen, she has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she repaid the past loan which enabled her to improve her living condition than before. This second loan, she will manage it to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good outputs. She hopes to get more yields to earn more income so that she can save for health care service of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs so that she can earn more income to save for health care service of her children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Autonomia Group

texts.es:
Arcenia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, decidida y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista’ área central que aglomera a edificios públicos y privados.
Arcenia es morena, de cabello negro y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (la primera de la izquierda viste calza roja). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como;  venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de medicinas naturales, confección de tejidos, artesanía en cuero, venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras y frutería. Su negocio es la venta de comida como la ‘patasca’ que es un caldo que se prepara con mote y la cabeza del cerdo, es muy popular y muy sustanciosa, nutritiva y con una gran concentración de sabores debido a los ingredientes que lleva, “sólo cocino patasca porque es una comida tradicional que muchos acostumbran a comer para curar la resaca…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como maíz, carne, y otros. Su sueño es ser elegida por los clientes de la zona, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Arcenia solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para cocinar patasca.
texts.en:
Arcenia is a 37-year-old woman. She is single, has two children ages 10 and 13, and her business is selling food.

She is a good mother, dedicated, and very determined. Her business is set in the Mutualista zone, a central area where public and private buildings are clumped together.

Arcenia is dark-skinned with black hair and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She is the first on the left, seen in the red pants. She shares her live with her children, who go to school. They live in their own house made of wood, which has basic utilities. The need to improve her business brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as: the sale of secondhand clothing, the sale of natural medicine, dressmaking, artisanal leather, grocery sales, and fruit and vegetable sales.

Her business is the sale of food such as "patasca", which is a soup prepared with boiled corn and pig's head. It is very popular and very sustaining, nutritious, and with a large concentration of flavors, given its ingredients.

"I only cook patasca because it is a traditional food that many people ar accustomed to eating to cure hangovers…” she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy the ingredients, such as corn, meat, and others. Her dream is to be chosen by customers in the area. She wishes to buy ingredients to stock her business.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the three years she has worked at this endeavor.

For these reasons, Arcenia is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to cook patasca.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook patasca [a highly nutritious beef and sheep soup].

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to work in her grocery store and restaurant business. This borrower is a hardworking person who provides for her family through this business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

Rosa is happy about this loan, and she is committed to making the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, who is 29 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps dairy animals and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Emily makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Emily can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce.

She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Emily’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. The work this mother does to survive with her loved ones is commendably dignified, and it is worthwhile to provide her the benefit of the support she needs

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Angelica se sigue dedicando  al negocio de venta de comida por las noches, la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angelica continues to work in her food sales business in the evenings. This borrower is a hardworking person who supports her family through this business. Her dream is to expand her food sales business.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy about this loan, and she is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Kenyenya village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income.
Isabellah is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. Through your loan investment, her cattle will be sheltered againast harsh weather conditions such as extreme heat from the sun. The other advantage of having a cowshed is that it allows for an easier management of the herd, in terms of feeding and movement. This intervention will result in improved health and dairy management, both keys to having a highly productive dairy farm. 
Income resulting from this intervention will be used by Isabellah to clear loan repayments and meet her family’s basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in the South Rift area of Kenya. Dairy farming to Peter is not only a source of income, but also a livelihood. He has dedicated a significant portion of his farm's real estate for grazing. To better utilize the available pasture and make more income, Peter has been planning to acquire an additional dairy cow.

Peter is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies. The impact this loan will have on Peter and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation and increase in income. Peter's ultimate goal is to elevate his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a rural smallholder farmer from North Rift Kenya. She keeps livestock to earn a living. Her work brings home an important source of income. The increasing household expenses forced Gladys to start thinking of how to grow her business and generate more income.  
Gladys applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm by adding another cow to the herd. Even though she lacks the capital to do that, she is planning to take out a dairy loan and use the income from the additional milk produced and sold to service the loan. 
The impact of this loan investment to Gladys and the members of her family is improved food security, improved income and eventually, wider asset base

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes, caramelos,chicles y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ernestina makes a living selling sweets. She is very hardworking and she takes care of her family via this business. Her dream is to grow her sweet-selling business. She is requesting the loan to buy lollipops, sweets, gum, and cookies.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, candies, gum, and cookies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia. Juan está muy contento con su préstamo porque gracias a ello pudo realizar la inversión que tanta falta le hacía a su negocio, a  Dios gracias logro comprar su materia prima para la elaboración de diferentes artículos típicas y a sus clientes logro satisfacer. Juan con este gran avance ha considerado necesario volver a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más hilos de diferentes tipos y colores para seguir elaborando sus atuendos típicos.  Pues por ser uno de los mejores artesanos de su pueblo su trabajo es muy codiciado y frecuentemente buscado. Juan tiene las esperanzas puestas en el préstamo para seguir mejorando sus ingresos y también sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a 55 year old man, married, with a beautiful family. Juan is very happy with his previous loan because thanks to it he could perform some investments that were badly needed for his business. He gives thanks to God that he managed to buy his raw materials for the production of different traditional items, and that his customers were satisfied.

With this breakthrough, Juan has considered it necessary to again apply for a loan to purchase more thread, of different types and colors, to further develop his traditional garments. And as he is one of the best craftsmen of his town, his work is well known and highly sought after. Juan has his hopes set on this loan to further improve his income and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread.
